hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין לַעֲבוֹר עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה, וְהָלַךְ הַיָּחִיד וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג עַל פִּיהֶם, בֵּין שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה עִמָּהֶן, בֵּין שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה אַחֲרֵיהֶן, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה – פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁתָּלָה בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: a court issued a ruling to violate one of all the mitzvot that are stated in the Torah, and an individual proceeded and performed unwittingly on the basis of whether performed and he performed with them, whether performed and he performed after them, whether did not perform and he performed exempt due to that he associated with court.
llm_translation: They taught: The court instructed to transgress one of all the commandments stated in the Torah, and an individual went and unintentionally transgressed according to their ruling, whether they acted and he acted with them, whether they acted and he acted after them, whether they did not act and he acted - he is exempt, because he relied on the court.

hebrew_text: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין, וְיָדַע אֶחָד מֵהֶן שֶׁטָּעוּ, אוֹ תַּלְמִיד וְהוּא רָאוּי לְהוֹרָאָה, וְהָלַךְ וְעָשָׂה עַל פִּיהֶן – בֵּין שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה עִמָּהֶן, בֵּין שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה אַחֲרֵיהֶן, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה – הֲרֵי זֶה חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא תָּלָה בְּבֵית דִּין. זֶה הַכְּלָל: הַתּוֹלֶה בְּעַצְמוֹ חַיָּיב, וְהַתּוֹלֶה בְּבֵית דִּין – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: court issued a ruling and one of knew that they erred, or a student and he qualified to issue rulings, and proceeded and performed on the basis of its whether performed and he performed with them, whether performed and he performed after them, whether did not perform and he performed is liable due to that he did not associate with court. This is the principle: One who associates with himself liable, and one who associates with court exempt.
llm_translation: They instructed the court, and one of them knew that they erred, or a student who is fit to teach, and he went and acted according to their ruling - whether they acted and he acted with them, whether they acted and he acted after them, whether they did not act and he acted - he is liable, because he did not rely on the court. This is the principle: one who relies on himself is liable, and one who relies on the court is exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְעוֹלָם אֵין בֵּית דִּין חַיָּיבִין עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לָהֶם ״מוּתָּרִין אַתֶּם״. רַב דִּימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא אָמַר: עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לָהֶם ״מוּתָּרִין אַתֶּם לַעֲשׂוֹת״. מַאי טַעְמָא? לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִגְמְרָה הוֹרָאָה.
human_translation: Shmuel says: court are never liable until they say to It is permitted for you. Rav Dimi from Neharde’a says: unless they say to It is permitted for you to perform What is the reason due to that the ruling is not completed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: Always not court obligated until they say to them "permitted you." Rav Dimi from Nehardea said: until they say to them "permitted you to do." What reason? Because not finished instruction.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: חָזַר לְעִירוֹ שָׁנָה וְלִימֵּד כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁלִּימֵּד – פָּטוּר, הוֹרָה לַעֲשׂוֹת – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Abaye said: We learn as well. returned to his city, he taught in the manner that he was teaching exempt instructed to act liable
llm_translation: Abaye said, "We also learned: If one returned to his city after a year and taught in the same manner as he had been taught - he is exempt; if he taught to act - he is liable."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: הוֹרוּ לָהּ בֵּית דִּין לְהִנָּשֵׂא, וְהָלְכָה וְקִלְקְלָה – חַיֶּיבֶת בְּקׇרְבָּן, שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּירוּ לָהּ אֶלָּא לְהִנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: We learn as well. court instructed to marry but she proceeded and disgraced liable to an offering, as they permitted her only to marry,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said, "We also learned: If the court instructed her to marry, and she went and caused damage - she is liable for a sacrifice, for they only permitted her to marry."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין לַעֲבוֹר עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה״, תּוּ לָא מִידִּי.
human_translation: Ravina said: We learn as well: a court issued a ruling to violate one of all the mitzvot that are stated in the Torah, nothing more
llm_translation: Ravina said, "We also learned: 'The court should instruct to transgress one of all the commandments stated in the Torah,' but not from me."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין בֵּית דִּין חַיָּיבִין עַד שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ לָהֶם ״מוּתָּרִים אַתֶּם לַעֲשׂוֹת״. רַב דִּימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ ״מוּתָּרִים אַתֶּם״ – נִגְמְרָה הוֹרָאָה. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, וְהָא לָא תְּנַן הָכִי: חָזַר לְעִירוֹ, וְשָׁנָה אוֹ לִימֵּד כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁלִּימֵּד – פָּטוּר, הוֹרָה לַעֲשׂוֹת – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Some say Shmuel says: court are not liable until they say to It is permitted for you to perform Rav Dimi from Neharde’a says: Even It is permitted for you, ruling is completed Abaye said: But isn’t we did not learn returned to his city, and he taught in the manner that he was teaching exempt instructed to act liable
llm_translation: There are some who say, Shmuel said: A court is not liable until they are told, "You are permitted to do it." Rav Dimi from Nehardea said: Even if they are told, "You are permitted to do it," the instruction is complete. Abaye said, but did we not learn thus: If he returned to his city and repeated or taught as he was taught - he is exempt; if he instructed to do - he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא, וְהָא לָא תְּנַן הָכִי: הוֹרוּ לָהּ בֵּית דִּין לְהִנָּשֵׂא, וְהָלְכָה וְקִלְקְלָה – חַיֶּיבֶת בְּקׇרְבָּן, שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּירוּ לָהּ אֶלָּא לְהִנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: But isn’t we did not learn court instructed to marry but she proceeded and disgraced liable to an offering, as they permitted her only to marry,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said, and did we not learn thus: If the court instructed her to marry, and she went and caused damage - she is liable for a sacrifice, for they only permitted her to marry.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, וְהָא לָא תְּנַן הָכִי: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין לַעֲבוֹר עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה, תּוּ לָא מִידִּי.
human_translation: Ravina said: But isn’t we did not learn a court issued a ruling to violate one of all the mitzvot that are stated in the Torah, nothing more
llm_translation: Ravina said, but did we not learn thus: The court may instruct to transgress any one of all the commandments stated in the Torah, except for idolatry, sexual immorality, and bloodshed.

hebrew_text: וְהָלַךְ הַיָּחִיד וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג עַל פִּיהֶם. וְנִיתְנֵי: ״וְעָשָׂה עַל פִּיהֶם״, ״שׁוֹגֵג״ לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רָבָא: ״שׁוֹגֵג״ – לְאֵתוֹיֵי הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁחֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְנִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ חֵלֶב בְּשׁוּמָּן, וַאֲכָלוֹ – פָּטוּר. ״עַל פִּיהֶם״ – עַל פִּיהֶם מַמָּשׁ,
human_translation: And the individual proceeded and performed unwittingly on the basis of And let us teach And performed on the basis of why do I Unwittingly? Rava said: unwittingly to include the court issued a ruling that permitted fat, and fat became confused for him with fat, and he ate it exempt. On the basis of actually on the basis of
llm_translation: The individual went and unintentionally acted according to their words. And it is taught: "And he acted according to their words," why do I need "unintentionally"? Rava said: "Unintentionally" – to include a case where the court ruled that fat is permissible, and it was mistakenly replaced with oil, and he ate it – he is exempt. "According to their words" – literally according to their words.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: ״שׁוֹגֵג״ – עַל פִּיהֶם הוּא דְּפָטוּר, אֲבָל נִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ חֵלֶב בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And some say Rava said It is unwittingly on the basis of that exempt. But fat became confused for him with fat and he ate it liable
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rava said: "Shogeg" - according to their words he is exempt, but if he mistakenly switched its fat with its oil and ate it - he is liable.

hebrew_text: מִילְּתָא דִּפְשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ לְרָבָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְרָמִי בַּר חָמָא, דִּבְעַי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁחֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְנִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ, מַהוּ?
human_translation: The matter that obvious to Rava, was raised as a dilemma for Rami bar Ḥama, as Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma: a court ruled that fat is permitted, and became confused for him with fat and he ate what is
llm_translation: The matter that is clear to Rava, he asked Rami bar Hama to ask: Rami bar Hama asked: If the court ruled that fat is permitted, and it was exchanged for oil and he ate it, what is the law?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: הָלַךְ יָחִיד וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג עַל פִּיהֶם כּוּ׳. שׁוֹגֵג עַל פִּיהֶם לְמָה לִי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁחֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְנִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ חֵלֶב בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ – פָּטוּר. דִּלְמָא שׁוֹגֵג עַל פִּיהֶם הוּא דְּפָטוּר, אֲבָל נִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ חֵלֶב בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear individual proceeded and performed unwittingly on the basis of etc. Why do I Unwittingly on the basis of not to include court issued a ruling that permitted fat, and fat became confused for him with fat, and he ate it exempt? Perhaps It is unwittingly on the basis of its that exempt; but fat became confused for him with fat, and he ate liable.
llm_translation: Rava said, "Come and hear: If an individual went and inadvertently violated a prohibition according to their the Sages' ruling - he is exempt. Why am I exempt if he inadvertently violated a prohibition according to their the Sages' ruling? Because it is not for the purpose of the court's directives that fat is permitted, and if it was exchanged for oil and he ate it - he is exempt. Perhaps this is because he inadvertently violated a prohibition according to their the Sages' ruling, he is exempt, but if it was exchanged for oil and he ate it - he is liable."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: הָלַךְ יָחִיד וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג עַל פִּיהֶם. מַאי לָאו, שׁוֹגֵג עַל פִּיהֶם הוּא דְּפָטוּר, אֲבָל נִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ חֵלֶב בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ – חַיָּיב. דִּלְמָא: אוֹ שׁוֹגֵג, אוֹ עַל פִּיהֶם.
human_translation: Some say Rava said: Come hear individual proceeded and performed unwittingly on the basis of What, is it not unwittingly on the basis of its that exempt; but fat became confused for him with fat, and he ate liable? Perhaps either unwittingly, or on the basis of
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rava said, come and hear: If an individual went and unintentionally violated their words. What is the reason? Unintentionally violating their words exempts him, but if he mistakenly switched out fat for oil and ate it - he is liable. Perhaps: Either unintentionally, or according to their words.

hebrew_text: בִּפְלוּגְתָּא: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁחֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְנִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ חֵלֶב בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ – רַב אָמַר: פָּטוּר, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: חַיָּיב. מֵיתִיבִי: ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ בַּעֲשֹׂתָהּ״, פְּרָט לִמְשׁוּמָּד.
human_translation: in the dispute a court ruled that fat is permitted, and fat became confused for him with fat and he ate Rav says: exempt, and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: liable, raises an objection from among the common people in performing to exclude an apostate.
llm_translation: In the case of a dispute: if the court ruled that fat is permissible, and it was switched with oil and he ate it - Rav said: he is exempt, and Rabbi Yochanan said: he is liable. A contradiction was raised: "from the common people in their doing," excluding intentional acts.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֵעָשֶׂינָה בִּשְׁגָגָה וְאָשֵׁם אוֹ הוֹדַע״ – הַשָּׁב מִידִיעָתוֹ, מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ. לֹא שָׁב מִידִיעָתוֹ – אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: It is unnecessary as it says unwittingly that are not to be done, and he is guilty; or be known one who repents due to his awareness, brings a sacrifice for his unwitting not repent due to his awareness does not bring an offering for his unwitting
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yosei says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: It is not necessary, as he says: "Which he did not do unintentionally, and is guilty, or he is informed" - if he repents immediately upon his knowledge, he brings a sacrifice for his unintentional sin. If he does not repent immediately upon his knowledge, he does not bring a sacrifice for his unintentional sin.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא, הָא לֹא שָׁב מִידִיעָתוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: And if it is so isn’t not repent due to his awareness?
llm_translation: And if it is stated, this is not one who has returned from his knowledge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, קָסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כֵּיוָן דְּכִי מִתְיְדַע לְהוּ לְבֵי דִינָא, הָדְרִי בְּהוּ, וְהוּא נָמֵי הָדַר בֵּיהּ – שָׁב מִידִיעָתוֹ קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ, וְחַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Rabbi Yoḥanan holds: Since once it becomes known to the court retract their and also repent we characterize him one who repents due to his awareness, and he is liable
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, Rabbi Yochanan holds: Once he has made himself known to the court, he may retract, and he too may retract - as soon as he is known to them, we read it in him, and he is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מוֹדֶה רַב שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַשְׁלִים לְרוֹב צִבּוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בִּשְׁגָגָה״ – עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ כּוּלָּן בִּשְׁגָגָה אֶחָת.
human_translation: Rava says: Rav concedes that he does not complete a majority of the congregation. What is the reason? the verse states: unwittingly” unless they are all unwitting one
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav concedes that one does not join with the majority of the congregation. What is the reason? The verse says: "Unintentionally" - until they are all unintentional together.

hebrew_text: בֵּין שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה עִמָּהֶן כּוּ׳. לְמָה לֵיהּ לְמִיתְנָא כׇּל הָנֵי? בִּשְׁלָמָא רֵישָׁא – לֹא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא סֵיפָא דִּלְחִיּוּבָא, אִיפְּכָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Whether performed and he performed with them, Why did teach all these Granted, the first clause teaches Not this also that, But the latter clause where liability, should have the opposite.
llm_translation: Between those who did and those who did not do with them. Why does it need to teach all of these? The beginning - this one not this one it teaches. But the end regarding obligation, the opposite it should have taught!

hebrew_text: זוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: teaches This, and it is unnecessary to say that,
llm_translation: This and not need to say this it is taught.

hebrew_text: וְיָדַע אֶחָד מֵהֶן שֶׁטָּעוּ אוֹ תַּלְמִיד וְרָאוּי לְהוֹרָאָה. תַּרְתֵּי לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רָבָא: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי גְּמִיר וּסְבִיר, אֲבָל גְּמִיר וְלָא סְבִיר – לָא.
human_translation: And one of knew that they erred, or a student and qualified to issue rulings. Why do I two Rava said: It was necessary enter your mind to say this statement learned and analytical, but learned but not analytical, no,
llm_translation: One of them should know that they made a mistake or a student who is fit to teach. Two, why do I need them? Rava said: It is necessary, for your mind might think that those matters which are learned and understood are acceptable, but if they are learned without being understood - no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְהוֹרָאָה גְּמִיר וּסְבִיר מַשְׁמַע! אֲמַר לֵיהּ, אֲנָא הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא: אִי מֵהַהִיא – הֲוָה אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי גְּמִיר וּסְבִיר, אֲבָל גְּמִיר וְלָא סְבִיר – לָא, תְּנָא רָאוּי לְהוֹרָאָה, מִמִּשְׁנָה יְתֵירָה: אֲפִילּוּ גְּמִיר וְלָא סְבִיר, סְבִיר וְלָא גְּמִיר.
human_translation: Abaye said to to issue rulings, indicates learned and analytical. said to This I am saying: If from that I would say this statement learned and analytical, but learned and not analytical, no, taught qualified to issue rulings, from extraneous mishna even learned but not analytical analytical but not learned.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: For teaching, learning and understanding! He said to him, I am saying this: If from that - I would have said these matters are learned and understood, but learned and not understood - no, a Tanna fit for teaching, from the Mishnah extra: Even if learned and not understood, understood and not learned.

hebrew_text: רָאוּי לְהוֹרָאָה וְכוּ׳. כְּגוֹן מַאן? אָמַר רָבָא: כְּגוֹן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי וְשִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן זוֹמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא מֵזִיד הוּא!
human_translation: Qualified to issue rulings. Like whom? Rava said: like Shimon ben Azzai or Shimon ben Zoma, Abaye said to a case like this, he is an intentional
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Fit for teaching, etc." Who is an example? Rava said: Such as Shimon ben Azzai and Shimon ben Zoma. Abaye said to him: This type is intentional!

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּתַנְיָא: ״בַּעֲשֹׂתָהּ אַחַת״, יָחִיד הָעוֹשֶׂה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיב, בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר. כֵּיצַד? הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁחֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְנוֹדַע לְאֶחָד מֵהֶן שֶׁטָּעוּ, אוֹ תַּלְמִיד יוֹשֵׁב לִפְנֵיהֶן וְרָאוּי לְהוֹרָאָה כְּגוֹן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי, יָכוֹל יְהֵא פָּטוּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּעֲשֹׂתָהּ אַחַת״, יָחִיד הָעוֹשֶׂה עַל פִּי עַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיב, בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר!
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, that which is taught “In performing one” an individual who performs on his own is liable, on the ruling of court is exempt; how court ruled that fat is permitted, and it became known to one of that they erred, or a student sitting before them and he is qualified to issue rulings, e.g., Shimon ben Azzai, might he would be exempt? the verse states: “In performing one,” an individual who performs on his own is liable, on the ruling of court is exempt.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to your reasoning, as it was taught: "When he does it alone," one who does it of his own accord - is liable; if by the ruling of the court - he is exempt. How so? If the court ruled that fat is permissible, and it became known to one of them that they erred, or a disciple sitting before them who is fit to teach, such as Shimon ben Azzai, is it possible that he should be exempt? The verse teaches: "When he does it alone," one who does it of his own accord - is liable; if by the ruling of the court - he is exempt!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? כְּגוֹן דְּיָדַע דְּאָסוּר, וְקָא טָעֵי בְּמִצְוָה לִשְׁמוֹעַ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. לְדִידִי נָמֵי, דְּטָעוּ בְּמִצְוָה לִשְׁמוֹעַ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: Rather, how can you find these where knew that prohibited, but he erred with regard to the mitzva of heeding the statements of the Sages. according to my too, where they erred with regard to the mitzva of heeding the statements of the Sages.
llm_translation: Rather, how does she find it? For example, she knows that it is forbidden, yet she is engaging in a mitzvah to hear the words of the sages. According to my opinion as well, they are engaging in a mitzvah to hear the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל הַתּוֹלֶה בְּעַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיב. לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מְבַעֵט בְּהוֹרָאָה.
human_translation: This is the principle: One who associates with himself is liable. What to include? to include disdains rulings
llm_translation: This is the principle that depends on itself - liable. For what purpose? To teach that one can challenge a ruling.

hebrew_text: תּוֹלֶה בְּבֵית דִּין – לְאֵיתוֹיֵי הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְיָדְעוּ שֶׁטָּעוּ וְחָזְרוּ בָּהֶן. הָא בְּהֶדְיָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ! תָּנֵי וַהֲדַר מְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: one who associates with court to include court issued a ruling and discovered that they erred and reversed their teaches this explicitly teaches it and then teaches it explicitly.
llm_translation: Hanging in the court - for the purpose of the court to see and know that they erred and reconsidered. Here, it is taught in a Baraita! Teach and then explain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָחִיד שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – חַיָּיב. מַאי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דְּתַנְיָא: ״אִם נֶפֶשׁ אַחַת תֶּחֱטָא בִשְׁגָגָה בַּעֲשֹׂתָהּ״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִעוּטִין: הָעוֹשֶׂה מִפִּי עַצְמוֹ – חַיָּיב, בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: This the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. But the Rabbis say: An individual who performs on the ruling of court liable. What Rabbi Yehuda as it is taught if one soul shall sin unwittingly in performing These are three exclusionary one who performs on his own liable, on the ruling of court exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah, but the sages say: An individual who performs an act based on the ruling of the court - is liable. What is Rabbi Yehudah's reasoning? As it was taught: "If one person sins unintentionally by doing any of the things" - these are the three exceptions: one who acts on his own accord - is liable, one who acts based on the ruling of the court - is exempt.

hebrew_text: מַאי רַבָּנַן? דְּתַנְיָא, עֲדַיִין אֲנִי אוֹמֵר: מִיעוּט קָהָל שֶׁחָטְאוּ – חַיָּיבִין, שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶן פַּר. רוֹב קָהָל שֶׁחָטְאוּ – יְהוּ פְּטוּרִין, שֶׁהֲרֵי בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶם פַּר. תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״ – אֲפִילּוּ רוּבָּהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: What the Rabbis? as it is taught Still I say: a minority of the congregation that sinned liable as court does not bring a bull on the basis of a majority of congregation that sinned would be exempt as court brings a bull on the basis of the verse states “From among the common people,” even the majority of and even the entire
llm_translation: What do the Rabbis say? For it was taught: I still say: If a minority of the congregation sinned - they are liable, for the court does not bring a bull on their behalf. If the majority of the congregation sinned - they are exempt, for the court brings a bull on their behalf. The Talmud says: "From the people of the land" - even if the majority, and even if all of them.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי? אִילֵּימָא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה [בֵּית דִּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּהוֹרָאָה], בֵּית דִּין מַאי עֲבִידְתַּיְיהוּ? שֶׁלֹּא בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין, בֵּית דִּין מִי מַיְיתוּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּהוֹרָאָה? אֶלָּא בְּהוֹרָאָה. וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיב ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״ – בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה הוּא דִּכְתִיב!
human_translation: In what If we say with unwitting an action a court not a ruling, what action did court not on the ruling of court, does court bring not on ruling? Rather, on ruling But when it is written “From among the common people,” with regard to with unwitting of an action that it is written.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what? Perhaps with unintentional action by a court not in a ruling capacity, what does the court do? Not with the ruling of the court, who brings it not with the ruling? Rather with the ruling. And it is as it is written "from the people of the land" - it is with unintentional action that it is written!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִיעוּט קָהָל שֶׁחָטְאוּ בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה חַיָּיבִין, שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶן פַּר בְּהוֹרָאָה. הָא הֵן חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: Rather, is it not this is saying: a minority of the congregation that sinned with unwitting of an action liable as court does not bring a bull on the basis of in ruling. But liable.
llm_translation: Rather, this is what he is saying: A small congregation that sinned unintentionally in a matter are liable, for the court does not bring a calf for them as a sin offering. Indeed, they are liable.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל רוֹב צִבּוּר שֶׁעָשׂוּ בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה יְהוּ פְּטוּרִין, שֶׁהֲרֵי בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין עֲלֵיהֶם פַּר [בְּהוֹרָאָה]? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״, אֲפִילּוּ רוּבּוֹ.
human_translation: might a majority of the congregation that with unwitting of an action would be exempt, as court brings a bull on the basis of in ruling. the verse states: “From among the common people,” even the majority of
llm_translation: One might have thought that the majority of the congregation who acted unintentionally in a matter are exempt, for the court brings upon them a bull for a ruling? The Scripture teaches: "From the people of the land," even if the majority.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא לֹא הֵן וְלֹא בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: From where Perhaps neither do those nor does court
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: From where? Perhaps not yes and not court!

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא דְּקָמְהַדַּר עַל רוּבָּא לְחִיּוּבָא? לָאו מִכְּלָל דְּמִיעוּט בְּהוֹרָאָה קַיְימָא לֵיהּ דְּמִיחַיְּיבוּ בְּהוֹרָאָה?! וּנְהַדַּר בְּרֵישָׁא עַל מִיעוּטָא דְּמִיחַיַּיב בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה, וּלְבַסּוֹף נִיהַדַּר עַל רוּבָּא לְחִיּוּבָא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: If so, why specifically seek the majority for liability? not, by inference, a minority on ruling he holds that they are liable on ruling let first seek about a minority that liable for unwitting of an action, and ultimately seek about a majority to liability for unwitting of an action,
llm_translation: If so, what is the meaning that he is initially obligated for the majority? Is it not from the inference that a minority in teaching establishes him as obligated in teaching?! And initially he is established on the basis of the minority that obligates in unintentional action, and ultimately he is established for the majority in unintentional action!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו מִדְּלָא מְהַדַּר עַל מִיעוּט דְּמִיחַיְּיבִין בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה, וּבְסוֹף מְהַדַּר עַל רוּבָּא לְחִיּוּבָא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מִיעוּט בְּהוֹרָאָה חַיָּיבִין – הֵן כִּשְׂבָּה וּשְׂעִירָה, וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּהוֹרָאָה – בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: Rather, not from that did not seek about a minority that liable for unwitting of an action and then about a majority to liability for unwitting an action? conclude from it a minority on ruling liable a female lamb or a female goat and for unwitting of an action not on ruling liable.
llm_translation: Rather, no, from that which he emphasizes on the minority that they are liable for unintentional action, and in the end he emphasizes on the majority for liability in unintentional action. Learn from it: for a minority in teaching they are liable - such as a ewe and a he-goat, and not in teaching - they are liable for unintentional action.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ סְתָמֵי תְּנַן, מִמַּאי דְּקַמַּיְיתָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וּבָתְרָיְיתָא רַבָּנַן? אֵימָא אִיפְּכָא! מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּדָרֵישׁ מִיעוּטֵי כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Now, we learned both of unattributed. From where that the first Rabbi Yehuda and the latter the Rabbis? Say the opposite. Whom did you hear that interprets exclusionary in this way? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says:
llm_translation: From the fact that we learned in a Mishnah, what is the reason that Rabbi Yehuda is mentioned first and the Rabbis afterward? Say, perhaps it should be reversed! Who heard that he expounds on minor points like this case? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says:

hebrew_text: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הָעוֹלָה הִיא״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה מִיעוּטִין.
human_translation: “This is the law of the burnt-offering, it is these are three exclusionary
llm_translation: "This is the law of the burnt offering" - behold, these are three limitations.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: עֲדַיִין אֲנִי אוֹמֵר לָא מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּקָתָנֵי: רוֹב קָהָל שֶׁחָטְאוּ – בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶן פַּר, וְאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָאָמַר: צִבּוּר הוּא דְּמַיְיתֵי, בֵּית דִּין – לָא. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה שְׁבָטִים שֶׁחָטְאוּ – מְבִיאִין שִׁבְעָה פָּרִים.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Still I say. You cannot interpret in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, as teaches: a majority of the congregation that sinned court brings a bull on the basis of their And if Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say: It is the congregation that brings not the court? As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: Seven tribes that sinned bring seven bulls.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: I still say it is not found established for her like Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught: If the majority of the congregation sinned - the court brings a bull on their behalf, but if Rabbi Yehuda says: It is the community that brings, not the court. For we learned, Rabbi Yehuda says: If seven tribes sinned - they bring seven bulls.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָחִיד שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – חַיָּיב. מַאי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וּמַאי רַבָּנַן? דְּתַנְיָא: הוֹרוּ וְעָשׂוּ – רַבִּי מֵאִיר פּוֹטֵר, וַחֲכָמִים מְחַיְּיבִין.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman Shmuel says: is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis say: An individual who performed on the ruling of court liable. What Rabbi Meir and what the Rabbis as it is taught issued a ruling and performed Rabbi Meir deems exempt and the Rabbis deem liable.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: These are the words of Rabbi Meir, but the sages say: an individual who acts according to the ruling of the court - is liable. What is the opinion of Rabbi Meir and what is the opinion of the sages? As it was taught: "They instructed and they did" - Rabbi Meir exempts, and the sages obligate.

hebrew_text: מַאן עָשׂוּ? אִילֵּימָא בֵּית דִּין, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן דִּמְחַיְּיבִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְעָשׂוּ בֵּית דִּין, יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַקָּהָל וְעָשׂוּ״, מַעֲשֶׂה תָּלוּי בַּקָּהָל וְהוֹרָאָה תְּלוּיָה בְּבֵית דִּין!
human_translation: Who performed If we say court what is the reasoning of the Rabbis, who deem liable? But isn’t it taught might court issued a ruling and court performed might they be liable The verse states the congregation and they performed” action is dependent on the congregation and ruling is dependent on court.
llm_translation: Who did it? If you say the court, what is the reason that the Rabbis obligated? And it was taught: Can the court instruct and the court do, can they be liable? The Talmud teaches: "The congregation shall do," the action depends on the congregation, and the instruction depends on the court!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְעָשׂוּ רוֹב קָהָל. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּפוֹטֵר? אֶלָּא לָאו: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְעָשׂוּ מִיעוּט קָהָל, וּבְהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: יָחִיד שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר, וּמַר סָבַר: יָחִיד שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rather, court issued a ruling and the majority of the congregation performed what is the reasoning of Rabbi Meir, who deems exempt? Rather, is it not court issued a ruling and a minority of the congregation performed and with regard to this disagree: Sage, holds: An individual who performed on the ruling of court exempt; and Sage, holds: An individual who performed on a ruling of court liable.
llm_translation: Rather, the court instructed and the majority of the congregation acted. What is the reason for Rabbi Meir who exempts? Rather, is it not: the court instructed and the minority of the congregation acted, and in this case they disagreed. One Master holds: an individual who acted based on the instruction of the court - is exempt, and the other Master holds: an individual who acted based on the instruction of the court - is liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יָחִיד שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין – פָּטוּר, אֶלָּא בֵּית דִּין מַשְׁלִים לְרוֹב צִבּוּר קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: everyone agrees an individual who performed on the ruling of court exempt. Rather, disagree court complete a majority of congregation.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In all the world, an individual who acts in accordance with the ruling of the court is exempt, but the court compensates the majority of the public.

hebrew_text: מָר סָבַר: בֵּית דִּין מַשְׁלִים לְרוֹב צִבּוּר, וּמַר סָבַר: אֵין בֵּית דִּין מַשְׁלִים לְרוֹב צִבּוּר.
human_translation: Sage, holds: the court complete a majority of congregation. And Sage, holds: court do not complete a majority of congregation;
llm_translation: Master says: the court pays the majority of the public, and Master says: the court does not pay the majority of the public.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְעָשׂוּ רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל, וּמַאן חֲכָמִים – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: צִבּוּר מַיְיתֵי וּבֵית דִּין מַיְיתִי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say court issued a ruling and a majority of the congregation performed And who are the Rabbis It is Rabbi Shimon, who said: congregation brings and court brings
llm_translation: And if you will say: Let the court instruct and the majority of the congregation act, and who are the sages? - it is Rabbi Shimon, as he said: The community brings the offering and the court brings the offering.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: שֵׁבֶט שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּינוֹ, וּמַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: שֵׁבֶט שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּינוֹ, אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And if you wish, say a tribe that performed on the ruling of its court. And who are the Rabbis It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught a tribe that performed on a ruling of its court, that tribe liable.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: A tribe that acted based on the ruling of its court, and who are the sages? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: A tribe that acted based on the ruling of its court, that tribe is liable.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁחָטְאוּ שִׁשָּׁה, וְהֵן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל, אוֹ שִׁבְעָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל, וּמַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הִיא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say where six sinned and, they a majority of congregation. Or seven even though they are not a majority of congregation, And whose the baraita It is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For example, if six sinned, and they are the majority of the congregation, or seven, even though they are not the majority of the congregation, and the Mishnah counts them? It is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: חָטְאוּ שִׁשָּׁה וְהֵן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל, אוֹ שִׁבְעָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל – חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of six sinned and they are a majority of congregation, or seven even though they are not a majority of congregation, they are liable.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in his own name: If six sinned and they are the majority of the congregation, or if seven, even though they are not the majority of the congregation - they are liable.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: וּבְהוֹרָאָה, הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב יוֹשְׁבֵי אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַשׂ שְׁלֹמֹה בָעֵת הַהִיא אֶת הֶחָג וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עִמּוֹ קָהָל גָּדוֹל מִלְּבוֹא חֲמָת עַד נַחַל מִצְרַיִם לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים וְשִׁבְעַת יָמִים אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר יוֹם״. מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עִמּוֹ״, ״קָהָל גָּדוֹל מִלְּבוֹא חֲמָת עַד נַחַל מִצְרַיִם״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָנֵי הוּא דְּאִיקְּרִי קָהָל, אֲבָל הָנָךְ לָא אִיקְּרִי קָהָל.
human_translation: Rav Asi says: And with regard to ruling follow the majority of the residents of Eretz Yisrael, as it is stated: “And Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great congregation, from the entrance of Hamath until the Brook of Egypt, before the Lord our God, seven days and seven days, fourteen days” Since it is written: “And all Israel with him,” why do I “A great congregation, from the entrance of Hamath until the Brook of Egypt”? Conclude from it: these who are characterized a congregation; but those are not characterized a congregation.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: And in teaching, follow the majority of the inhabitants of the Land of Israel, as it is stated: "And Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great congregation, from the entrance of Hamath unto the Brook of Egypt, before the Lord our God, seven days and seven days, even fourteen days." From where is it derived? As it is written: "And all Israel with him," "a great congregation, from the entrance of Hamath unto the Brook of Egypt." Why do I need this? Learn from it: Those are the ones that are called a congregation, but those are not called a congregation.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: מְרוּבִּין וְנִתְמַעֲטוּ – הַיְינוּ פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: obvious numerous, and diminished, that is the dispute between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis,
llm_translation: The straightforward conclusion: "Many and few" - this is the dispute between Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מוּעָטִין וְנִתְרַבּוּ, מַאי? מִי פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבָּנַן? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר יְדִיעָה מְחַיַּיב, וְרַבָּנַן דְּאָזְלִי בָּתַר חַטָּאת – פָּטְרִי [אוֹ לָא], מַאי?
human_translation: few, and increased, what Do Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis disagree Rabbi Shimon, who follows awareness, deems liable, and the Rabbis, who follow transgression, deem exempt. Or not What
llm_translation: Few and increased, what? Who argues Rabbi Shimon and the Rabbis? Rabbi Shimon who goes after knowledge obligates, and the Rabbis who go after sin-offering - exempt or not, what?

hebrew_text: וְתִיסְבְּרָא? אֵימוֹר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָזֵיל אַף בָּתַר יְדִיעָה [הֵיכִי דְּהָוֵי יְדִיעָה וַחֲטָאָה בְּחִיּוּב], יְדִיעָה דְּלָא חֲטָאָה מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And can you understand Say that you heard that Rabbi Shimon follows awareness as well, where awareness and transgression in liability, awareness transgression not, did you hear
llm_translation: And was it established? Say that you heard it to Rabbi Shimon that he goes even after knowledge how is it that there is knowledge and sin with obligation, knowledge that did not sin, did you hear it?

hebrew_text: דְּאִם כֵּן, לַיְיתֵי כִּי הַשְׁתָּא! אֶלָּא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲטָאָה וִידִיעָה בָּעֵי.
human_translation: As, if so let bring according to present Rather, Rabbi Shimon requires transgression and awareness
llm_translation: If so, let him bring it now! Rather, Rabbi Shimon requires sin and knowledge.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין חֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְעָשׂוּ מִיעוּט הַקָּהָל, וְחָזְרוּ בֵּית דִּין בָּהֶן, וְהוֹרוּ, וְעָשׂוּ מִיעוּט אַחֵר, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁתֵּי יְדִיעוֹת נִינְהוּ לָא מִצְטָרֵף, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חֵלֶב הוּא, מִצְטָרֵף?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before court issued a ruling fat permitted, and a minority of the congregation performed and the court reversed their and issued a ruling and a different minority performed what is since there are two awareness, does not combine Or perhaps, since this and that fat, combines
llm_translation: He asked them: If the court ruled that fat is permitted, and the congregation acted stringently, and then the court reversed their ruling, and ruled again, and the congregation acted stringently again, what is the law? Since they are two separate entities, do they not combine, or perhaps, since both are fat, do they combine?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצָא לוֹמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חֵלֶב הוּא מִצְטָרֵף, מִיעוּט בְּחֵלֶב שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַקֵּבָה, וּמִיעוּט בְּחֵלֶב שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי דַּקִּין, מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי כֵּיוָן דְּבִתְרֵי קְרָאֵי קָאָתֵי – לָא מִצְטָרֵף, אוֹ דִּלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי חֵלֶב הוּא – מִצְטָרֵף?
human_translation: And if you say Since this and that fat, combines a minority fat that is upon the maw, and a minority fat that is upon the small intestine, what is Here, certainly, since come from two verses, does not combine or perhaps, since this and that fat, combines
llm_translation: And if you should find to say: since both this and that are fat, they combine, a little of the fat on the liver, and a little of the fat on the kidneys, what is the law? Here, surely, since it stands between two verses - it does not combine, or perhaps since both this and that are fat - does it combine?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר: שֵׁם חֵלֶב הוּא וּמִצְטָרֵף, מִיעוּט בְּחֵלֶב וּמִיעוּט בְּדָם, מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי (כֵּיוָן) דִּתְרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי נִינְהוּ, [וְכֵיוָן דְּאֵין אִיסּוּרָן שָׁוֶה] – לָא מִצְטָרֵף, אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן (דְּאִיסּוּרָן שָׁוֶה) – דְּקׇרְבָּנָן שָׁוֶה, מִצְטָרֵף?
human_translation: And if you say It is the name of fat and combines a minority fat, and a minority blood, what is Here, certainly, they are two prohibitions, and since their prohibition is not identical, does not combine Or perhaps, since their offerings are identical, combines
llm_translation: And if you might say: "It is the name of fat and it is mixed, a little in fat and a little in blood, what? Here certainly (since) there are two prohibitions, and since their prohibition is not equal - it does not mix, or perhaps since (their prohibition is equal) - their offering is equal, does it mix?

hebrew_text: וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר: כֵּיוָן (דְּאִיסּוּרָן שָׁוֶה) דְּקׇרְבָּנָן שָׁוֶה מִצְטָרֵף, מִיעוּט בְּחֵלֶב וּמִיעוּט בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, מַהוּ? הָכָא וַדַּאי אֵין אִיסּוּרָן שָׁוֶה וְאֵין קׇרְבָּנָן שָׁוֶה, אוֹ דִּלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי כָּרֵת הוּא, מִצְטָרֵף? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And if you say Since their offerings are identical, combines a minority fat, and a minority in idol worship, what is Here, certainly, neither are their prohibitions identical nor are their offerings identical, Or perhaps, since this and that is excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ] combines shall stand
llm_translation: And if you might say: Since their prohibition is equal, their offering is combined, a little in fat and a little in foreign worship, what? Here, surely their prohibition is not equal and their offering is not equal, or perhaps since both are liable to karet, they combine? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁחֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְעָשׂוּ מִיעוּט הַקָּהָל, וּמֵת אוֹתוֹ בֵּית דִּין וְעָמַד בֵּית דִּין אַחֵר, וְחָזְרוּ וְהוֹרוּ, וְעָשׂוּ מִיעוּט אַחֵר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before court issued a ruling that fat permitted, and a minority of the congregation performed and that court died and another court stood and again issued ruling and a different minority performed
llm_translation: He asked them: If the court ruled that fat is permitted, and the congregation acted with stringency, and that court died and another court arose, and they reversed the ruling and permitted it, and the congregation acted with a different stringency.

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר בֵּית דִּין מַיְיתֵי – לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּהָא לֵיתַנְהוּ, אֶלָּא כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ – אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר צִבּוּר מַיְיתֵי, מַאי צִבּוּר? הָא קָאֵי,
human_translation: According to of the one who said court brings do not raise the dilemma, as those are no Rather, when should you raise the dilemma? according to of the one who said congregation brings What congregation exists,
llm_translation: In the matter of one who says the court should bring the item - it should not be brought to you, for they do not give it. Rather, when it should be brought to you - in the matter of one who says the community should bring the item, what is the community? It stands.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִּלְמָא [יְדִיעָה] דְּהָהוּא בֵּית דִּין דְּהוֹרוּ בָּעִינַן! תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Or perhaps, we require awareness of the same court that issued the ruling, shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps the knowledge of that court that they require! Tiku.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מֵאָה שֶׁיָּשְׁבוּ לְהוֹרוֹת – אֵין חַיָּיבִין עַד שֶׁיּוֹרוּ כּוּלָּן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם כׇּל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל יִשְׁגּוּ״, עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁגּוּ כּוּלָּן [עַד שֶׁתִּפְשׁוֹט הוֹרָאָה בְּכׇל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל] אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּבְכָל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ קַיְימָא לַן רוּבּוֹ כְּכוּלּוֹ, וְהָכָא כְּתִיב ״כׇּל הָעֵדָה״ – הוֹאִיל וְכָךְ, אֲפִילּוּ הֵן מֵאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: one hundred who convened to issue a ruling they are not liable unless they all issue ruling, as it is stated “And if the entire assembly of Israel shall act unwittingly” until they all act unwittingly, and the ruling disseminate throughout the entire assembly of Israel, Rav Huna, son of Rav Hoshaya, said: So too it is reasonable as throughout the entire Torah we maintain the majority of like all of and here: “The entire assembly,” is written. Since it is so, Even they are one hundred
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan said: From one hundred who sit to teach - they are not obligated until they all teach, as it is stated: "And if the entire congregation of Israel shall err," until they all err until the teaching is spread throughout the entire congregation of Israel. Rav Huna, son of Rav Hoshaya, said: This is reasonable, for in the entire Torah, its majority is like its entirety for us, and here it is written "the entire congregation" - since this is so, even if they are one hundred.

hebrew_text: [תְּנַן:] הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין, וְיָדַע אֶחָד מֵהֶן שֶׁטָּעוּ, אוֹ תַּלְמִיד וְרָאוּי לְהוֹרָאָה, וְהָלַךְ וְעָשָׂה עַל פִּיהֶם, בֵּין שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה עִמָּהֶן, וּבֵין שֶׁעָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה אַחֲרֵיהֶן, וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא עָשׂוּ וְעָשָׂה – הֲרֵי זֶה חַיָּיב, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא תָּלָה בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: We learned court issued ruling, and one of knew that they erred, or a student and qualified to issue rulings, and proceeded and performed on the basis of whether performed and he performed with them, or whether performed and he performed after them, or whether did not perform and he performed is liable due to that he did not associate with court.
llm_translation: Tanna: Instruct the court, and one of them knows that they erred, or a student fit to teach, and he went and acted according to their ruling, whether they acted and he acted with them, or whether they acted and he acted after them, or whether they did not act and he acted - he is liable, because he did not rely on the court.

hebrew_text: הַאי הוּא דְּחַיָּיב, הָא אַחֵר פָּטוּר, וְאַמַּאי? הָא לֹא נִגְמְרָה הוֹרָאָה! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִרְכִּין הַהוּא אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּרֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: It is this who liable, but another exempt. But why The ruling is not completed What are we dealing with here? where the one among them bowed his head
llm_translation: This one who is liable, that one is exempt, and why? Because the teaching has not been completed! What are we dealing with here? For example, when that one prepared one of them on his head.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין, וְיָדַע אֶחָד מֵהֶן שֶׁטָּעוּ וְאָמַר לָהֶן ״טוֹעִין אַתֶּם״ – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִים. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר לָהֶן ״טוֹעִין אַתֶּם״ – דִּפְטוּרִים, הָא שָׁתֵיק מִישְׁתָּק – חַיָּיבִין, וְגָמַר לַהּ הוֹרָאָה, וְאַמַּאי? וְהָא לֹא הוֹרוּ כּוּלָּן! אָמְרִי: הָכִי נָמֵי כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִרְכִּין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear court issued a ruling, and one of knew that they erred and he said to them: You are mistaken, they are exempt. The reason that exempt that said to them: You are mistaken. But he was silent, liable, and the ruling is complete. And why, But isn’t not all of them issued ruling? say So too where bowed his head.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The court instructed, and one of them knew that they erred and said to them, "You are mistaken" - these are exempt. The reason he said to them, "You are mistaken" - is that they are exempt. But if he remained silent - they are liable. And he completed the instruction for her. And why? But they did not all instruct! They said: So too, for example, if he tied it on his head.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: סָמְכוּ רַבּוֹתֵינוּ עַל דִּבְרֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְעַל דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק, שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: אֵין גּוֹזְרִין גְּזֵירָה עַל הַצִּבּוּר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן רוֹב הַצִּבּוּר יְכוֹלִין לַעֲמוֹד בָּהּ,
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya raises an objection Our Sages relied on the statement of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and on the statement of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, who would say: One does not issue a decree upon the congregation unless the majority of the congregation is able to withstand it.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Mesharshya asked: Did our Sages rely on the words of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and on the words of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, who used to say: We do not decree a decree upon the community unless the majority of the community can comply with it.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַבָּא: מַאי קְרָא? ״בַּמְּאֵרָה אַתֶּם נֵאָרִים וְאֹתִי אַתֶּם קֹבְעִים הַגּוֹי כֻּלּוֹ״. וְהָא הָכָא דִּכְתִיב ״הַגּוֹי כֻּלּוֹ״, וְרוּבָּא כְּכוֹלָּא דָּמֵי, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי (יוֹחָנָן) [יוֹנָתָן]. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: And Rav Adda bar Abba said: What is the verse “With the curse you are cursed, yet you rob Me, the entire nation” But here it is written: “The entire nation,” and the majority of like the entire The refutation of Rabbi Yonatan a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: And Rav Adda bar Abba said: What is the verse? "You are cursed with a curse, for you are robbing Me, the whole nation of you." But here it is written "the whole nation of you," and the majority is like the whole, the excellence of Rabbi Yonatan. The excellence.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, מַאי ״כׇּל עֲדַת״ דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי אִיכָּא כּוּלָּם – הָוְיָא הוֹרָאָה, וְאִי לָא – לָא הָוְיָא הוֹרָאָה.
human_translation: Rather, what “the entire assembly” that the Merciful One states? This is saying: If there are all it is a ruling, and if not, it is not a ruling.
llm_translation: And rather, what is "all congregation" that the Merciful One is saying? Thus He is saying: If there are all of them - it is considered instruction, and if not - it is not considered instruction.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: עֲשָׂרָה שֶׁיּוֹשְׁבִין בַּדִּין – קוֹלָר תָּלוּי בְּצַוַּאר כּוּלָּן. פְּשִׁיטָא! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ תַּלְמִיד בִּפְנֵי רַבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: ten who sit in judgment, the chain [ kolar ] is suspended around the neck of all of them, obvious? This teaches us that even a student before his teacher
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: Ten who sit in judgment - a collar is hanging on all of them. It is obvious! This teaches us that even a student in the presence of his teacher.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵיק לְבֵי דִינָא, מַיְיתִי עֲשָׂרָה תַּנָּאֵי דְבֵי רַב לְקַמֵּיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנִימְטְיַין שִׁיבָּא מִכְּשׁוּרָא. רַב אָשֵׁי כִּי הֲווֹ מַיְיתִי טְרֵפְתָּא לְקַמֵּיהּ, מַיְיתֵי עֲשָׂרָה טַבָּחֵי מִמָּתָא מַחְסֵיָא וּמוֹתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ, אָמַר: כִּי הֵיכָא דְּנִימְטְיַין שִׁיבָּא מִכְּשׁוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, when he would go out to the court bring ten tanna’im , who study hall, before him so that we will receive a splinter from the beam, Rav Ashi, when they would bring before him a tereifa , would bring ten slaughterers from Mata Meḥasya and sit before him He said: so that we will receive a splinter from the beam.
llm_translation: Rav Huna, when he would go out to the court, would bring ten teachings from the study hall of Rav before him, so that they would be readily available. Rav Ashe, when he would bring a treifah before him, would bring ten butchers from the city of Mehasya and have them stand before him, saying: so that they would be readily available.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְיָדְעוּ שֶׁטָּעוּ וְחָזְרוּ בָּהֶן, בֵּין שֶׁהֵבִיאוּ כַּפָּרָתָן וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיאוּ כַּפָּרָתָן, וְהָלַךְ וְעָשָׂה עַל פִּיהֶן – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: סָפֵק. אֵיזֶהוּ סָפֵק? יָשַׁב לוֹ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ – חַיָּיב, הָלַךְ לוֹ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם – פָּטוּר.
human_translation: court issued ruling and they discovered that they erred and reversed their whether they brought their atonement or whether they did not bring their atonement and proceeded and performed on the basis of their Rabbi Shimon deems exempt and Rabbi Elazar says: uncertainty Which is uncertainty sat inside his house liable went to a country overseas exempt.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the court instructed and they knew that they erred, and they reconsidered, whether they brought their atonement or did not bring their atonement, and one went and acted according to their ruling - Rabbi Shimon exempts him, and Rabbi Eliezer says: It is a doubt. What is considered a doubt? If he remained within his home - he is liable, if he went to a maritime province - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מוֹדֶה אֲנִי בָּזֶה שֶׁהוּא קָרוֹב לִפְטוּר מִן הַחוֹבָה. אָמַר לוֹ בֶּן עַזַּאי: מַאי שְׁנָא זֶה מִן הַיּוֹשֵׁב בְּבֵיתוֹ? שֶׁהַיּוֹשֵׁב בְּבֵיתוֹ אֶפְשָׁר הָיָה לוֹ שֶׁיִּשְׁמַע, וְזֶה לֹא הָיָה לוֹ אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁיִּשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I concede in that that he is closer to exemption than liability. Ben Azzai said to him: what is this different from one who sits in his house? that one who sits in his house it would have been possible for him to hear but that it would not have been possible for him to hear
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I concede regarding this, that he is close to being exempt from the obligation. Ben Azzai said to him: What is the difference between this one and one who is sitting in his house? For one who is sitting in his house, it is possible for him to hear, but this one it was not possible for him to hear.

hebrew_text: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין לַעֲקוֹר אֶת כָּל הַגּוּף, אָמְרוּ: אֵין נִדָּה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֵין שַׁבָּת בַּתּוֹרָה, אֵין עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בַּתּוֹרָה – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין. הוֹרוּ לְבַטֵּל מִקְצָת וּלְקַיֵּים מִקְצָת – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: court issued ruling to abolish the entire essence they said: There is no a menstruating woman in the Torah, there is no Shabbat in the Torah, there is no idol worship in the Torah, these are exempt, issued a ruling to nullify part and to sustain part these are liable.
llm_translation: They instructed the court to uproot the entire body, they said: "There is no impurity in the Torah, there is no Sabbath in the Torah, there is no idolatry in the Torah - these are exempt. They instructed to nullify some and to fulfill some - these are obligated."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? אָמְרוּ: יֵשׁ נִדָּה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַבָּא עַל שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם – פָּטוּר,
human_translation: How said: There is a menstruating woman in the Torah, but one who engages in intercourse with who observes day for a day exempt.
llm_translation: How so? They said: There is a menstruant woman in the Torah, but one who has relations with a woman observing a day of purity opposite a day of impurity - is exempt.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ שַׁבָּת בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַמּוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים – פָּטוּר,
human_translation: There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who carries out from the private domain to the public domain exempt.
llm_translation: There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who transfers from a private domain to a public domain - is exempt.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה – פָּטוּר, הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנֶעֱלַם דָּבָר״ – דָּבָר, וְלֹא כָּל הַגּוּף.
human_translation: There is idol worship in the Torah, but one who bows exempt. these are liable, as it is stated: “And the matter is hidden” a matter, but not the entire essence
llm_translation: There is foreign worship in the Torah, but one who prostrates - exempt, here are those who are obligated, as it is said: "and a matter is hidden" - a matter, and not the entire body.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? הוֹאִיל וּבִרְשׁוּת בֵּית דִּין הוּא עוֹשֶׂה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כׇּל הוֹרָאָה שֶׁיָּצְאָה בְּרוֹב צִבּוּר – יָחִיד הָעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָהּ פָּטוּר, לְפִי שֶׁלֹּא נִיתְּנָה הוֹרָאָה אֶלָּא לְהַבְחִין בֵּין שׁוֹגֵג לְמֵזִיד.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? since with the permission of the court he performs Some say Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Rabbi Shimon would say: any ruling that disseminated to the majority of congregation, an individual who performs exempt, because a ruling is given only to distinguish between unwitting and intentional
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion? Since he is acting with the permission of the court. Some say that Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, or Rabbi Shimon said: Any teaching that has gone out in public – the individual who performs it is exempt, because the teaching was only given to distinguish between unintentional and intentional actions.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: פַּר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר וּשְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – בַּתְּחִלָּה גּוֹבִין עֲלֵיהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה הֵן בָּאִין. אַמַּאי, כֵּיוָן דְּגָבֵי לְהוּ, הָוֵי לֵיהּ ״הוֹדַע״!
human_translation: raises an objection a bull an unwitting communal sin, and goats of idol worship, collects for from the outset, the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: comes from the collection of the chamber, why Since they collect is for him became known,
llm_translation: Challenger: A young bull for a communal sin-offering and he-goats for foreign worship - initially they are collected for them, the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: They come from the Chamber's heave-offering. Why? Since they are collected for it, it is considered "designated" for it!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁגָּבוּ סְתָם.
human_translation: If you wish, say where they collected without specification.
llm_translation: If you ask, say: such as when he collected anonymously.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּגוֹן דְּלָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּמָתָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say where was not in the city.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: For example, that he did not have in the city.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: רַב כְּאִידַּךְ תַּנָּא סָבַר, דְּתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא: בַּתְּחִילָּה גּוֹבִין לָהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה הֵן בָּאִין.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rav holds in accordance with the other tanna as it is taught reversed: collects for from the outset; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: comes from the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Rav, like the other, taught, as it was taught in a Baraita the opposite: Initially, they collect for them, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: They come from the contribution of the chamber.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי: רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: סָפֵק, מִשּׁוּם סוֹמְכוֹס אָמְרוּ: תָּלוּי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Meir deems liable and Rabbi Shimon deems exempt. Rabbi Elazar says: uncertainty In the name of Sumakhos, said: suspended Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a provisional guilt-offering there is between
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir obligates, and Rabbi Shimon exempts, Rabbi Elazar says: It is a doubt, due to the principle of "safek somchus" they said: It is dependent. Rabbi Yochanan said: There is a suspended guilt offering between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָמָּה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁאָכַל סָפֵק חֵלֶב סָפֵק שׁוּמָּן, וְנוֹדַע לוֹ, שֶׁמֵּבִיא אָשָׁם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: an analogy of Rabbi Elazar. To what is this matter comparable? to a person who ate uncertainty fat uncertainty fat, And became aware as bring guilt-offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: The parable of Rabbi Elazar, to what is the matter similar? To a person who ate doubtful fat, doubtful lard, and it became known to him, that he brings a guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: וְלָא מִבַּעְיָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר צִבּוּר מַיְיתֵי, דִּמְפַרְסְמָא מִלְּתָא. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין, דְּלָא מְפַרְסְמָא מִלְּתָא – אִי הֲוָה שָׁאֵיל, הֲווֹ אָמְרִין לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And it is not necessary according to the one who said congregation brings as the matter, is publicized But even according to the one who said court brings where the matter is not publicized if he had asked, they would have told him
llm_translation: And not necessary according to the one who says the community brings, for it publicizes the matter. Rather, even according to the one who says the court brings, for it does not publicize the matter - if he had asked, they would have told him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר זְבִידָא: מָשָׁל דְּסוֹמְכוֹס לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְאָדָם שֶׁהֵבִיא כַּפָּרָתוֹ בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, סָפֵק מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם נִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ, סָפֵק מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁכָה נִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ, שֶׁאֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida, says: an analogy of Sumakhos. To what is this matter comparable? to a person who brings his atonement twilight, uncertainty atoned for him while it is still day, uncertainty it atoned for him after nightfall, that he does not bring a provisional guilt-offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin said, and some say Rabbi Yosei bar Zevida: A parable - to what is the matter comparable? To a person who brought his sin-offering between the sunsets, whether he was atoned for from before the day or whether he was atoned for from after the darkness, for one does not bring a guilt-offering that is dependent.

hebrew_text: וְלָא מִבַּעְיָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין דְּלָא אִפַּרְסְמָא מִלְּתָא, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר צִבּוּר מְבִיאִין, דִּמְפַרְסְמָא מִלְּתָא, וַהֲווֹ אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ, דְּהָכָא בְּסָפֵק מִבְּעוֹד יוֹם סָפֵק מִשֶּׁחָשֵׁכָה, אִי שָׁאֵיל לָא אַשְׁכַּח אִינָשׁ דִּמְשַׁיֵּילֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And it is not necessary according to the one who said court brings when the matter is not publicized but even according to the one who said congregation brings when the matter is publicized and we would have said to him because here, in uncertainty while it is still day uncertainty after nightfall, if he asks he would not find a person whom he ask.
llm_translation: And not from the question to whom says the court brings not to publicize a matter, but even to whom says the community brings, for publicizing a matter, and they said to him, that here in a case of doubt from before day doubt from after night, if you ask, you will not find a person who will answer him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ בֶּן עַזַּאי: מַאי שְׁנָא מִן הַיּוֹשֵׁב כּוּ׳. שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְבֶן עַזַּאי?
human_translation: ben Azzai said to what different from one who sits Rabbi Akiva said well to ben Azzai.
llm_translation: He said to him, Ben Azzai: What is different from the one who sits? Rabbi Akiva said well to him, Ben Azzai?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, לְבֶן עַזַּאי חַיָּיב – דְּהָא בְּבֵיתֵיהּ אִיתֵיהּ, לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא פָּטוּר – דְּהָא הֶחְזִיק בַּדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Rava said: one who set out on the way there is between them. According to ben Azzai liable, as in his home he is According to Rabbi Akiva exempt, as he set out on way.
llm_translation: Rava said: If there is a path between them, Ben Azzai is liable - because he is in his house, but Rabbi Akiva is exempt - because there is a path.

hebrew_text: הוֹרוּ לוֹ בֵּית דִּין לַעֲקוֹר אֶת כָּל הַגּוּף. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנֶעֱלַם דָּבָר״ – וְלֹא שֶׁיֵּעָקֵר הַמִּצְוָה כּוּלָּהּ. כֵּיצַד? אָמְרוּ: אֵין נִדָּה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֵין שַׁבָּת בַּתּוֹרָה, אֵין עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בַּתּוֹרָה, יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנֶעֱלַם דָּבָר״ – וְלֹא שֶׁתִּתְעַלֵּם מִצְוָה כּוּלָּהּ. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: court issued ruling to abolish the entire essence The Sages taught: “And the matter is hidden but not where they will abolish the entire mitzva. How said: There is no a menstruating woman in the Torah, there is no Shabbat in the Torah, there is no idol worship in the Torah, might would be liable. the verse states: “And the matter is hidden,” and not that entire mitzva will be hidden. they are exempt
llm_translation: Instruct him the court to uproot all the body. The Rabbis taught: "And a thing hidden" - not that the entire commandment should be uprooted. How so? They said: There is no menstruation in the Torah, there is no Sabbath in the Torah, there is no idol worship in the Torah, can they possibly be liable? The Talmud teaches: "And a thing hidden" - not that the entire commandment should be hidden. These are exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אָמְרוּ: יֵשׁ נִדָּה בַּתּוֹרָה אֲבָל הַבָּא עַל שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם פָּטוּר, יֵשׁ שַׁבָּת בַּתּוֹרָה אֲבָל הַמּוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים פָּטוּר, יֵשׁ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בַּתּוֹרָה אֲבָל הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה פָּטוּר – יָכוֹל יְהוּ פְּטוּרִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנֶעֱלַם דָּבָר״ וְלֹא כָּל הַגּוּף.
human_translation: But said: There is a menstruating woman in the Torah, but one who engages in intercourse with who observes day for a day exempt; There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who carries out from the private domain to the public domain exempt; There is idol worship in the Torah, but one who bows exempt, might would be exempt. the verse states: “And the matter is hidden,” but not the entire essence.
llm_translation: But they said: There is impurity in the Torah, but one who has relations with a woman on the day corresponding to her day is exempt. There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who transfers from a private domain to a public domain is exempt. There is foreign worship in the Torah, but one who bows down is exempt - can they be exempt? The Talmud teaches: "And a matter is hidden" and not the entire body.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: יָכוֹל יְהוּ פְּטוּרִין. וְאִי בְּקִיּוּם מִקְצָת וּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת פְּטוּרִין, וּבַעֲקִירַת כָּל הַגּוּף פְּטוּרִין – בְּמַאי חַיָּיבִין? תַּנָּא הָכִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, אֵימָא: ״דָּבָר״ כּוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא מַשְׁמַע! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנֶעֱלַם דָּבָר״.
human_translation: The Master said: might would be exempt. But if in sustaining a portion and nullifying a portion exempt, and in abolishing the entire essence exempt, in what liable? This difficult for the tanna : Say “matter” is referring to the entire matter, the verse states: “And the matter is hidden [ venelam davar ].”
llm_translation: Master said: Can they be exempt? And if some are fulfilled and some are annulled, they are exempt. And if the entire body is uprooted, they are exempt - with what are they liable? It was taught thus: This is difficult for him, say: "The matter" implies the entire thing is heard! The Talmud teaches: "And a matter is hidden."

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר עוּלָּא: קְרִי בֵּיהּ ״וְנֶעֱלַם מִדָּבָר״.
human_translation: From where inferred? Ulla said: Read into Venelam middavar ,
llm_translation: What is the implication? Ula said: It reads in it "and hidden from the desert."

hebrew_text: חִזְקִיָּה אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָשׂוּ אַחַת מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת״, ״מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת״ – וְלֹא כׇּל מִצְוֹת. מִצְוֹת תַּרְתֵּי מַשְׁמַע! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: ״מִצְוַת״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya said the verse states: “And they performed one of all the mitzvot” of all the mitzvot and not all the mitzvot. mitzvot indicates two. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: mitzvat is written,
llm_translation: Hezekiah said, the verse says: "And they shall do one of all the commandments," "of all the commandments" – and not all commandments. The word "commandments" implies two! Rav Nahman son of Yitzhak said: "Commandment" is written.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: יָלֵיף ״דָּבָר״ ״דָּבָר״ מִזָּקֵן מַמְרֵא, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּזָקֵן מַמְרֵא: ״כִּי יִפָּלֵא מִמְּךָ דָבָר... לֹא תָסוּר מִן הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר יַגִּידוּ לְךָ יָמִין וּשְׂמֹאל״, מָה מַמְרֵא – ״מִן הַדָּבָר״ וְלֹא כׇּל דָּבָר, אַף בְּהוֹרָאָה – ״דָּבָר״ וְלֹא כָּל הַגּוּף.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: derives “matter” from “matter” rebellious elder. As it is written with regard to rebellious elder: “If there shall be a matter [ davar ] too hard for you…You shall not turn aside from the matter [ haddavar ] that they shall declare unto you, to the right nor to the left” Just as a rebellious of the matter and not an entire matter, so too, with regard to ruling matter and not the entire essence
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "Learn 'davar' 'davar' from the elder of Mamre, as it is written in it in the elder of Mamre: 'For a thing will be wondrous from you... do not turn away from the thing that they will tell you, right or left.' Just as in the case of Mamre - 'from the thing' and not every thing, so too in teaching - 'davar' and not the entire body."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין בֵּית דִּין חַיָּיבִין עַד שֶׁיּוֹרוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין הַצַּדּוּקִין מוֹדִין בּוֹ. אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁהַצַּדּוּקִין מוֹדִין בּוֹ – פְּטוּרִין. מַאי טַעְמָא? זִיל קְרִי בֵּי רַב הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: A court is not liable unless it issues ruling concerning a matter with which the Sadducees do not agree. But with regard to a matter with which the Sadducees agree, exempt. What is the reasoning is go learn a children’s school.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A court is not obligated until they rule on a matter that the Sadducees do not agree with. But in a matter that the Sadducees agree with - they are exempt. What is the reason? Go, read in the house of Rav.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: יֵשׁ נִדָּה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַבָּא עַל שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם פָּטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם, הָא כְּתִיב ״וְסָפְרָה לָּהּ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁסּוֹפֶרֶת אֶחָד לְאֶחָד!
human_translation: We learned There is a menstruating woman in the Torah, but one who engages in intercourse with who observes day for a day exempt. And why who observes a day for a day is written “And she shall count for herself” teaches that she counts one for one
llm_translation: We learned: There is a niddah in the Torah, but one who has relations with a shomeret yom k'neged yom is exempt. And why? A shomeret yom k'neged yom, as it is written "and he shall reckon it to her," teaching that she counts one to one!

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִי: הַעֲרָאָה שַׁרְיָא, גְּמַר בִּיאָה הוּא דַּאֲסִירָא. הָא נָמֵי כְּתִיב: ״אֶת מְקוֹרָהּ הֶעֱרָה״!
human_translation: where they said: The initial stage of intercourse [ ha’ara’a ] permitted it is the completion of intercourse that is prohibited. That halakha is also written: “He has uncovered [ he’era ] her fount”
llm_translation: The text reads: "They said: A nakedness of hair is permitted, it is the completion of intercourse that is prohibited. As it is written: 'Her wellspring he uncovered'!"

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִי: כְּדַרְכָּהּ – אֲסִירָא, שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – שַׁרְיָא. הָא כְּתִיב: ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״!
human_translation: where they said: in the typical manner prohibited, in an atypical manner, permitted. Isn’t it written: “The manners in which one lies with a woman”
llm_translation: They said: "As her way" - prohibited, "not as her way" - permitted. But isn't it written: "with a woman lying with a man"!

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִי: כְּדַרְכָּהּ – אָסוּר אֲפִילּוּ הַעֲרָאָה, בְּשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – גְּמַר בִּיאָה הוּא דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל הַעֲרָאָה שַׁרְיָא. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ נִדָּה נָמֵי!
human_translation: where they said: in a typical manner, even the initial stage of intercourse forbidden. in an atypical manner, it is completion of intercourse that forbidden, but the initial stage of intercourse permitted. If so, even a menstruating woman, also
llm_translation: They said: "In its usual manner - forbidden even with mere sight, not in its usual manner - it is considered complete intercourse that is forbidden, but mere sight is permitted. If so, even a menstruating woman as well!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וּדְאָמְרִי: הַעֲרָאָה בְּאִשָּׁה דָּוָה הוּא דִּכְתִיבָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, דְּאָמְרִי: זָבָה לָא הָוְיָא אֶלָּא בִּימָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל יְמֵי זוֹבָהּ״.
human_translation: Rather, actually, in a typical manner, and said: the initial stage of intercourse, it is with regard to an afflicted woman, that it is written, And if you wish, say that they said: a zava , only during the day, as it is written: “All the days of her discharge”
llm_translation: Rather, forever as its way, and they say: the seeing in a widowed woman it is as it is written. And if you will say, that they say: a menstruating woman is only in her days, as it is written: "all the days of her menstruation."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: יֵשׁ שַׁבָּת בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַמּוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת לִרְשׁוּת פָּטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? הוֹצָאָה הָא כְּתִיבָא: ״לֹא תוֹצִיאוּ מַשָּׂא מִבָּתֵּיכֶם״!
human_translation: We learned There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who carries out from domain to domain exempt. And why carrying out isn’t it written: “Neither carry a burden out of your houses
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who transfers from one domain to another is exempt. And why? Because it is written: "You shall not carry a burden from your houses"!

hebrew_text: [דְּאָמְרִי הוֹצָאָה הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הַכְנָסָה מוּתָּר. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא], דְּאָמְרִי: הוֹצָאָה וְהַכְנָסָה הוּא דַּאֲסִירָא, מוֹשִׁיט וְזוֹרֵק שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: where said: carrying out that is prohibited, carrying into permitted. And if you wish, say that said: It is carrying out and carrying into that is prohibited. passing or throwing permitted.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: de'amri hotza'ah hu de'asur, haknasa mutar. ve'ibaita eima, de'amri: hotza'ah vehaknasa hu da'asira, moshit vezorek sherei. English translation: As they say, carrying out is what is forbidden, bringing in is permitted. And if you ask, say, as they say: carrying out and bringing in are what is prohibited, extending and throwing are permissible.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: יֵשׁ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה פָּטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה הָא כְּתִיבָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לְאֵל אַחֵר״!
human_translation: We learned There is idol worship in the Torah, but one who bows exempt. And why one who bows isn’t it written as it is written: “You shall not bow to another god”
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: There is foreign worship in the Torah, but one who prostrates is exempt. And why? One who prostrates, as it is written: "You shall not prostrate yourself to another god"!

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִי: כִּי אֲסִירָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה כְּדַרְכָּהּ, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ – שַׁרְיָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, דְּאָמְרִי: הִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה גּוּפַהּ כְּדַרְכָּהּ הוּא דַּאֲסִיר, דְּאִית בַּהּ פִּשּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם, הָא הִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה דְּלֵית בַּהּ פִּשּׁוּט יָדַיִם וְרַגְלַיִם – שַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: where said: When bowing is forbidden the typical manner But not its typical manner permitted. And if you wish, say where said: bowing itself, in its typical manner that prohibited. that has in its extension of the arms and legs, But bowing that does not have in its extension of the arms and legs permitted.
llm_translation: The scholars say: When a prisoner bows down in her usual manner, it is prohibited, but if not in her usual manner - it is permitted. And if you wish, say: The bowing down of her body in her usual manner is what is prohibited, for if there are exposed hands and feet, then bowing down is prohibited, but if there are no exposed hands and feet - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אֵין חֲרִישָׁה בְּשַׁבָּת, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מוֹדוּ בְּכוּלְּהוּ מִלְּתָא, כְּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת וְקִיּוּם מִקְצָת דָּמֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא עָקְרִיִין לֵיהּ לַחֲרִישָׁהּ כׇּל עִיקָּר, כַּעֲקִירַת גּוּף דָּמֵי?
human_translation: Rav Yosef raises a dilemma: there is no plowing on Shabbat, what is Do we say since agree to the entire matter tantamount to nullification of a portion and fulfillment of a portion Or perhaps, since are abolishing plowing in its entirety, tantamount to abolishing essence
llm_translation: The question of Rav Yosef: Is there plowing on Shabbat, what is it? Who said: Since they agree in all matters, like the nullification of some and the fulfillment of some, is it perhaps: Since they uproot it for its essential plowing, is it like the uprooting of the body itself?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: יֵשׁ נִדָּה בַּתּוֹרָה אֲבָל הַבָּא עַל שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם פָּטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? הָא עָקְרִיִין לְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם כְּנֶגֶד יוֹם כׇּל עִיקָּר!
human_translation: Come hear There is a menstruating woman in the Torah, but one who engages in intercourse with who observes day for a day exempt. And why Didn’t abolish who observes day for a day in its entirety?
llm_translation: Listen: There is impurity in the Torah, but one who comes upon a Shomeret Yom (a woman who observes the laws of ritual purity) day corresponding to day is exempt. And why? Because the primary requirement for a Shomeret Yom is day corresponding to day, that is the essence!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב יוֹסֵף: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יוֹם דְּקָאָמְרִין כִּדְשַׁנִּין.
human_translation: Rav Yosef say to you: who observes day as we stated, as we explained
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said to you: "Shomeret Yom" as we say, like Dshannin.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: יֵשׁ שַׁבָּת בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַמּוֹצִיא מֵרְשׁוּת הַיָּחִיד לִרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים פָּטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? הָא עָקְרִיִין לְהוֹצָאָה כׇּל עִיקָּר!
human_translation: Come hear There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who carries out from the private domain to the public domain exempt. And why Didn’t abolish carrying out in its entirety?
llm_translation: "Come and hear: There is Shabbat in the Torah, but one who transfers from a private domain to a public domain is exempt. And why? Because the primary carrying out has already been uprooted!"

hebrew_text: הָתָם נָמֵי כִּדְשַׁנִּין.
human_translation: That too as we explained
llm_translation: There, we say as we say.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: יֵשׁ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הַמִּשְׁתַּחֲוֶה פָּטוּר. אַמַּאי? וְהָא עָקְרִיִין לְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה כׇּל עִיקָּר!
human_translation: Come hear There is idol worship in the Torah, but one who bows exempt. And why But didn’t abolish bowing in its entirety?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: yesh avodah zarah bat Torah, aval hamishtachaveh patur. Ammai? Veha akriyin lehishtachavayah kol ikar!" English translation: "Come and hear: There is foreign worship in the Torah, but one who prostrates is exempt. Why? Because the main thing is for prostration!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: הִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָה נָמֵי כִּדְשַׁנִּין.
