human_translation: say: Bowing, too, as we explained
llm_translation: They said: "He bowed down like Dan."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי זֵירָא: אֵין שַׁבָּת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, מַהוּ? בְּמַאי טָעוּ? בְּהָדֵין קְרָא: ״בֶּחָרִישׁ וּבַקָּצִיר תִּשְׁבֹּת״, בִּזְמַן דְּאִיכָּא חֲרִישָׁה – אִיכָּא שַׁבָּת, וּבִזְמַן דְּלֵיכָּא חֲרִישָׁה – לֵיכָּא שַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: there is no Shabbat during the Sabbatical what is With regard to what did they err with regard to this verse “In plowing and in harvest you shall rest” During a time when there is plowing, there is Shabbat. But during a time when there is no plowing, there is no Shabbat.
llm_translation: The question of Rabbi Zeira: Is there Shabbat on the seventh year, what is the law? With what reasoning? With this verse: "During plowing and harvesting you shall rest" (Exodus 34:21) - when there is plowing, there is Shabbat, and when there is no plowing, there is no Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מִי אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דִּמְקַיְּימִין לַהּ בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ, כְּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת וְקִיּוּם מִקְצָת דָּמֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא עָקְרִיִין לֵיהּ בִּשְׁבִיעִית, כַּעֲקִירַת הַגּוּף דָּמֵי?
human_translation: Do we say: Since one fulfills during the rest of the years of the Sabbatical tantamount to nullification of a portion and fulfillment of a portion Or perhaps, since is abolishing during the Sabbatical tantamount to abolishing the essence
llm_translation: We say: Since they establish for it in the rest of the two weeks, like the nullification of some and the fulfillment of some of the money, or perhaps: since they uproot it in the seventh, is it like uprooting the body?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: נָבִיא שֶׁנִּתְנַבֵּא לַעֲקוֹר דָּבָר מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה – חַיָּיב. לְבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת וּלְקִיּוּם מִקְצָת, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: פָּטוּר. וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר: הַיּוֹם עוֹבְדָהּ, וּלְמָחָר בַּטְּלָה – חַיָּיב, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֵין שַׁבָּת בַּשְּׁבִיעִית כְּבִיטּוּל מִקְצָת וְקִיּוּם מִקְצָת דָּמֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said: Come hear a prophet who prophesies to abolish a matter of the matters of the Torah, liable for the nullification of part and the fulfillment of part Rabbi Shimon says exempt And with regard to idol worship, even says: Worship it today and revoke its status tomorrow, liable, Learn from it there is no Shabbat during the Sabbatical tantamount to nullification of a portion and fulfillment of a portion learn from it.
llm_translation: Ravina said, come and hear: a prophet who prophesies to uproot a matter from the words of the Torah - liable. For nullifying some and upholding some, Rabbi Shimon says: exempt. And in foreign worship, even if one says: today it is worshipped, and tomorrow it is annulled - liable, learn from it: there is no Sabbath on the seventh like nullifying some and upholding some of its blood. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין, וְיָדַע אֶחָד מֵהֶן שֶׁטָּעוּ, וְאָמַר לָהֶן: ״טוֹעִין אַתֶּם״, אוֹ שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מוּפְלָא שֶׁל בֵּית דִּין שָׁם, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן גֵּר אוֹ מַמְזֵר אוֹ נָתִין, אוֹ זָקֵן שֶׁלֹּא רָאוּי לְבָנִים – הֲרֵי זֶה פָּטוּר.
human_translation: court issued a ruling, and one of knew that they erred and he said to them: You are mistaken; or if the most distinguished [ mufla ] of the court was not there or if one of was a convert, or a child born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzer ], or a Gibeonite, or an old man no able to children, this is exempt,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the court instructed, and one of them knew that they erred, and he said to them: "You are mistaken," or if it was not likely that the court was present there, or if one of them was a convert, a mamzer, a eunuch, or an elderly man unsuitable for children - he is exempt.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר כָּאן ״עֵדָה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״עֵדָה״, מֶה ״עֵדָה״ הָאֲמוּרָה לְהַלָּן – כּוּלָּן רְאוּיִן לְהוֹרָאָה, אַף ״עֵדָה״ הָאֲמוּרָה כָּאן – עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כּוּלָּן רְאוּיִן לְהוֹרָאָה.
human_translation: as “assembly” is stated here and “assembly” is stated there Just as “assembly” stated there, all fit to issue rulings, so too, “assembly” stated here, unless all will be fit to issue rulings.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated here "edah," and it is stated there "edah," just as the "edah" mentioned there is fit for teaching, so too the "edah" mentioned here is fit for teaching.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אוֹ שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה מוּפְלָא שֶׁל בֵּית דִּין שָׁם – מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ הוֹרוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁהַצַּדּוּקִין מוֹדִין בּוֹ פְּטוּרִין? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶם לִלְמוֹד וְלֹא לָמְדוּ, לֹא הָיָה מוּפְלָא שֶׁל בֵּית דִּין שָׁם נָמֵי פְּטוּרִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶם לִלְמוֹד וְלֹא לָמְדוּ.
human_translation: Or if the most distinguished member of the court was not there, From where do we Rav Sheshet said, and likewise the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: For what did say: issued a ruling with regard to a matter with which the Sadducees agree, exempt? due to that it was upon them to learn and they did not learn the most distinguished member of the court was not there, also exempt, as it was upon them to learn and they did not learn.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If a case was not a wonder that the court was there - whence? Rav Sheshet said, and so did the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Why did they instruct regarding a matter that the Sadducees admit to, they are exempt? Because they had the opportunity to learn and did not learn, it was not a wonder that the court there also exempted, because they had the opportunity to learn and did not learn.

hebrew_text: נֶאֱמַר שָׁם ״עֵדָה״ וְנֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״עֵדָה״, עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ כּוּלָּן רְאוּיִן לְהוֹרָאָה. וְהָתָם מְנָלַן? דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִתְיַצְּבוּ שָׁם עִמָּךְ״ – ״עִמָּךְ״ בְּדוֹמִין לָךְ.
human_translation: “Assembly” is stated there and “assembly” is stated here… unless all will be fit to issue rulings. And there, from where do we as Rav Ḥisda says the verse states “That they may stand there with you” “with you” With similarity to you,
llm_translation: It is stated there "edah" and it is stated here "edah," until all of them are fit for teaching. And how do we know this? For Rav Ḥisda said, as the verse states: "And they shall stand there with you" - "with you" in a manner similar to you.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״עִמָּךְ״ לִשְׁכִינָה! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנָשְׂאוּ אִתָּךְ״ – ״אִתָּךְ״ בְּדוֹמִין לָךְ.
human_translation: And say that “with you,” for the Divine Presence Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says the verse states and bear it with you” “With you” Similar to you.
llm_translation: And why does it say, "with you" imach for the Divine Presence Shekhinah? Rather, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, the verse says, "and they shall bear with you" – "with you" it is similar to you.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שׁוֹגְגִין, וְעָשׂוּ כָּל הַקָּהָל שׁוֹגְגִין – מְבִיאִין פַּר. מְזִידִין, וְעָשׂוּ שׁוֹגְגִין – מְבִיאִין כִּשְׂבָּה וּשְׂעִירָה. שׁוֹגְגִין, וְעָשׂוּ מְזִידִין – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: court issued ruling unwittingly and the entire congregation performed unwittingly brings a bull, intentionally, and performed unwittingly brings a female lamb or a female goat unwittingly and performed intentionally, these are exempt
llm_translation: They taught: If the court erred unintentionally, and the entire congregation erred unintentionally - they bring a bull. If they erred intentionally, and the congregation erred unintentionally - they bring a he-goat and a she-goat. If they erred unintentionally, and they intentionally - these are exempt.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שׁוֹגְגִין וְעָשׂוּ מְזִידִין – הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין. הָא שׁוֹגֵג דּוּמְיָא דְּמֵזִיד – חַיָּיב, וְהֵיכִי דָּמֵי? שֶׁהוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁחֵלֶב מוּתָּר, וְנִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ.
human_translation: unwittingly and performed intentionally, these are exempt. But unwittingly similar to an intentional liable. And what are the circumstances where the court issued a ruling that fat permitted, and fat became confused for with fat and he ate
llm_translation: Gemara: If one committed a sin inadvertently and then intentionally, he is exempt. But if the inadvertent act resembles the intentional act, he is liable. How so? If the court ruled that fat is permitted, and he mistakenly thought it was oil and consumed it.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא, תִּפְשׁוֹט הָא דְּבָעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא! אָמַר לָךְ, מִשּׁוּם דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא: מְזִידִין וְעָשׂוּ שׁוֹגְגִין, תְּנָא סֵיפָא: שׁוֹגְגִין וְעָשׂוּ מְזִידִין.
human_translation: let us say: Resolve that which Rami bar Ḥama raises as a dilemma say to you due to that taught the first clause intentionally, and performed unwittingly, he taught the latter clause unwittingly and performed intentionally.
llm_translation: Let us say, "Take off the one that Ba'ei Ramei son of Hama wants!" He said to you, "Because a Tanna taught in the beginning: They acted intentionally and it turned out unintentional, a Tanna taught in the end: It was unintentional and it turned out intentional."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְעָשׂוּ כׇּל הַקָּהָל אוֹ רוּבָּן עַל פִּיהֶן – מְבִיאִין פַּר. וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – מְבִיאִין פַּר וְשָׂעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים – מְבִיאִין שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר פָּרִים. וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – מְבִיאִין שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר פָּרִים וּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׂעִירִים.
human_translation: the court issued ruling and the entire congregation or a majority thereof performed on the basis of their bring a bull And involved idol worship, bring a bull and a goat, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Twelve tribes, bring twelve bulls, and for idol worship they bring twelve bulls and twelve goats,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the court instructs and the entire congregation or the majority of them act in accordance with their ruling - they bring a bull. In matters of idolatry - they bring a bull and a he-goat, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: For the twelve tribes - they bring twelve bulls. In matters of idolatry - they bring twelve bulls and twelve he-goats.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר פָּרִים, וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר פָּרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר שְׂעִירִים, פַּר וְשָׂעִיר לְכׇל שֵׁבֶט וְשֵׁבֶט, פַּר וְשָׂעִיר לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: thirteen bulls; and for idol worship thirteen bulls and thirteen goats, a bull and a goat for each and every tribe and a bull and a goat for court.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Thirteen bulls, and in the case of idolatry - thirteen bulls and thirteen he-goats, a bull and a he-goat for each tribe, a bull and a he-goat for the court.

hebrew_text: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין וְעָשׂוּ שִׁבְעָה שְׁבָטִים אוֹ רוּבָּן עַל פִּיהֶן – מְבִיאִין פַּר, וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – מְבִיאִין פַּר וְשָׂעִיר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה שְׁבָטִים שֶׁחָטְאוּ – מְבִיאִין שִׁבְעָה פָּרִים, וּשְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים שֶׁלֹּא חָטְאוּ – מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶן פַּר, שֶׁאַף אֵלּוּ שֶׁלֹּא חָטְאוּ מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵי חוֹטְאִין. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁמוֹנָה פָּרִים, וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – שְׁמוֹנָה פָּרִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה שְׂעִירִים, פַּר וְשָׂעִיר לְכׇל שֵׁבֶט וְשֵׁבֶט, פַּר וְשָׂעִיר לְבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: court issued a ruling, and seven tribes, or a majority of performed on the basis of their bring a bull; and for idol worship they bring a bull and a goat. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: seven tribes that sinned bring seven bulls, and the rest of the tribes, that did not sin, brings bull on the basis of as even those who did not sin bring on the basis of sinners. Rabbi Shimon says: eight bulls And for idol worship, eight bulls and eight goats bull and goat for each and every tribe bull and goat for court.
llm_translation: They taught in the court and they did with seven tribes or the majority of them - they bring a bull, and in the case of idolatry - they bring a bull and a goat, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: for seven tribes that sinned - they bring seven bulls, and for the rest of the tribes that did not sin - they bring through them a bull, for even those that did not sin bring through the hands of the sinners. Rabbi Shimon says: eight bulls, and in the case of idolatry - eight bulls and eight goats, a bull and a goat for each tribe, a bull and a goat for the court.

hebrew_text: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אֶחָד מִן הַשְּׁבָטִים, וְעָשָׂה אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט עַל פִּיהֶן – אוֹתוֹ שֵׁבֶט הוּא חַיָּיב, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁבָטִים פְּטוּרִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא עַל הוֹרָיוֹת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל בִּלְבַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִם כׇּל עֲדַת יִשְׂרָאֵל יִשְׁגּוּ״, וְלֹא עֲדַת אוֹתוֹ שֵׁבֶט.
human_translation: court of one of the tribes issued a ruling and that tribe performed on the basis of its that tribe is liable and the rest of all the tribes exempt; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: One is liable only for rulings of the High Court alone, as it is stated: “And if the entire assembly of Israel shall act unwittingly” but not the assembly of that tribe.
llm_translation: They taught in the house of judgment of one of the tribes, and that tribe acted according to their ruling - that tribe is liable, and all the other tribes are exempt, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the sages say: Only liable for the rulings of the great court, as it is said: "And if the whole congregation of Israel sins," and not the congregation of that tribe.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יָדְעוּ שֶׁהוֹרוּ, וְטָעוּ מָה הוֹרוּ, יָכוֹל יְהוּ חַיָּיבִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנוֹדְעָה הַחַטָּאת״, וְלֹא שֶׁיִּוָּדְעוּ הַחוֹטְאִין.
human_translation: The Sages taught knew that they issued ruling, and erred ruling they issued, might they would be liable The verse states: “And the sin became known, and not where it became known to the sinners.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If they knew that they permitted, and erred in what they permitted, can it be that they are liable? The Torah teaches: "And the sin shall be known," and not that the sinners should be known.

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר חָטְאוּ״, חָטְאוּ שְׁנֵי שְׁבָטִים – מְבִיאִין שְׁנֵי פָרִים, חָטְאוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה – מְבִיאִין שְׁלֹשָׁה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹמֵר אֶלָּא חָטְאוּ שְׁנֵי יְחִידִים – מְבִיאִין שְׁנֵי פָרִים, חָטְאוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה – מְבִיאִין שְׁלֹשָׁה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַקָּהָל״, הַקָּהָל חַיָּיב, וְכׇל קָהָל וְקָהָל חַיָּיב, כֵּיצַד? חָטְאוּ שְׁנֵי שְׁבָטִים – מְבִיאִין שְׁנֵי פָרִים, חָטְאוּ שִׁבְעָה – מְבִיאִין שִׁבְעָה, וּשְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים שֶׁלֹּא חָטְאוּ – מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶן פַּר פַּר, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁלֹּא חָטְאוּ מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵי הַחוֹטְאִין, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״קָהָל״ לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל קָהָל וְקָהָל. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: “that they sinned” two tribes sinned they bring two bulls, three sinned they bring three Or says only two individuals sinned they bring two bulls, three sinned they bring three the verse states: “The congregation,” The congregation liable, and each and every congregation liable. How two tribes sinned they bring two bulls. seven sinned they bring seven And each the rest of the tribes that did not sin brings bull on the basis of as even those that did not sin bring on the basis of the sinners. For that “congregation” is stated to render each and every congregation liable. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: "Who have sinned," if two tribes have sinned - they bring two bulls, if three have sinned - they bring three, or does it only mean if two individuals have sinned - they bring two bulls, if three have sinned - they bring three? The Talmud teaches: "The congregation," the congregation is liable, and every congregation and congregation is liable, how so? If two tribes have sinned - they bring two bulls, if seven have sinned - they bring seven, and the rest of the tribes that have not sinned - they bring through their hands a bull each, for even those who have not sinned bring through the hands of the sinners. Therefore it is said "congregation" to obligate every congregation and congregation. The words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה שְׁבָטִים שֶׁחָטְאוּ – מְבִיאִין שִׁבְעָה פָּרִים, וּבֵית דִּין מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶן פַּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר לְמַטָּה ״קָהָל״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְמַעְלָה ״קָהָל״. מָה ״קָהָל״ הָאָמוּר לְמַעְלָה – בֵּית דִּין עִם הַקָּהָל, אַף ״קָהָל״ הָאָמוּר לְמַטָּה – בֵּית דִּין עִם הַקָּהָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Seven tribes that sinned bring seven bulls, and court brings bull on the basis of their as “congregation” is stated below: and “congregation” is stated above: Just as “congregation” that is stated above court, with “the congregation,” so too, “congregation” that is stated below, court with the congregation.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Seven tribes that sinned - bring seven bulls, and the court brings through them a bull, as it is said below "congregation" and it is said above "congregation." Just as the "congregation" mentioned above is the court with the congregation, so too the "congregation" mentioned below is the court with the congregation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה שְׁבָטִים שֶׁחָטְאוּ – בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין עַל יְדֵיהֶם פַּר, וְהֵן פְּטוּרִין, נֶאֱמַר ״קָהָל״ לְמַטָּה וְנֶאֱמַר ״קָהָל״ לְמַעְלָה, מָה ״קָהָל״ הָאָמוּר לְמַעְלָה – בֵּית דִּין וְלֹא צִבּוּר, אַף ״קָהָל״ הָאָמוּר לְמַטָּה – בֵּית דִּין וְלֹא צִבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: seven tribes that sinned, court brings a bull on the basis of their and are exempt, “congregation” is stated below: and “congregation” is stated above: Just as “congregation” that is stated above court and not public, so too, “congregation” that is stated below court and not public.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: Seven tribes that sinned - the court brings a bull on their behalf, and they are exempt. It is stated "congregation" below and it is stated "congregation" above, just as the "congregation" mentioned above refers to the court and not the public, so too the "congregation" mentioned below refers to the court and not the public.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: חָטְאוּ שִׁשָּׁה שְׁבָטִים וְהֵם רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל, אוֹ שִׁבְעָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל – מְבִיאִין פַּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of six tribes sinned and they a majority of congregation, or seven even though they do not a majority of congregation, brings a bull.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in his name: If six tribes sinned, and they are the majority of the congregation, or even seven, even though they are not the majority of the congregation - they bring a young bull.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״וְנוֹדְעָה הַחַטָּאת״ – וְלֹא שֶׁיִּוָּדְעוּ הַחוֹטְאִין. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רָבָא: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. דִּתְנַן,
human_translation: The Master said: “And the sin became known,” and not where it became known to the sinners. Who is the tanna Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and some say Rava that not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned
llm_translation: Master said: "And the sin shall be known" - not that the sinners shall be known. Who is the Tanna? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and some say Rava: Not like Rabbi Eliezer. As we learned:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִם חֵלֶב אָכַל – חַיָּיב, נוֹתָר אָכַל – חַיָּיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Whichever you If fat he ate liable, notar he ate liable.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: What is your intention? If one ate fat - liable, if one left over - liable.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר חָטְאוּ עָלֶיהָ״. הָתָם נָמֵי הָכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר חָטָא בָּהּ״! הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: פְּרָט לַמִּתְעַסֵּק.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even you say Rabbi Eliezer, Here, is different, as it is written: that they sinned There too, isn’t it written: that he sinned that is necessary for to exclude acts unawares.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Eliezer, it is different here, as it is written: "who have sinned against her." There, it is also written: "who has sinned with her!" That one excludes one who engages in business dealings.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? קָסָבַר: אַרְבָּעָה קְהָלֵי כְּתִיבִי – ״קָהָל״, ״הַקָּהָל״, ״קָהָל״, ״הַקָּהָל״.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda, he holds: four congregation written: Congregation, the congregation, congregation, the congregation.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? He holds: Four mentions of "קָהָל" are written in the Scriptures - "קָהָל", "הַקָּהָל", "קָהָל", "הַקָּהָל".

hebrew_text: חַד לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל קָהָל וְקָהָל, וְחַד לְהוֹרָאָה תְּלוּיָה בְּבֵית דִּין וּמַעֲשֶׂה תָּלוּי בַּקָּהָל. וְחַד לִגְרִירָה. וְחַד לְשֵׁבֶט שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: One to render each and every congregation liable, and one to ruling is dependent on court and action is dependent on the congregation; and one to drawing, and one to a tribe that performed on the ruling of court
llm_translation: One is liable for the entire congregation, and one is dependent on the ruling of the court and the action is dependent on the congregation. And one is for coercion. And one for a tribe that acted based on the ruling of the court.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן תְּלָתָא קְהָלֵי כְּתִיבִי: ״הַקָּהָל״, ״קָהָל״, ״הַקָּהָל״. ״מֵעֵינֵי הַקָּהָל״ אוֹרְחֵיהּ דִּקְרָא הוּא, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: מֵעֵינֵי דִּפְלָנְיָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, three congregation written. The congregation, congregation, The congregation, “From the eyes of the congregation.” This is the manner of the verse, as people say: From the eyes of so-and-so,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Telta three congregations of Ktivi: "HaKahal," "Kahal," "HaKahal." "Me'einei HaKahal" orechei dikra hu, kid'amri inashei: "Me'einei diflanya."

hebrew_text: חַד לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל קָהָל וְקָהָל, וּתְרֵי אַחֲרִינֵי: נֶאֱמַר לְמַטָּה ״קָהָל״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְמַעְלָה ״קָהָל״, מָה לְהַלָּן בֵּית דִּין עִם הַקָּהָל – אַף כָּאן בֵּית דִּין עִם הַקָּהָל.
human_translation: one to render each and every congregation liable, and other two “congregation” is stated below, and “congregation” is stated above. Just as there, court, with the congregation, so too, here court with the congregation.
llm_translation: One is liable for the entire congregation, and two others: it is stated below "congregation" and it is stated above "congregation," just as there, the court is with the congregation - so too here, the court is with the congregation.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, ״קָהָל״ ״הַקָּהָל״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ, הִלְכָּךְ תְּרֵי קְהָלֵי כְּתִיבִי. מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: לְנֶאֱמַר לְמַטָּה ״קָהָל״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְמַעְלָה ״קָהָל״, מָה לְהַלָּן בֵּית דִּין וְלֹא צִבּוּר – אַף כָּאן בֵּית דִּין וְלֹא צִבּוּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, He does not derive “congregation” “the congregation.” Therefore, two congregation written. necessary for him to “congregation” is stated below, and “congregation” is stated above. Just as there, court and not public, so too here, court and not public.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: "Kahal" "HaKahal" is not expounded upon, therefore two "Kahal" are written. He asks: To say below "Kahal" and to say above "Kahal," just as there it refers to the court and not the congregation - so too here it refers to the court and not the congregation.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר מַאי טַעְמָא? כְּתִיב: ״וְהָיָה אִם מֵעֵינֵי הָעֵדָה״ – אַלְמָא מִיעוּטָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵעֵינֵי״. וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי לְכׇל הָעָם בִּשְׁגָגָה״, לְמֵימְרָא דְּרוּבָּא – אִין, מִיעוּטָא – לָא.
human_translation: And what is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, It is written: “Then it shall be, if from the eyes of the congregation” Apparently, a minority as “from the eyes” is written, And it is written: “As for all the people unwittingly” to say that the majority yes, the minority no,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, what is the reason? It is written: "And if it is done unintentionally by the congregation" - this implies a limitation, as it is written: "by the congregation." And it is written: "For all the people in error" - to say in the majority case, no, in the minority case, yes.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? עָשׂוּ שִׁשָּׁה וְהֵן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל, אוֹ שִׁבְעָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל – חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: How so? six sinned and they a majority of congregation, or seven even though they do not a majority of congregation, liable
llm_translation: This is how? They made six and they are the majority of the congregation, or seven even though they are not the majority of the congregation - they are obligated.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּהוֹרָאָה תְּלוּיָה בְּבֵית דִּין וּמַעֲשֶׂה תָּלוּי בַּקָּהָל, מְנָא לְהוּ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהָיָה אִם מֵעֵינֵי הָעֵדָה נֶעֶשְׂתָה לִשְׁגָגָה״. רָבָא אָמַר: ״מִלְּכׇל הָעָם בִּשְׁגָגָה״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Meir, from where do they that ruling is dependent on court and action is dependent on the congregation? Abaye said as the verse states “Then it shall be, if it was performed unwittingly, hidden from the eyes of the congregation” Rava said: from “For all the people unwittingly”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Meir, the teaching depends on the court and the action depends on the community, from where do we derive this? Abaye said, as the verse states: "And if it was done unintentionally by the eyes of the congregation." Rava said, "From the entire people unintentionally."

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְהָיָה אִם מֵעֵינֵי הָעֵדָה נֶעֶשְׂתָה לִשְׁגָגָה״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ מִיעוּטָא, לְהָכִי כְּתִיב ״לְכׇל הָעָם בִּשְׁגָגָה״. וְאִי כְּתַב ״לְכׇל הָעָם בִּשְׁגָגָה״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: עַד דְּעָבְדִי בֵּית דִּין בַּהֲדֵי רוּבָּא, לְהָכִי כְּתִיב ״וְהָיָה אִם מֵעֵינֵי הָעֵדָה נֶעֶשְׂתָה לִשְׁגָגָה״.
human_translation: And necessary. As, had the Merciful One written “Then it shall be, if it was performed unwittingly, hidden from the eyes of the congregation” I would say: even a minority Therefore, it is written: “For all the people it was performed unwittingly.” And had written “For all the people unwittingly,” I would say: unless court performs together with the majority Therefore, it is written: “Then it shall be, if it was performed unwittingly, hidden from the eyes of the congregation,”
llm_translation: The matter is necessary, for if the Merciful One had written, "And if it was done unintentionally from the eyes of the congregation," I would say: even if it was a minority, therefore it is written, "for all the people unintentionally." And if He had written, "for all the people unintentionally," I would say: until the court performs it in the presence of the majority, therefore it is written, "And if it was done unintentionally from the eyes of the congregation."

hebrew_text: וְהָא כִּי כְּתִיבִי הָנֵי קְרָאֵי בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הוּא דִּכְתִיבִי. יָלְפִינַן ״מֵעֵינֵי״ ״מֵעֵינָי״.
human_translation: But when these verses are written, they are written with regard to idol worship, We derive “from the eyes of “from the eyes of
llm_translation: And this, for when it is written these verses in foreign worship it is written. We learn "from my eyes" "from your eyes."

hebrew_text: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁל אֶחָד וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל, מִי מַיְיתוּ שְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים אוֹ לָא? מִי אָמְרִינַן: שִׁבְעָה שְׁבָטִים הוּא דְּמַיְיתוּ שְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא רוּבָּא, אֲבָל חַד שֵׁבֶט, דְּלֵיכָּא רוּבָּא – לָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא!
human_translation: court of one issued a ruling, A dilemma was raised before According to Rabbi Yehuda, one tribe on the ruling of the High Court, are other tribes bring or not? Do we say it is seven tribes that other tribes bring together with them because there is a majority but one tribe where there is no majority not? Or perhaps is no different,
llm_translation: They taught in the court of one, etc. It was asked: If one tribe rules according to the ruling of the Great Court of Rabbi Yehuda, do the other tribes agree or not? Do we say: The seven tribes can bring the other tribes to agreement, because there is a majority, but if it is just one tribe, where there is no majority - no, or perhaps it does not matter!

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מָה הֵן מְבִיאִין? פַּר אֶחָד, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי פָרִים. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא שֶׁחָטְאוּ שִׁבְעָה, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן תְּמָנְיָא בָּעֵי! אֶלָּא דְּחָטָא שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד. בְּמַאי? אִי בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּינוֹ, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Come hear What do they bring? one bull; Rabbi Shimon says: Two bulls. What are we dealing with If we say where seven sinned, Rabbi Shimon requires eight Rather, where one tribe sinned. In what If on the ruling of its court, Rabbi Shimon does not accept Rather, is it not on a ruling of the High Court?
llm_translation: Come and hear: What do they bring? One bull. Rabbi Shimon says: Two bulls. With what are we dealing? If you say they sinned sevenfold, Rabbi Shimon requires eight! Rather, we are dealing with one tribe that sinned. With what? If you say with the ruling of their court, Rabbi Shimon does not agree! Rather, we are dealing with a sin not in accordance with the ruling of the great court.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא מַנִּי? אִי נֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא רוּבָּא בָּעֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּכְגוֹן שֶׁחָטָא שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד.
human_translation: And who is the first tanna , If we say Rabbi Meir, Doesn’t he require the majority Rather, is not Rabbi Yehuda, and where one tribe sinned
llm_translation: The Tanna of the first question? If you say it is Rabbi Meir, the majority is needed! Rather, is it not Rabbi Yehuda, and for example, when one tribe sinned.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁחָטְאוּ שִׁשָּׁה שְׁבָטִים וְהֵן רוּבָּן שֶׁל קָהָל, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: חָטְאוּ שִׁשָּׁה וְהֵן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל, אוֹ שִׁבְעָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל קָהָל – מְבִיאִין פַּר.
human_translation: says What are we dealing with here? where six tribes sinned and they a majority of congregation, and is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of six tribes sinned and they a majority of congregation, or seven even though they do not a majority of congregation, brings a bull.
llm_translation: They said, what are we dealing with here? For example, if six tribes sinned, and they are the majority of the congregation, and Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar is the one. As it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in his own name: If six sinned and they are the majority of the congregation, or seven, even though they are not the majority of the congregation - they bring a calf.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֵׁבֶט שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּינוֹ – אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט חַיָּיב, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁבָטִים פְּטוּרִין. וּבְהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל – אֲפִילּוּ שְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים חַיָּיבִים. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says: a tribe that performed on a ruling of its court, that tribe liable and all the rest of the tribes exempt. But on the ruling of the High Court, even the rest of tribes liable. Learn from it
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda says: A tribe that acted according to the ruling of its court - that tribe is liable, and all the other tribes are exempt. But if it is according to the ruling of the Great Court - even the other tribes are liable. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: וְעָשָׂה אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט עַל פִּיהֶם – אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט חַיָּיב וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַשְּׁבָטִים פְּטוּרִין. לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנָא וּשְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים פְּטוּרִים? הָא תְּנָא אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט חַיָּיב, וְכֵיוָן דִּתְנָא אוֹתוֹ הַשֵּׁבֶט חַיָּיב, מִמֵּילָא יָדַעְנָא שְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים פְּטוּרִין! אֶלָּא הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לָן, בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּינוֹ הוּא דִּשְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים פְּטוּרִים, אֲבָל בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל – אֲפִילּוּ שְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים חַיָּיבִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the mishna is also precise as teaches: and that tribe performed on the basis of its that tribe liable and all the rest of the tribes exempt. Why do I to teach: And the rest of the tribes exempt? Didn’t he teach: That tribe liable? And since he teaches: That tribe liable, we know automatically rest of tribes exempt. Rather, this is teaching us it is on the ruling of its court that the rest of tribes are exempt; but on the ruling of the High Court, even the rest of tribes liable. Learn from
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah is precise, as it teaches: "And the tribe itself shall do according to their word" - that tribe itself is liable, and all the other tribes are exempt. Why do I need to be taught that the other tribes are exempt? The Mishnah teaches that that tribe itself is liable, and since it teaches that that tribe itself is liable, we automatically know that the other tribes are exempt! Rather, this is what it comes to teach us: In the ruling of a regular court, the other tribes are exempt, but in the ruling of the Great Court - even the other tribes are liable. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מִי מַיְיתֵי אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before where one tribe performed on the ruling of the High Court, according to Rabbi Shimon are they bring or not?
llm_translation: He asked them: A tribe one that did according to the ruling of the Great Court, to Rabbi Shimon who brings it or not?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מָה הֵן מְבִיאִין? פַּר אֶחָד, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי פָרִים. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא שֶׁחָטְאוּ שִׁבְעָה – שְׁנֵי פָרִים? שְׁמֹנָה פָּרִים בָּעֵי! אֶלָּא דְּחָטָא שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד, וּבְמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּינוֹ, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לֵית לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Come hear What do they bring? one bull; Rabbi Shimon says: Two bulls. What are we dealing with If we say where seven sinned, two bulls Eight bulls are required Rather, where one tribe sinned. And in what If we say on the ruling of its court, Rabbi Shimon does not accept Rather, on a ruling of the High Court.
llm_translation: Come and hear: What do they bring? One bull. Rabbi Shimon says: Two bulls. With what are we dealing? If you say that seven tribes sinned – two bulls? We need eight bulls! Rather, if one tribe sinned, with what? If you say with the ruling of his court, Rabbi Shimon does not agree! Rather, with the ruling of the Great Court.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא: תַּנָּא קַמָּא מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר – הָא רוּבָּא בָּעֵי, אִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה – שְׁאָר שְׁבָטִים נָמֵי מַיְיתוּ! אֶלָּא הָא מַנִּי – רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, וְכִדְתַנְיָא.
human_translation: And you understand Who, is the first tanna If Rabbi Meir, Doesn’t he require the majority If Rabbi Yehuda, the rest of tribes also bring Rather, who is this is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and as it is taught
llm_translation: And it was reasoned: Did the first Tanna hold? If it is Rabbi Meir - the majority is needed, if it is Rabbi Yehuda - the rest of the tribes are also included! Rather, the first Tanna is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, as it was taught.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל הוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין הַגָּדוֹל. מַאן חֲכָמִים? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, רוּבָּא בָּעֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear And the Rabbis say: One is never liable, other than for the ruling of the High Court. Who are the Rabbis If we say Rabbi Meir, he requires a majority Rather, is it not Rabbi Shimon? Conclude from it
llm_translation: Come and hear, and the sages say: One is always obligated only for the ruling of the Great Court. Who are the sages? If you say Rabbi Meir, there is a difficulty! Rather, it is not so, it is Rabbi Shimon! Learn from it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, שֵׁבֶט אֶחָד דְּאִקְּרִי קָהָל מְנָא לְהוּ? אָמְרִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲמֹד יְהוֹשָׁפָט בִּקְהַל יְהוּדָה וִירוּשָׁלִַים (נָכַח חֲצַר בֵּית ה׳) [בְּבֵית ה׳ לִפְנֵי הֶחָצֵר] הַחֲדָשָׁה״. מַאי ״חֲדָשָׁה״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, שֶׁחִידְּשׁוּ דְּבָרִים וְאָמְרוּ: טְבוּל יוֹם, אַל יִכָּנֵס בְּמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, from where do they one tribe is characterized as a congregation? say as it is written: “And Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem before the new courtyard in the house of the Lord” What “new” Rabbi Yoḥanan says that they introduced new matters and said: One who immersed that day may not enter the Levite camp.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah and Rabbi Shimon, one tribe that is called "Kahal," what is it counted for them? They said, as it is written: "And Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem (in the courtyard of the house of the Lord) in the house of the Lord before the courtyard the new." What is "new"? Rabbi Yochanan said, that they innovated matters and said: "A tevul yom should not enter the camp of Levi."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, דַּהֲוָה נָמֵי בִּנְיָמִין! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי הִנְנִי מַפְרְךָ וְהִרְבִּיתִךָ וּנְתַתִּיךָ לִקְהַל עַמִּים וְגוֹ׳״ מַאן אִתְיְלִיד לֵיהּ הָהִיא שַׁעְתָּא? בִּנְיָמִין, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: מִתְיְלִיד לָךְ הַשְׁתָּא קָהָל אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov objects to this: From where Perhaps Jerusalem is different, as was also Benjamin. Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said as it is written “And said to me: Behold, I will make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will make of you a congregation of peoples” Who was born to him that time Benjamin. Conclude from it this the Merciful One is saying Another congregation shall be now born to you.
llm_translation: The text in English: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov objects to her: From where? Perhaps Jerusalem is different, as it was also situated in Benjamin! Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said, as it is written: “And He said to me, ‘Behold, I will make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will make you a congregation of peoples, etc.’” Who will give her that time? Benjamin. Understand from it thus did the Merciful One say: “I will make for you now another congregation.”

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שַׁבָּא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא, דִּלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא: לְכִי מִתְיְלִיד לָךְ בִּנְיָמִין, הוּא דְּהָווּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים דְּמִתְקַרְיַית קָהָל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים אִיקְּרוּ קָהָל, אַחַד עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים לֹא אִיקְּרוּ קָהָל?
human_translation: Rav Shabba said to Rav Kahana: Perhaps this the Merciful One is saying It is when Benjamin is born to you that you will have twelve tribes, who are characterized as a congregation. said to him: But twelve tribes are characterized as a congregation, eleven tribes are not characterized as a congregation?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shabba said to Rav Kahana, perhaps this is what the Merciful One meant when He said to you, "Benjamin shall be born to you, who will be called a gathering of tribes!" He said to him: Rather, twelve tribes were called a gathering, but eleven tribes were not called a gathering?

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּפַר שֵׁנִי בֶן בָּקָר תִּקַּח לְחַטָּאת״? אִם לְלַמֵּד שֶׁהֵם שְׁנַיִם, וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וַעֲשֵׂה אֶת הָאֶחָד חַטָּאת וְאֶת הָאֶחָד עֹלָה לַה׳״! [אֶלָּא] יָכוֹל [תְּהֵא] נֶאֱכֶלֶת חַטָּאת לַלְוִיִּם? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּפַר שֵׁנִי״ – שֵׁנִי לָעוֹלָה, מָה עוֹלָה לָא נֶאֱכֶלֶת,
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon says: What the verse states: “And a second young bull shall you take as a sin-offering” If to teach that they are two, isn’t it already stated: “And sacrifice the one as a sin-offering, and the other as a burnt-offering, unto the Lord” Rather, might sin-offering for the Levites shall be eaten the verse states: “And a second bull,” second to the burnt-offering Just as a burnt-offering is not eaten,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says: What is the Talmud teaching us by stating, "And a second bull of the herd you shall take for a sin offering"? If to teach that they are two, but hasn't it already been stated, "And he shall make one a sin offering and the other a burnt offering to the Lord"! Rather, could it be that the sin offering is to be eaten by the Levites? The Talmud teaches us: "And a second bull" – the second for a burnt offering, just as a burnt offering is not eaten,

hebrew_text: אַף חַטָּאת לֹא נֶאֱכֶלֶת.
human_translation: so too, sin-offering is not eaten.
llm_translation: Even a sin-offering is not eaten.

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: ״הַבָּאִים מֵהַשְּׁבִי הַגּוֹלָה הִקְרִיבוּ [עֹלוֹת] לֵאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל פָּרִים שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר וְגוֹ׳ הַכֹּל עוֹלָה״. הַכֹּל עוֹלָה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁחַטָּאת עוֹלָה! אֶלָּא הַכֹּל כָּעוֹלָה: מָה עוֹלָה לֹא נֶאֱכֶלֶת – אַף חַטָּאת לֹא נֶאֱכֶלֶת. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הֱבִיאוּם, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עַל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁעָשׂוּ בִּימֵי צִדְקִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: Similarly, Rabbi Yosei said who came out of exile sacrificed burnt-offerings to the God of Israel, twelve bulls all this was a burnt-offering enter your mind “All this was a burnt-offering”? possible that a sin-offering a burnt-offering? Rather, All this like a burnt-offering. Just as a burnt-offering is not eaten, so too, sin-offering is not eaten, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: for idol worship they brought them; and Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: for the idol worship that they practiced during the days of Zedekiah.
llm_translation: As an example of this, Rabbi Yosei said: "Those who came from the captivity of the exile brought burnt offerings to the God of Israel twelve bulls, etc., 'all burnt offerings.' Is it really all burnt offerings in your opinion? Perhaps it is a sin offering! Rather, it is all like a burnt offering: Just as a burnt offering is not eaten – so too a sin offering is not eaten." As it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: "They brought them for idolatry, and Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: For idolatry that they did in the days of King Zedekiah."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ לְהָנֵי שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חַטָּאוֹת כְּגוֹן דְּחָטְאוּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים, דְּמַיְיתוּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׂעִירִים. אִי נָמֵי דְּחָטְאוּ שִׁבְעָה שְׁבָטִים וּשְׁאָרָא אִינָךְ בִּגְרִירָה. וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, כְּגוֹן דְּחָטְאוּ אַחַד עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים, דְּמַיְיתוּ אַחַד עָשָׂר שְׂעִירִים וְאִידַּךְ דְּבֵית דִּין. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר: בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִין וְלֹא צִבּוּר, שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ? כְּגוֹן דְּחָטְאוּ וַהֲדַר חָטְאוּ וַהֲדַר חָטְאוּ, עַד תְּרֵיסַר זִימְנֵי.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Yehuda, you find these twelve sin-offerings where twelve tribes sinned as they bring twelve goats. Alternatively, where seven tribes sinned, and the rest of these drawn And according to Rabbi Shimon as well, you find where eleven tribes sinned, as they bring eleven goats and the other by the court. But according to Rabbi Meir, who says the court brings and public not, how do you find this twelve offerings? where they sinned, and then sinned and then sinned until twelve times.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rabbi Yehuda, she finds for herself twelve sin offerings, such as when they sinned twelve tribes, they bring twelve he-goats. If you say they sinned seven tribes and the rest you do not include in the count. And according to Rabbi Shimon, she finds for herself, such as when they sinned eleven tribes, they bring eleven he-goats and the other for the court. But according to Rabbi Meir who says: the court brings and not the community, how does she find twelve for them? Such as they sinned, then sinned again, and sinned again, until twelve times.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מַיְיתֵי לְהוּ הָנְהוּ דְּחָטְאוּ!
human_translation: But didn’t those who sinned die?
llm_translation: And he brought upon them those who sinned!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כִּי גְּמִירִי חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ בְּמִיתָה – הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּיָחִיד, אֲבָל לֹא בְּצִבּוּר, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מִיתָה בְּצִבּוּר. מְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַב פָּפָּא הָא? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״תַּחַת אֲבוֹתֶיךָ יִהְיוּ בָנֶיךָ״, אִי הָכִי אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָחִיד נָמֵי!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: When is learned a sin-offering whose owners have died to die this matter with regard to an individual but not with regard to a congregation, because there is no death with regard to a congregation; From where does Rav Pappa derive this? If we say from which is written: “Instead of your fathers shall be your sons” if so, even with regard to an individual as well,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: When we learn that a sin-offering whose owners died is nullified by death - those words apply to an individual, but not to a community, because death does not nullify in a community. How does Rav Papa know this? If you say it is from what is written: "Your children shall be under your fathers," even so, this applies even to an individual!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דּוּקְיָא דְּרַב פָּפָּא מִשָּׂעִיר דְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: מַיְיתֵי מִתְּרוּמַת הַלִּשְׁכָּה. וְהָא מַיְיתֵי לְהוּ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, וְהָנָךְ דְּפָיְישִׁי הֵיכִי מַיְיתוּ! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ בְּצִבּוּר קְרֵבָה.
human_translation: Rather, the inference of Rav Pappa is from the goat of the New Moon, as the Merciful One states: Bring from the collection of the chamber, But haven’t some of the Jewish people died how can those who remain bring Rather, learn from it a sin-offering whose owners have died may be sacrificed in a communal
llm_translation: Rather, the case of Rav Papa's question from Seir on Rosh Chodesh, as the Merciful One said: "Let them bring the offering of the chamber." And they brought it from Yisrael, so how did they bring it from there! Rather, learn from it: The sin offering whose owners died, if it was brought by the community, it is valid.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? שָׂעִיר דְּרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ, דִּלְמָא לָא מַיְיתוּ מִצִּבּוּר, אֲבָל הָכָא וַדַּאי מַיְיתוּ! אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דְּרַב פָּפָּא מֵהָכָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כַּפֵּר לְעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר פָּדִיתָ ה׳״ – רְאוּיָה כַּפָּרָה זוֹ שֶׁתְּכַפֵּר עַל יוֹצְאֵי מִצְרַיִם, מִדִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר פָּדִיתָ״.
human_translation: Are comparable? the goat of the New Moon, perhaps no from public died But here, certainly died, Rather, the reason of Rav Pappa is from here, as it is written “Atone for Your people Israel whom You have redeemed, Lord” This atonement is fit to atone for those who emerged from Egypt, from that it is written: “Whom You have redeemed.”
llm_translation: Who is similar? The he-goat of the head of the month, perhaps they did not bring it from the community, but here for sure they brought it! Rather, the reason is from Rav Papa from here, as it is written: "Atone for Your people Israel, whom You have redeemed, O Lord" - this atonement is fitting to atone for those who left Egypt, as it is written: "whom You have redeemed."

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, כּוּלְּהוּ אִיתִינוּן מִגּוֹ דִּמְכַפְּרָה אַחַיִּים, מְכַפְּרָה נָמֵי אַמֵּתִים. אֶלָּא הָכָא מִי הֲווֹ חַיִּים? אִין, הָכִי נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְרַבִּים מֵהַכֹּהֲנִים וְהַלְוִיִּם וְרָאשֵׁי הָאָבוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Are comparable? There, all are present since it atones for the living, it also atones for the dead. But here, are alive Yes, it is indeed so as it is written: “Many of the priests and Levites and heads of patrilineal houses,
llm_translation: Who is similar? There, all of them have from the goat of atonement, living brothers, atonement is also for the dead. Rather here, who are living? None, thus it is stated: "And many from the priests and Levites and heads of the fathers, etc."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא מוּעָטִין הֲווֹ וְלָא רַבִּים הֲווֹ! הָכְתִיב: ״(וְלֹא הִכִּירוּ בְּקוֹל) [וְאֵין הָעָם מַכִּירִים קוֹל] תְּרוּעַת הַשִּׂמְחָה לְקוֹל בְּכִי הָעָם [וְגוֹ׳] וְהַקּוֹל נִשְׁמַע עַד לְמֵרָחוֹק״.
human_translation: But perhaps those were few and were not many, Isn’t it written: “And the people could not discern the noise of the shout of joy from the noise of the weeping of the people; and the noise was heard far off”
llm_translation: And perhaps they were few and not many! It is written: "(And they did not recognize the voice) and the people do not recognize the voice of the shout of joy from the voice of the weeping of the people etc., and the voice is heard from afar."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מְזִידִין הֲווֹ? הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי – ״אֵילִים תִּשְׁעִים וְשִׁשָּׁה כְּבָשִׂים שִׁבְעִים וְשִׁבְעָה״, כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אֶלָּא הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה, הָכָא נָמֵי הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: But didn’t intentionally? It was a provisional edict So too it is reasonable, as if you do not say so, “ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs,” what correspond? Rather, was a provisional edict. Here too, it was a provisional edict.
llm_translation: The intentional ones were they? It was a temporary teaching. So too it is logical, for if you do not say so - "rams ninety-six, lambs seventy-seven," against whom? Rather, it was a temporary teaching, here too it was a temporary teaching.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מֵת אֶחָד מִן הַצִּבּוּר – חַיָּיבִין, אֶחָד מִבֵּית דִּין – פְּטוּרִין. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַב, רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: בֵּית דִּין מְבִיאִים וְלֹא צִבּוּר, הִלְכָּךְ מֵת אֶחָד מִן הַצִּבּוּר – חַיָּיבִין, דְּהָא קָאֵים כּוּלֵּיהּ בֵּית דִּין, מֵת אֶחָד מִבֵּית דִּין – פְּטוּרִין, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּת אֶחָד מִן הַשּׁוּתָּפִין, וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: the Sages taught: one of the public died, liable one of the court exempt. Who is the tanna Rav Ḥisda said Rabbi Zeira said Rav Yirmeya said Rav said: It is Rabbi Meir, who says: court, and not the public, brings Therefore, one of the public died liable, as the entire court intact. one of court died exempt, as is a sin-offering that one of the partners died, and due to that exempt.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one person from the community dies - they are obligated, if one person from the court dies - they are exempt. Who is the Tanna? Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rabbi Zeira who said in the name of Rav Yirmeya who said in the name of Rav, it is Rabbi Meir, for he said: The court brings an offering and not the community, therefore if one person from the community dies - they are obligated, because the court represents the entire community. If one person from the court dies - they are exempt, for it would be like a sin offering brought because one of the partners died, and therefore they are exempt.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: וְנוֹקְמַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: בֵּית דִּין עִם הַצִּבּוּר, מֵת אֶחָד מִן הַצִּבּוּר – חַיָּיבִין, דְּאֵין צִבּוּר מֵתִים. מֵת אֶחָד מִבֵּית דִּין – פְּטוּרִין, כִּדְאָמְרִינַן דְּחַטָּאת שׁוּתָּפִין הִיא!
human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this: And let us establish in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who says: court, with the public, one of the public died liable, as public does not die. one of court died exempt, in accordance with which we say, that it is a sin-offering partners.
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Yosef: And vengeance like Rabbi Shimon, for he said: A court with the public, if one from the public dies - they are liable, for the public do not die. If one from the court dies - they are exempt, as we say that a sin offering is a partner!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר: חַטַּאת שׁוּתָּפִין אֵינָהּ מֵתָה, דְּתַנְיָא: פַּר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁאָבְדוּ, וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶם – יָמוּתוּ כּוּלָּן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יִרְעוּ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה.
human_translation: Abaye said to We heard with regard to Rabbi Shimon that he says: A sin-offering partners is not die, as it is taught a bull and a goat of Yom Kippur were lost, and one designated other in their place, they shall all die; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: They shall graze due to that a communal sin-offering is not die.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye, we have heard from Rabbi Shimon who said: A communal sin-offering does not cause death, as it was taught: If the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur got lost, and others were designated in their place - they all shall die, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: Let them graze, for a communal sin-offering does not cause death.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: כֹּהֲנִים קָא אָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי כֹּהֲנִים, דְּאִיקְּרוּ קָהָל, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל הַכֹּהֲנִים וְעַל כׇּל עַם הַקָּהָל יְכַפֵּר״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to Priests, you say? Priests are different, as they are characterized as a congregation as it is written: “And for the priests and for all the people of the congregation he shall atone”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef: "Are you speaking about priests?" It is different with priests, for they are called a congregation, as it is written: "For the priests and for all the congregation of the people shall atone."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה נַיְיתוֹ פַּר בְּהוֹרָאָה! וְכִי תֵּימָא, הָכִי נָמֵי – טָפִי לְהוּ שְׁבָטִים.
human_translation: If that is so, let them bring a bull on ruling And if you would say indeed it is so, tribes has increased
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, let him be appointed as a bull for teaching! And if you say, so it is said - "A little one shall become a thousand."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: שִׁבְטוֹ שֶׁל לֵוִי לָא אִיקְּרוּ קָהָל, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנְנִי מַפְרְךָ וְהִרְבִּיתִךָ וּנְתַתִּיךָ לִקְהַל עַמִּים וְגוֹ׳״. כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אֲחוּזָּה – אִיקְּרִי קָהָל, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֲחוּזָּה – לָא אִיקְּרִי קָהָל.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ya’akov, said: The tribe of Levi is not characterized as a congregation, as it is written: “Behold, I will make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will make of you a congregation of peoples; any that has possession is characterized as a congregation, and any that does not have possession is not characterized as a congregation.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ahah son of Rabbi Yaakov said: The tribe of Levi was not called "congregation," as it is written: "Behold, I have broken you and increased you, and I have given you to the congregation of the peoples, etc." Anyone who has an inheritance is called a congregation, and anyone who does not have an inheritance is not called a congregation.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, חָסְרִי לְהוּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר שְׁבָטִים! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״אֶפְרַיִם וּמְנַשֶּׁה כִּרְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן יִהְיוּ לִי״. אָמַר רָבָא, וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״עַל שֵׁם אֲחֵיהֶם יִקָּרְאוּ בְּנַחֲלָתָם״, לְנַחֲלָה הוּקְשׁוּ וְלֹא לְדָבָר אַחֵר!
human_translation: If so, the twelve tribes are lacking Abaye said “Ephraim and Manasseh shall be like Reuben and Simeon to me” Rava said: But isn’t it written: “After the name of their brethren shall they be called in their inheritance” with regard to inheritance they are likened but not with regard to another matter?
llm_translation: If so, they are lacking twelve tribes! Abaye said: "Ephraim and Manasseh shall be to me like Reuben and Simeon." Rava said, but is it not written: "They shall be called by the name of their brothers in their inheritance," referring to inheritance and not to anything else!

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא חֲלוּקִין בַּדְּגָלִים! כְּנַחֲלָתָן כָּךְ חֲנִיָּיתָן, כְּדֵי לְחַלֵּק כָּבוֹד לַדְּגָלִים.
human_translation: And not But aren’t they separate with regard to the banners In accordance with their inheritances, so was their encampment in order to honor the banners,
llm_translation: And not? But they are divided by flags! Just as their inheritance, so is their encampment, in order to give honor to the flags.

hebrew_text: וְהָא חֲלוּקִים בַּנְּשִׂיאִים! הָהוּא, לַחֲלוֹק כָּבוֹד לַנְּשִׂיאִים. דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁלֹמֹה עָשָׂה שִׁבְעָה יְמֵי חֲנוּכָּה, וּמָה רָאָה מֹשֶׁה לַעֲשׂוֹת שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר יְמֵי חֲנוּכָּה? כְּדֵי לַחֲלוֹק כָּבוֹד לַנְּשִׂיאִים.
human_translation: But aren’t they separate with regard to princes That in order to honor the princes, as it is taught Solomon set seven days of dedication and what did Moses see to set twelve days of dedication in order to honor the princes,
llm_translation: The Gemara: And are they divided among the princes! That one, to divide honor among the princes. As it was taught in a Baraita: Solomon made seven days of dedication, and what did Moses see to do twelve days of dedication? In order to divide honor among the princes.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ?
human_translation: What was about
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Alah"?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר, חָמֵשׁ חַטָּאוֹת מֵתוֹת: וְלַד חַטָּאת, וּתְמוּרַת חַטָּאת, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁנִּתְכַּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתָהּ. וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר וְלַד חַטָּאת בְּצִבּוּר, שֶׁאֵין צִבּוּר מַפְרִישִׁין נְקֵבָה. וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר תְּמוּרַת חַטָּאת בְּצִבּוּר, שֶׁאֵין תְּמוּרָה בְּצִבּוּר. וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ בְּצִבּוּר, שֶׁאֵין צִבּוּר מֵתִים.
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: five sin-offerings die, The offspring of a sin-offering the substitute of a sin-offering, a sin-offering whose owners have died; a sin-offering whose owners’ atoned and a sin-offering whose year has passed, And you cannot state the offspring of a communal sin-offering, as congregation does not designate a female And you cannot state a substitute of a communal sin-offering, as there is no substitute for a communal And you cannot state a sin-offering whose owners have died in a communal as public does not die.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, there are five types of sin offerings that result in death: the sin offering of a woman after childbirth, the substitute sin offering, the sin offering whose owners died, the sin offering whose owners were atoned for, and the sin offering whose appointed time has passed. And you cannot say that the sin offering of a woman after childbirth can be brought by the community, for the community does not separate a female. And you cannot say that the substitute sin offering can be brought by the community, for there is no substitution in the community. And you cannot say that the sin offering whose owners died can be brought by the community, for the community does not die.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנִּתְכַּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ וְשֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתָהּ – לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ, יָכוֹל יָמוּתוּ? אָמַרְתָּ: יִלְמוֹד סָתוּם מִן הַמְפוֹרָשׁ, מַה מָּצִינוּ בִּוְלַד חַטָּאת וּתְמוּרַת חַטָּאת וְשֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ – בְּיָחִיד דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים וְלֹא בְּצִבּוּר, אַף שֶׁנִּתְכַּפְּרוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ וְשֶׁעָבְרָה שְׁנָתָהּ – בְּיָחִיד דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים וְלֹא בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: whose owners’ atoned and whose year has passed, we did not hear might shall die. You say: One shall derive vague from the explicit. What did we find with regard to the offspring of a sin-offering, the substitute of a sin-offering, and whose owners died? are stated with regard to an individual but not with regard to a communal So too, a sin-offering whose owners’ atoned and whose year has passed are stated with regard to an individual but not with regard to a communal
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If they achieved atonement for their owners, and she transgressed her year - we did not hear, can they die? You said: Let him learn the closed from the explicit, just as we find with the offspring of a sin-offering and the exchange of a sin-offering, that if they caused the death of their owners - it is in the case of individual matters and not communal matters, so too if they achieved atonement for their owners, and she transgressed her year - it is in the case of individual matters and not communal matters."

hebrew_text: וְכִי דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּחַד מָקוֹם גְּמִיר.
human_translation: And does one derive possible from impossible? Rabbi Shimon learns in one place,
llm_translation: "And can one judge 'possible' from 'impossible'? Rabbi Shimon in one place concludes."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין
llm_translation: We will return to you, our teacher, the court has instructed.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹרָה כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ לְעַצְמוֹ שׁוֹגֵג וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג – מֵבִיא פַּר. שׁוֹגֵג וְעָשָׂה מֵזִיד, מֵזִיד וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג – פָּטוּר, שֶׁהוֹרָאַת כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ לְעַצְמוֹ כְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין לַצִּבּוּר.
human_translation: an anointed priest, issued ruling for himself unwittingly and unwittingly performed bring a bull unwittingly, and performed intentionally, intentionally and performed unwittingly, exempt as the ruling of an anointed priest for himself is like the ruling of the court for the public.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If the anointed Kohen (High Priest) ruled for himself unintentionally and acted unintentionally - he brings a bull. If he acted intentionally after ruling unintentionally, or if he ruled intentionally and acted unintentionally - he is exempt, because the ruling of the anointed Kohen for himself is like the ruling of the court for the public.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שׁוֹגֵג וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג – מֵבִיא פַּר. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: unwittingly and unwittingly performed bring a bull. obvious?
llm_translation: "Gemara: 'Gem shogeg ve'asa shogeg - mevi par.' Peshita!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוֹרָה, וְשָׁכַח מֵאֵיזֶה טַעַם הוֹרָה, וּבְשָׁעָה שֶׁטָּעָה אָמַר: הֲרֵינִי עוֹשֶׂה עַל דַּעַת הוֹרָאָתוֹ, דְּמַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ מִתְיְדַע לֵיהּ, [שֶׁמָּא] הָדַר בֵּיהּ – כְּמֵזִיד דָּמֵי וְלָא לִחַיַּיב, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Abaye said: What are we dealing with here? where he issued ruling and forgot the reason that he issued the ruling, and at the moment that he erred he said: I am hereby performing with ruling in mind. As, lest you say: Since if the reason became known to him perhaps he would have retracted his like an intentional and let him not be liable teaches us
llm_translation: Abaye said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, one who teaches and forgets from which reason he taught, and at the time he erred, he said: "Behold, I am acting according to the opinion of my teacher," for you might say: since if he would have known the correct reason, he would have retracted – it is considered intentional but not liable, and this is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מֵזִיד וְעָשָׂה שׁוֹגֵג כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לְאַשְׁמַת הָעָם״, הֲרֵי מָשִׁיחַ כְּצִבּוּר. שֶׁיָּכוֹל, וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא:
human_translation: intentionally and performed unwittingly, From where are these matters, as the Sages taught so as to bring guilt upon the people” anointed is like public. As might Could this not logical inference?
llm_translation: Intentional and unintentional, etc. From where are these matters? For the Rabbis taught: "For the sake of the people," behold, the Messiah is like the congregation. That he is able, and is it not a just law?

hebrew_text: צִבּוּר מוּצָא מִכְּלַל יָחִיד, וּמָשִׁיחַ מוּצָא מִכְּלַל יָחִיד. מָה צִבּוּר אֵין חַיָּיבִין אֶלָּא עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה, אַף מָשִׁיחַ לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: public is removed from the category of an individual, And an anointed is removed from the category of an individual, just as public is liable only for absence of matter with unwitting of an action so too, an anointed will be liable only for absence of matter with unwitting of an action.
llm_translation: Assembly finds from general individual, and anointed finds from general individual. What assembly not liable except on inadvertent matter with negligent act, so anointed not shall be liable except on inadvertent matter with negligent act.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: נָשִׂיא מוּצָא מִכְּלַל יָחִיד, וּמָשִׁיחַ מוּצָא מִכְּלַל יָחִיד. מָה נָשִׂיא מֵבִיא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה בְּלֹא הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר, אַף מָשִׁיחַ מֵבִיא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה בְּלֹא הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר!
human_translation: Or go this way A king [ Nasi ] is removed from the category of an individual, And an anointed is removed from the category of an individual. just as a king brings for unwitting of an action, without absence of matter so too, an anointed brings for unwitting of an action, without absence of matter
llm_translation: Or like this: A prince brings a sin offering from the communal funds, and the anointed high priest brings a sin offering from the communal funds. Just as a prince brings an unintentional sin offering without any concealment of the matter, so too the anointed high priest brings an unintentional sin offering without any concealment of the matter!

hebrew_text: נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה? צִבּוּר – בְּפַר וְאֵין מְבִיאִין אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, וּמָשִׁיחַ – בְּפַר וְאֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. מָה צִבּוּר אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה, אַף מָשִׁיחַ לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Let us see to which is simi-lar. public with a bull and does not bring a provisional guilt-offering, and an anointed with a bull and does not bring a provisional guilt-offering. Just as public is liable only for absence of matter with unwitting of an action so too, an anointed will be liable only for absence of matter with unwitting of an action.
llm_translation: It appears to whom is it similar? The congregation - with a bull, and they do not bring a guilt offering suspended, and the anointed one - with a bull, and they do not bring a guilt offering suspended. Just as the congregation is only liable for inadvertent transgression of a matter with a negligent act, so too the anointed one is only liable for inadvertent transgression of a matter with a negligent act.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: נָשִׂיא מֵבִיא שְׂעִירָה בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּמֵבִיא אָשָׁם וַדַּאי, וּמָשִׁיחַ מֵבִיא שְׂעִירָה בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וּמֵבִיא אָשָׁם וַדַּאי. מָה נָשִׂיא מֵבִיא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה, אַף מָשִׁיחַ מֵבִיא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Or go this way The king brings a female goat for idol worship and brings a definite guilt-offering and an anointed brings a female goat for idol worship and brings a definite guilt-offering Just as a king brings for unwitting of an action so too, an anointed brings for unwitting of an action
llm_translation: Or like to the way: A prince brings a he-goat in a foreign service and brings a guilt-offering for certain, and a high priest brings a he-goat in a foreign service and brings a guilt-offering for certain. Just as a prince brings in an unwitting transgression, so too a high priest brings in an unwitting transgression.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לְאַשְׁמַת הָעָם״, הֲרֵי הוּא מָשִׁיחַ כְּצִבּוּר. מָה צִבּוּר אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶלָּא עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה, אַף מָשִׁיחַ אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא אֶלָּא עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: the verse states: so as to bring guilt upon the people” anointed is like public. just as public brings only for absence of matter with unwitting of an action so too, an anointed brings only for absence of matter with unwitting of an action.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "For the sin offering of the people," he is anointed as a leader of the community. Just as the community brings an offering only for an unwitting transgression of a matter involving action, so too, the anointed one brings an offering only for an unwitting transgression of a matter involving action.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: מָה צִבּוּר הוֹרָה וְעָשׂוּ אַחֲרָיו בְּהוֹרָאָתוֹ – חַיָּיבִין, אַף מָשִׁיחַ כְּשֶׁהוֹרָה וְעָשׂוּ אַחֲרָיו בְּהוֹרָאָתוֹ – יְהֵא חַיָּיב! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהִקְרִיב עַל חַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר חָטָא״, עַל מָה שֶׁחָטָא הוּא מֵבִיא, וְאֵין מֵבִיא עַל מָה שֶׁחָטְאוּ אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: say: Just as public, issued a ruling and performed after its in accordance with its ruling, liable, so too, an anointed when he issued a ruling and performed after his in accordance with his ruling, he should be liable. the verse states “Then he shall offer for his sin that he has sinned” He brings for that that he sinned but he does not bring for that that others sinned
llm_translation: אֵימָא: - "What if the congregation taught and acted after his teaching - they are liable." Even the anointed high priest, when he teaches and acts after his teaching - let him be liable! The Scripture states: "And he shall offer for his sin which he hath sinned," - for what he himself sinned he brings, but he does not bring for what others have sinned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מָשִׁיחַ בְּפַר וְאֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. מְנָא לֵיהּ דְּאֵין מֵבִיא אָשָׁם תָּלוּי?
human_translation: the Master said: An anointed with a bull and does not bring a provisional guilt-offering. From where does that does not bring a provisional guilt-offering?
llm_translation: Master said: The Messiah comes on a donkey, and does not bring a guilt offering. How do we know that he does not bring a guilt offering?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלָיו הַכֹּהֵן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ אֲשֶׁר שָׁגָג״, מִי שֶׁחַטָּאתוֹ וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ שָׁוָה, יָצָא מָשִׁיחַ שֶׁאֵין שִׁגְגָתוֹ וְחַטָּאתוֹ שָׁוָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְאַשְׁמַת הָעָם״, הֲרֵי הוּא מָשִׁיחַ כְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: as it is written “And the priest shall atone for him for his unwitting act that he performed unwittingly” one whose transgression and his unwitting are equal, exclude an anointed whose unwitting and his transgression are not equal, As it is written “So as to bring guilt upon the people” anointed is like public.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is written: "And the priest shall make atonement for him for his error that he erred," one whose sin offering and error are equal, the anointed High Priest has emerged. For one whose error and sin offering are not equal, as it is written: "For the guilt of the people," he is anointed like the community.

hebrew_text: ״לְאַשְׁמַת הָעָם״, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא אָשָׁם כְּדִי נַסְבַהּ.
human_translation: “So as to bring guilt upon the people”? To this point, did not state Rather, for no reason.
llm_translation: "For the guilt offering," until here it did not say to him. Rather, a guilt offering in order to elevate it."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הוֹרָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְעָשָׂה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. הוֹרָה עִם הַצִּבּוּר וְעָשָׂה עִם הַצִּבּוּר – מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר, שֶׁאֵין בֵּית דִּין חַיָּיבִין עַד שֶׁיּוֹרוּ לְבַטֵּל מִקְצָת וּלְקַיֵּים מִקְצָת, וְכֵן הַמָּשִׁיחַ, וְלֹא בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה עַד שֶׁיּוֹרוּ לְבַטֵּל מִקְצָת וּלְקַיֵּים מִקְצָת.
human_translation: issued a ruling by himself and performed by himself, he achieves atonement by himself he issued a ruling with the public, and performed with the public, he achieves atonement with the public. As, the court is not liable unless issue a ruling to nullify part and to sustain part and likewise the anointed And not with regard to idol worship unless they issue a ruling to nullify part and to sustain part
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one teaches privately and performs the act privately - he achieves atonement for himself privately. If one teaches publicly and performs the act publicly - he achieves atonement for himself publicly, for the court is not liable until they instruct to annul some and uphold some, and so too the anointed priest, and not in foreign worship until they instruct to annul some and uphold some.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוֹרָה עִם הַצִּבּוּר וְעָשָׂה עִם הַצִּבּוּר, יָכוֹל יָבִיא פַּר לְעַצְמוֹ?
human_translation: From where is this matter as the Sages taught issued a ruling with the public and performed with the public, might bring a bull for himself.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the case of "menahanei milei"? For the Rabbis taught: If one teaches publicly and acts publicly, can he bring a bull for himself?

hebrew_text: וְדִין הוּא: נָשִׂיא מוּצָא מִכְּלַל יָחִיד וּמָשִׁיחַ מוּצָא מִכְּלַל יָחִיד, מָה נָשִׂיא, חָטָא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – מֵבִיא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, חָטָא עִם הַצִּבּוּר – מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר. אַף מָשִׁיחַ, חָטָא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – מֵבִיא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, חָטָא עִם הַצִּבּוּר – מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר!
human_translation: And is a logical inference A king is removed from the category of an individual and an anointed is removed from the category of an individual, Just as a king, he sinned by himself he brings by himself, he sinned with the public, he achieves atonement with the public, so too, an anointed he sinned by himself he brings by himself, he sinned with the public, he achieves atonement with the public.
llm_translation: And the judgment is: If a prince sins from the category of an individual, and the anointed one sins from the category of an individual, what is the case with a prince? If he sinned privately - he brings a sacrifice privately; if he sinned publicly - he atones with the public. Likewise, the anointed one, if he sinned privately - he brings a sacrifice privately; if he sinned publicly - he atones with the public!

hebrew_text: לֹא, אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּנָשִׂיא – שֶׁכֵּן מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. תֹּאמַר בְּמָשִׁיחַ – שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים!
human_translation: No, if you said with regard to a king as he achieves atonement with the public on Yom Kippur. Shall you say with regard to an anointed who does not achieve atonement with the public on Yom Kippur
llm_translation: Not, if you say in a prince - that indeed atones for him with the community on the Day of Atonement. You will say in the Messiah - that he does not atone for him with the community on the Day of Atonement!

hebrew_text: הוֹאִיל וְאֵין מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, יָכוֹל יָבִיא פַּר לְעַצְמוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַל חַטָּאתוֹ אֲשֶׁר חָטָא״, הָא כֵּיצַד? חָטָא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ – מֵבִיא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, חָטָא עִם הַצִּבּוּר – מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ עִם הַצִּבּוּר.
human_translation: Since he does not achieve atonement with the public on Yom Kippur, might he will bring a bull for himself the verse states: for his sin that he has sinned” How so? he sinned by himself he brings by himself; he sinned with the public, he achieves atonement with the public.
llm_translation: Since he is not atoned for with the congregation on Yom Kippur, can he bring a bull for himself? The verse teaches: "For his sin that he committed." How so? If he sinned individually - he brings the offering individually; if he sinned with the congregation - he is atoned for with the congregation.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּהוּא מוּפְלָא וְהֵם אֵינָן מוּפְלָאִין, פְּשִׁיטָא דְּמִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, הוֹרָאָה דִּלְהוֹן וְלֹא כְּלוּם. וּבָעֵי אֵתוֹיֵי כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה כֹּל חַד וְחַד! וְאִי דְּאִינּוּן מוּפְלָאִין וְהוּא לָאו מוּפְלָא, אַמַּאי מִתְכַּפֵּר לוֹ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ? הָא הוֹרָאָה דִּידֵיהּ וְלֹא כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say where is a distinguished and are not distinguished obvious that he achieves atonement by himself, their ruling is nothing And each and every one needs to bring a ewe or female goat And where are distinguished and he is not a distinguished why does he achieve atonement by himself? Isn’t his ruling nothing at all,
llm_translation: How are they similar? If you say that he is extraordinary and they are not extraordinary, it is obvious that he atones for himself, a teaching for them and not for him. And if they require a female goat or a female sheep, each one separately! And if they are not extraordinary and he is not extraordinary, why does he atone for himself? This is a teaching for himself and not for them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ מוּפְלִין שְׁנֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: where both were distinguished
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: For example, they were both invalid.

hebrew_text: סָבַר אַבָּיֵי לְמֵימַר: חָטָא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וְעָשָׂה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? דְּיָתְבִי בִּשְׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת וְקָא מוֹרוּ בִּתְרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אַטּוּ שְׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת גּוֹרְמִין? אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ יָתְבִי בְּחַד מָקוֹם, וְכֵיוָן דְּקָא מוֹרוּ בִּתְרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי – חָטָא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: Abaye thought to say sinned by himself and performed by himself, what are the circumstances? where were convened in two places and issuing rulings with regard to two prohibitions. Rava said to Is that to say two places determines Rather, even are convened in one place. But since they are issuing rulings with regard to two prohibitions, it is sinned by himself.
llm_translation: Abaye thought to say: If one sinned in private and performed the act in private, what is the comparison? That he is situated in two places and they are teaching him two prohibitions. Rava said to him: Do two places cause it? Rather, even if he is situated in one place, and since they are teaching him two prohibitions - he has sinned in private.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא: הוּא בְּחֵלֶב וְהֵן בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה – חָטָא בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא, דְּהָא חֲלוּקִין בְּטַעְמַיְיהוּ, וַחֲלוּקִין בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹת. דְּהוּא בְּפַר, וְהֵן בְּפַר וְשָׂעִיר – דְּהָא קָא מַיְיתוּ הָנֵי שָׂעִיר, וְהוּא לָא מַיְיתֵי. וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן הוּא בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה וְהֵן בְּחֵלֶב, דַּחֲלוּקִין בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹתֵיהֶן [לִגְמָרֵי] – דְּהוּא שְׂעִירָה, וְאִינְהוּ פַּר,
human_translation: obvious with regard to fat and with regard to idol worship, it is sinned by himself. As are distinct in their reasons, and they are distinct in their offerings, since with a bull and with a bull and a goat as these bring a goat and does not bring And all the more so with regard to idol worship and with regard to fat, it is as are totally distinct in their offerings, since a female goat and a bull.
llm_translation: The Gemara: It is in the case of the bull, and they are in the case of idol worship - he sinned by himself, for they differ in their tastes, and they differ in their sacrifices. It is in the case of a bull, and they are in the case of a bull and a goat - for they bring that goat, and he does not bring it. And certainly so it is in the case of idol worship and they are in the case of the bull, for they differ completely in their sacrifices - it is a goat, and they are bulls.
