hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הֲווֹ אָזְלִי בִּסְפִינְתָּא, בַּהֲדֵי דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הֲוָה פִּיתָּא, בַּהֲדֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הֲוָה פִּיתָּא וְסוּלְתָּא. שְׁלִים פִּיתֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, סְמַךְ אַסּוּלְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי הֲוָה יָדְעַתְּ דְּהָוֵה לַן עִכּוּבָא כּוּלֵּי הַאי דְּאַיְתֵית סוּלְתָּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כּוֹכָב אֶחָד לְשִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה עוֹלֶה וּמַתְעֶה אֶת (הַסְּפִינוֹת) [הַסַּפָּנִים], וְאָמַרְתִּי: שֶׁמָּא יַעֲלֶה וְיַתְעֶה [אוֹתָנוּ].
human_translation: similar that where Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua were traveling on a ship. Rabban Gamliel had bread Rabbi Yehoshua had bread, and flour. Rabban Gamliel’s bread was finished. He relied on Rabbi Yehoshua’s flour said to Did you know that we would have so substantial a delay? that you brought flour said to There is one star that rises once in seventy years and misleads sailors And I said: Perhaps will rise and mislead us.
llm_translation: The matter of Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Yehoshua, they were traveling on a ship, with Rabban Gamliel having bread, and Rabbi Yehoshua having bread and flour. Rabban Gamliel finished his bread, leaned on the flour of Rabbi Yehoshua. He said to him: Did you know that we would need all this flour that you brought? He said to him: One star rises once in seventy years and misleads the ships, and I said: Perhaps it will rise and mislead us.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כׇּל כָּךְ בְּיָדְךָ, וְאַתָּה עוֹלֶה בִּסְפִינָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד שֶׁאַתָּה תָּמֵהַּ עָלַי, תְּמַהּ עַל שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידִים שֶׁיֵּשׁ לְךָ בַּיַּבָּשָׁה, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַסָּמָא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא, שֶׁיּוֹדְעִין לְשַׁעֵר כַּמָּה טִפּוֹת יֵשׁ בַּיָּם, וְאֵין לָהֶם פַּת לֶאֱכוֹל וְלֹא בֶּגֶד לִלְבּוֹשׁ! נָתַן דַּעְתּוֹ לְהוֹשִׁיבָם בָּרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: said to him: So much at your and you board a ship said to him: Before you wonder about me, wonder about two students that you have on dry land, Rabbi Elazar Ḥisma and Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Gudgeda, who know to calculate how many drops there are in the sea, and they have neither bread to eat nor a garment to wear. made up his mind to seat them at the head
llm_translation: He said to him: "All this is in your hands, and you are going up by ship?" He said to him: "Until you are amazed at me, be amazed at the two disciples that you have in the desert, Rabbi Elazar Hasama and Rabbi Yochanan ben Gudgeda, who know how to estimate how many drops are in the sea, and they have no bread to eat and no clothes to wear!" He decided to appoint them as leaders.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁעָלָה, שָׁלַח לָהֶם וְלֹא בָּאוּ, חָזַר וְשָׁלַח וּבָאוּ. אָמַר לָהֶם: כִּמְדוּמִּין אַתֶּם שֶׁשְּׂרָרָה אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָכֶם?
human_translation: When ascended he sent to them and they did not come. He again sent and they came. said to them: Do you imagine that I am granting you authority,
llm_translation: When it went up, he sent to them and they did not come, he went back and sent and they came. He said to them: Are you like governors that I should give you authority?

hebrew_text: עַבְדוּת אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לָכֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְדַבְּרוּ אֵלָיו לֵאמֹר אִם הַיּוֹם תִּהְיֶה עֶבֶד לָעָם הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: I am granting you servitude, as it is stated: “And they spoke to him saying: If you will be a servant to this people today”
llm_translation: Service I give to you, as it is stated: "And they spoke to him, saying, 'If you will be a servant to this people today.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אֲשֶׁר נָשִׂיא יֶחֱטָא״, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: אַשְׁרֵי הַדּוֹר שֶׁהַנָּשִׂיא שֶׁלּוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ. אִם נָשִׂיא שֶׁלּוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן, צָרִיךְ אַתָּה לוֹמַר מַהוּ הֶדְיוֹט! וְאִם עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן, צָרִיךְ אַתָּה לוֹמַר מַהוּ זְדוֹנוֹ!
human_translation: The Sages taught: “When [ asher ] a king sins” Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said: Happy [ ashrei ] is the generation whose king bring an offering for his unwitting If king brings an offering, you must say what a commoner And if brings an offering for his unwitting you must say what his intentional
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "When a leader sins," Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai said: "Fortunate is the generation whose leader brings an offering for his unintentional sin. If his leader brings an offering, do you need to say what about the commoner! And if he brings an offering for his unintentional sin, do you need to say what about his intentional sin!"

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר חָטָא מִן הַקֹּדֶשׁ יְשַׁלֵּם״, וּבְיָרׇבְעָם בֶּן נְבָט, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״אֲשֶׁר חָטָא וַאֲשֶׁר הֶחֱטִיא״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּאַשְׁרֵי הַדּוֹר הוּא! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּשַׁנִּי קְרָא בְּדִבּוּרֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava, son of Rabba, objects to this: If that is so, which is written: “And he shall pay for that which [ asher ] he has sinned from the sacred item” and with regard to Jeroboam, son of Nevat, about whom it is written: “Who [ asher ] sinned and caused others to sin” so too that this generation is happy? Here, is different, as the verse altered its formulation;
llm_translation: Rava son of Rabba objected to her: Rather, from now on, as it is written: "And he shall make restitution for that which he has sinned in the holy thing," and concerning Jeroboam son of Nebat, as it is written about him: "Who sinned and made Israel to sin," so too it is said here, that the verse is stated explicitly.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״יֶשׁ הֶבֶל אֲשֶׁר נַעֲשָׂה עַל הָאָרֶץ וְגוֹ׳״ – אַשְׁרֵיהֶם לַצַּדִּיקִים, שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ אֲלֵיהֶם כְּמַעֲשֵׂה הָרְשָׁעִים שֶׁל עוֹלָם הַבָּא בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה. אוֹי לָהֶם לָרְשָׁעִים, שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ אֲלֵיהֶם כְּמַעֲשֵׂה הַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁל עוֹלָם הַבָּא בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Ḥisda interpreted What which is written: “There is a vanity that is [ asher ] performed upon the earth; Happy [ ashrei ] are the righteous, to whom it happens in this world according to the experiences of the wicked in the World-to-Come, Woe unto the wicked, to whom it happens in this world according to the experiences of the righteous in the World-to-Come,
llm_translation: Rav Nahman son of Rav Hisda expounded, what is the meaning of the verse: "There is a vanity that is done upon the earth, etc." - Fortunate are the righteous, for they receive in this world the reward of the wicked in the World to Come. Woe to the wicked, for they receive in this world the reward of the righteous in the World to Come.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַטּוּ צַדִּיקֵי אִי אָכְלִי תְּרֵי עָלְמֵי מִי סְנֵי לְהוּ? אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אַשְׁרֵיהֶם לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ אֲלֵיהֶם כְּמַעֲשֵׂה הָרְשָׁעִים שֶׁל עוֹלָם הַזֶּה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, אוֹי לָהֶם לָרְשָׁעִים שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ אֲלֵיהֶם כְּמַעֲשֵׂה הַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁל עוֹלָם הַזֶּה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה.
human_translation: Rava said: Is that to say that if the righteous enjoyed two worlds it would be awful for them? Rather, Rava said Happy are the righteous to whom it happens in this world according to the experiences of the wicked in this world, Woe to the wicked, to whom it happens in this world according to the experiences of the righteous in this world,
llm_translation: Rava said: Do the righteous in this world enjoy even two worlds? Rather, Rava said: Fortunate are the righteous, for they receive in this world the reward of the wicked in this world, and woe to the wicked who receive in this world the reward of the righteous in this world.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אוֹקֵימְתּוּן מַסֶּכְתָּא פְּלָן וּמַסֶּכְתָּא פְּלָן? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין. אִיעַתְּרִיתוּ פּוּרְתָּא? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִין, דִּזְבַנַן קַטִּינָא דְּאַרְעָא. קָרֵי עֲלַיְיהוּ: אַשְׁרֵיהֶם לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ אֲלֵיהֶם כְּמַעֲשֵׂה הָרְשָׁעִים שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, came before Rava. said to them: Have you mastered this tractate and that tractate? They said to him: Yes. Have you become somewhat wealthy? They said to him: Yes, as us bought a parcel of land proclaimed about them: Happy are the righteous, to whom it happens in this world according to the actions of the wicked in this world.
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, came before Rava. He said to them: Have you established this tractate and that tractate? They said to him: No. Have you reviewed it thoroughly? They said to him: No, for we are like a small fish in the land. He recited regarding them: "Fortunate are the righteous, for they will receive their reward like the deeds of the wicked in this world."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יְשָׁרִים דַּרְכֵי ה׳ וְצַדִּקִים יֵלְכוּ בָם וּפֹשְׁעִים יִכָּשְׁלוּ בָם״? מָשָׁל לִשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁצָּלוּ פִּסְחֵיהֶם, אֶחָד אֲכָלוֹ לְשׁוּם מִצְוָה, וְאֶחָד אֲכָלוֹ לְשׁוּם אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה. זֶה שֶׁאֲכָלוֹ לְשׁוּם מִצְוָה – ״צַדִּקִים יֵלְכוּ בָם״, זֶה שֶׁאֲכָלוֹ לְשׁוּם אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה – ״וּפֹשְׁעִים יִכָּשְׁלוּ בָם״.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What which is written: “For the ways of the Lord are right, and the righteous will walk in them and transgressors will stumble in them” comparable to two people who roasted their Paschal offerings. One ate it for the sake of mitzva, and one ate it for the sake of excessive eating. that who ate it for the sake of mitzva, “The righteous will walk in them.” that who ate it for the sake of excessive eating, “And transgressors will stumble in them.”
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the meaning of what is written: "For the ways of the Lord are straight, and the righteous walk in them, but the wicked stumble in them"? It is a parable to two people who ate their Passover sacrifices, one ate for the sake of a mitzvah, and one ate for the sake of gluttony. This one who ate for the sake of a mitzvah - "the righteous walk in them," and this one who ate for the sake of gluttony - "but the wicked stumble in them."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רָשָׁע קָרֵית לֵיהּ? נְהִי דְּלָא עָבֵיד מִצְוָה מִן הַמּוּבְחָר, פֶּסַח מִי לָא קָאָכֵיל? אֶלָּא: מָשָׁל לִשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם, זֶה אִשְׁתּוֹ וַאֲחוֹתוֹ עִמּוֹ בַּבַּיִת, וְזֶה אִשְׁתּוֹ וַאֲחוֹתוֹ עִמּוֹ בַּבַּיִת, אֶחָד נִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֶחָד נִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ אֲחוֹתוֹ, זֶה שֶׁנִּזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ – ״צַדִּקִים יֵלְכוּ בָּם״, וְזֶה שֶׁנִּזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ אֲחוֹתוֹ – ״וּפֹשְׁעִים יִכָּשְׁלוּ בָם״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Did you call wicked? Although he did not perform mitzva ideal didn’t he eat Paschal offering? Rather, analogous to two people; this his wife and his sister with him in house and that his wife and his sister with him in house. One his wife happened to him and one, his sister happened to him that to whom his wife happened “The righteous will walk in them.” that to whom his sister happened “And transgressors will stumble in them.”
llm_translation: He said to him, Reish Lakish: "You call him wicked?" Isn't it that he did not perform a mitzvah from the choicest, the Passover, who does not eat? Rather, it is a parable to two men, this one, his wife and sister are with him in the house, and this one, his wife and sister are with him in the house, one his wife happens to be encountered by him, and one his sister happens to be encountered by him, this one whose wife happens to be encountered by him - "the righteous will walk in them," and this one whose sister happens to be encountered by him - "and the transgressors will stumble in them."

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? אֲנַן קָאָמְרִינַן חֲדָא דֶּרֶךְ, וְהָכָא שְׁנֵי דְּרָכִים! אֶלָּא מָשָׁל לְלוֹט וּשְׁתֵּי בְנוֹתָיו, הֵן שֶׁנִּתְכַּוְּונוּ לְשֵׁם מִצְוָה – ״צַדִּקִים יֵלְכוּ בָם״, הוּא שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּון לְשֵׁם עֲבֵירָה – ״וּפֹשְׁעִים יִכָּשְׁלוּ בָם״.
human_translation: Are these comparable? we are speaking of one path and here, two paths, Rather, analogous to Lot and his two daughters who, intended for the sake of a mitzva, “The righteous will walk in them.” who intended for the sake of a transgression, “And transgressors will stumble in them.”
llm_translation: Who is similar? We are saying one path, and here two paths! Rather, a parable to Lot and his two daughters, if they intended for the sake of a commandment - "the righteous will walk in them," if they intended for the sake of a transgression - "and the wicked will stumble in them."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הוּא נָמֵי לְשֵׁם מִצְוָה (הוּא מְכַוֵּין) [אִיכַּוַּון]! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, כׇּל הַפָּסוּק הַזֶּה לְשֵׁם עֲבֵירָה נֶאֱמַר.
human_translation: Perhaps too intended for the sake of a mitzva. Rabbi Yoḥanan says this entire verse: is stated in the context of transgression.
llm_translation: And perhaps he is standing there for the sake of a commandment (he is intending)! Rabbi Yochanan said, "This entire verse was said for the sake of transgression."

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּשָּׂא לוֹט״ – ״וַתִּשָּׂא אֵשֶׁת אֲדֹנָיו אֶת עֵינֶיהָ״, ״אֶת עֵינָיו״ – ״וַיֹּאמֶר שִׁמְשׁוֹן [וְגוֹ׳] אוֹתָהּ קַח לִי כִּי הִיא יָשְׁרָה בְעֵינָי״, ״וַיַּרְא״ – ״וַיַּרְא אֹתָהּ שְׁכֶם בֶּן חֲמוֹר״, ״אֶת כׇּל כִּכַּר הַיַּרְדֵּן״ – ״כִּי בְעַד אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה עַד כִּכַּר לָחֶם״, ״כִּי כֻלָּהּ מַשְׁקֶה״ – ״אֵלְכָה אַחֲרֵי מְאַהֲבַי נֹתְנֵי לַחְמִי וּמֵימַי צַמְרִי וּפִשְׁתִּי שַׁמְנִי וְשִׁקּוּיָי״.
human_translation: “And Lot cast “His master’s wife cast her eyes “His eyes” “And Samson said: Get her for me, as she is pleasing to my eyes” “And beheld” “And Shechem, son of Hamor, beheld her; “The entire plain [ kikar ] of the Jordan” “For on account of a prostitute a man is brought to a loaf [ kikar ] of bread” “That it was well watered [ mashke ] everywhere” “I will follow my lovers, givers of my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink [ veshikkuyai ]”
llm_translation: "And Lot lifted up" - "And his master's wife lifted up her eyes," "his eyes" - "And Samson said etc. take her for me, for she is right in my eyes," "and he saw" - "And Shechem the son of Hamor saw her," "all the plain of the Jordan" - "For because of this harlot woman, up to the plain of the Jordan," "for she is all my provision" - "I will go after my lovers, who give my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, my oil and my drink."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵינָס אֲנִיס! תָּנָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי חוֹנִי: לָמָּה נָקוּד עַל וָיו שֶׁבְּ״קוּמָהּ״ שֶׁל בְּכִירָה? לוֹמַר לָךְ, שֶׁבְּשִׁכְבָהּ לָא יָדַע אֲבָל בְּקוּמָהּ יָדַע. וּמַאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד? מַאי דַּהֲוָה הֲוָה! נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ דִּלְפַנְיָא אַחֲרִינָא לָא אִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִישְׁתֵּי.
human_translation: Wasn’t he circumstances beyond his control, taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥoni: Why is it dotted over vav that “ bekumah ” elder to say to you that when she lay down he did not know; but when she arose, he knew. And what was he to do? What was, was. derived from it that on the following night he should not drink.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And did she flee due to being forced? It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina: Why is the vav in the word "bikumah" of the firstborn marked with a dot? To say to you that in her lying down she did not know, but in her rising up she knew. And what could he have done to her? Whatever he could have done! It is evident from her that she did not consent to him.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבָּה, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אָח נִפְשָׁע מִקִּרְיַת עֹז וּמִדְיָנִים כִּבְרִיחַ אַרְמוֹן״? ״אָח נִפְשָׁע מִקִּרְיַת עֹז״ – זֶה לוֹט שֶׁפֵּירַשׁ מֵאַבְרָהָם, ״וּמִדְיָנִים כִּבְרִיחַ אַרְמוֹן״ – שֶׁהֵטִיל מִדְיָנִים בֵּין יִשְׂרָאֵל לְעַמּוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָבֹא עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי בִּקְהַל ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabba taught: What which is written: “A brother betrayed a strong city, and their contentions are like the bars of a castle” “A brother betrayed a strong city”; that is Lot, who parted from Abraham. “And their contentions are like the bars of a castle” because he, introduced contention between Israel and Ammon, as it is stated: “An Ammonite or a Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabah expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "A brother is offended more than a strong city, and contentions are like the bars of a castle"? "A brother is offended more than a strong city" - this refers to Lot who separated from Abraham. "And contentions are like the bars of a castle" - that Midianites caused contentions between Israel and Ammon, as it is stated: "An Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״לְתַאֲוָה יְבַקֵּשׁ נִפְרָד (וּבְכָל) [בְּכָל] תּוּשִׁיָּה יִתְגַּלָּע״? ״לְתַאֲוָה יְבַקֵּשׁ נִפְרָד״ – זֶה לוֹט שֶׁנִּפְרָד מֵאַבְרָהָם. ״(וּבְכָל) [בְּכָל] תּוּשִׁיָּה יִתְגַּלָּע״ – שֶׁנִּתְגַּלָּה קְלוֹנוֹ בְּבָתֵּי כְּנֵסִיּוֹת וּבְבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת. דִּתְנַן: עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי אֲסוּרִין אִסּוּר עוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rava taught, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak What which is written: “He that separates himself seeks his own desire, and snarls against all sound wisdom” “He that separates himself seeks his own desire”; that is Lot, who separated from Abraham “And snarls [ yitgalla ] against all sound wisdom”; his shame was revealed [ shenitgalla ] in synagogues and study halls, as we learned An Ammonite and a Moabite, are forbidden a permanent prohibition.
llm_translation: Rava expounded, and it was stated in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: What is the meaning of what is written: "He seeks a pretext for desire; he breaks out against all sound judgment"? "He seeks a pretext for desire" - this refers to Lot who separated from Abraham. "(And) against all sound judgment" - that his disgrace was revealed in synagogues and study halls. As we learned: An Ammonite and a Moabite are prohibited with a perpetual prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: תָּמָר זִנְּתָה וְזִימְרִי זִינָּה. תָּמָר זִנְּתָה – יָצְאוּ מִמֶּנָּה מְלָכִים וּנְבִיאִים, זִימְרִי זִינָּה – נָפְלוּ כַּמָּה רְבָבוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: גְּדוֹלָה עֲבֵירָה לִשְׁמָהּ מִמִּצְוָה שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תְּבֹרַךְ מִנָּשִׁים יָעֵל אֵשֶׁת חֶבֶר הַקֵּינִי מִנָּשִׁים בָּאֹהֶל תְּבֹרָךְ״, מַאן נִינְהוּ ״נָשִׁים בָּאֹהֶל״? שָׂרָה, רִבְקָה, רָחֵל וְלֵאָה.
human_translation: And Ulla says: Tamar engaged in licentiousness and Zimri engaged in licentiousness Tamar engaged in licentiousness, kings and prophets emerged from her. Zimri engaged in licentiousness, tens of thousands from the Jewish people fell. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: A transgression for the sake of is greater than a mitzva not for its own sake, as it is stated: “Blessed above women shall be Yael, the wife of Heber the Kenite, above women in the tent shall she be blessed” Who are “women in the tent”? Sarah, Rebecca, Rachel, and Leah,
llm_translation: And Ula said: Tamar committed harlotry, and Zimri committed harlotry. Tamar committed harlotry - kings and prophets descended from her, Zimri committed harlotry - many tens of thousands of Israelites fell. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Greater is a sin for its own sake than a commandment not for its own sake, as it is stated: "Blessed above women shall Jael the wife of Heber the Kenite be, blessed shall she be above women in the tent." Who are the "women in the tent"? Sarah, Rebecca, Rachel, and Leah.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יַעֲסוֹק אָדָם בְּתוֹרָה וּבְמִצְוֹת אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ בָּא לִשְׁמָהּ. אֵימָא: כְּמִצְוָה שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ.
human_translation: Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav says: A person should always engage in Torah and mitzvot, even not for its sake, as through not for its sake, comes for its sake. Say like a mitzva not for its sake.
llm_translation: I? And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always engage in Torah and mitzvot, even if not for their own sake, for through doing them not for their own sake, one comes to do them for their own sake. I say: Like a mitzvah not for its own sake.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁבַע בְּעִילוֹת בָּעַל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בֵּין רַגְלֶיהָ כָּרַע נָפַל שָׁכָב וְגוֹ׳״. וְהָא קָא מִיתְהַנְיָא מֵעֲבֵירָה? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: אֲפִילּוּ טוֹבָתָם שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים רָעָה הִיא אֵצֶל צַדִּיקִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: That wicked performed seven intercourse at that time, as it is stated: “Between her legs he crouched, he fell, he lay; But didn’t she experience pleasure from transgression Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Even the good by the wicked is bad for the righteous,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: Seven cohabitations the husband of that wicked woman at that time, as it says: "Between her legs he stumbled, he fell, he lay down, etc." But is he deriving pleasure from a transgression? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Even the good of the wicked is evil in the eyes of the righteous.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יַעֲסוֹק אָדָם בַּתּוֹרָה וּבַמִּצְוֹת אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ, שֶׁמִּתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָהּ בָּא לִשְׁמָהּ, שֶׁבִּשְׂכַר אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁנַיִם קׇרְבָּנוֹת שֶׁהִקְרִיב בָּלָק הָרָשָׁע, זָכָה וְיָצְתָה מִמֶּנּוּ רוּת, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: רוּת בַּת בְּנוֹ שֶׁל עֶגְלוֹן, בֶּן בְּנוֹ שֶׁל בָּלָק מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A person should always engage in Torah and mitzvot, even not for its own sake, as through not for its own sake, comes for its own sake. as in reward for the forty-two offerings that Balak the wicked sacrificed he merited and Ruth emerged from him, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, says: Ruth was the daughter of the son of Eglon, the son of the son of Balak, king of Moab.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always engage in Torah and mitzvot, even if not for their own sake, for through engaging not for their own sake, one comes to engage for their sake. For in the merit of the forty-two sacrifices that the wicked Balak offered, Ruth emerged and descended from him, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: Ruth was the daughter of the son of Eglon, the grandson of Balak, king of Moab.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְקַפֵּחַ אֲפִילּוּ שְׂכַר שִׂיחָה נָאָה? מֵהָכָא, דְּאִילּוּ בְּכִירָה דִּקְרָיתֵיהּ מוֹאָב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְמֹשֶׁה: ״אַל תָּצַר אֶת מוֹאָב וְאַל תִּתְגָּר בָם מִלְחָמָה״. מִלְחָמָה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not withhold even reward for euphemistic speech? from here, as the elder called her son Moab, the Merciful One said to Moses: “Be not at enmity with Moab, neither contend with them in battle” It is battle
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: From where do we know that the Holy One, blessed be He, does not withhold reward even for pleasant conversation? From here, for even concerning the capital city of Moab, He said to Moses: "Do not distress Moab, nor provoke them to war." War.

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּלָא, הָא צַעוֹרֵי צַעֲרִינְהוּ. וְאִילּוּ צְעִירָה דִּקְרָיתֵיהּ ״בֶּן עַמִּי״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״אַל תְּצֻרֵם וְאַל תִּתְגָּר בָּם״, כְּלָל, אֲפִילּוּ צַעוֹרֵי לָא.
human_translation: that not but to harass them. While the younger daughter, who called ben Ami, said to “Neither harass them, nor contend with them” at all. Even harass not
llm_translation: He who did not, these are the small ones of the small ones. And if a young girl read "Ben Ammi" in her verses, he said to her: "Do not oppress them and do not contend with them," in general, even the small ones not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: לְעוֹלָם יַקְדִּים אָדָם לִדְבַר מִצְוָה, שֶׁבִּשְׂכַר לַיְלָה אַחַת שֶׁקָּדְמָה בְּכִירָה לַצְּעִירָה, זָכְתָה וּקְדָמַתָּה אַרְבַּע דּוֹרוֹת לַמַּלְכוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: A person should always be first to a matter of a mitzva, as in reward for one night that elder preceded the younger she merited and preceded her to royalty four generations.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Avin said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said: A person should always hasten to perform a mitzvah, for in reward for one night that the elder preceded the younger, she merited and preceded four generations in royalty.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״ – פְּרָט לְמָשִׁיחַ. ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״ – פְּרָט לְנָשִׂיא,
human_translation: The Sages taught “from among the common people” to exclude the anointed “from among the common people” to exclude the king.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "From the common people" - excluding the Messiah. "From the common people" - excluding a prince.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר יָצְאוּ מָשִׁיחַ לִידּוֹן בְּפַר, נָשִׂיא לִידּוֹן בְּשָׂעִיר! שֶׁיָּכוֹל: מָשִׁיחַ עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר עִם שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה מֵבִיא פַּר, עַל שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה לְחוֹדֵיהּ מֵבִיא כִּשְׂבָּה וּשְׂעִירָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״ – פְּרָט לְמָשִׁיחַ. ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״ – פְּרָט לְנָשִׂיא.
human_translation: But weren’t excluded an anointed subject to with a bull, a king subject to with a male goat? as might an anointed priest brings a bull for absence of the matter with the unwitting of an action, he brings a ewe or a female goat, for the unwitting of an action alone. the verse states: “From among the common people,” to exclude the anointed “from among the common people” to exclude the king.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And haven't the anointed ones already gone out to judgment in a bull, the prince to judgment in a goat! That he can: the anointed one for an unwitting transgression involving a matter brings a bull, for an unwitting transgression involving an action he brings a female goat and a male goat? The Torah teaches: "From the common people" - to exclude the anointed one. "From the common people" - to exclude the prince.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח מָשִׁיחַ, אֶלָּא נָשִׂיא בְּשִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה הוּא דְּמַיְיתֵי!
human_translation: Granted, an anointed But a king, it is for the unwitting of an action that he brings
llm_translation: The Messiah will not come, but a prince by mistake of action he resembles!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל כְּזַיִת חֵלֶב כְּשֶׁהוּא הֶדְיוֹט, וְנִתְמַנָּה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע לוֹ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא נַיְיתֵי כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן. הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָזֵל בָּתַר יְדִיעָה, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן (דְּאָזְלוּ) [דְּאָזְלִי] בָּתַר חֲטָאָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: What are we dealing with here? where one ate an olive-bulk of fat when he a commoner, and he was appointed and thereafter became known to him. enter your mind to say: Let him bring a ewe or a female goat teaches us This works out well according to Rabbi Shimon, who follows knowledge, But according to the Rabbis, who follow sin, what can be said?
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: With what are we dealing here? For example, one who ate olive-sized forbidden fat unknowingly, and then it was designated and afterwards became known to him. Is it your opinion that we should say it is like a female goat or a he-goat? We have heard the answer. It is left for Rabbi Shimon who goes after knowledge, but for the Rabbis who go after sin, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב זְבִיד מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל חֲצִי כְּזַיִת חֵלֶב כְּשֶׁהוּא הֶדְיוֹט, וְנִתְמַנָּה וְהִשְׁלִימוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹדַע לוֹ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא נִצְטְרֵף וְנַיְיתֵי כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: What are we dealing with here? where one ate half an olive-bulk of fat when he a commoner, and he was appointed and he finished and thereafter it became known to him enter your mind to say: Let combine and let him bring a ewe or a female goat. teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Zevid said in the name of Rava: What are we dealing with here? For example, if one ate half an olive-bulk of forbidden fat unknowingly, and then he was appointed and completed it, and only afterwards did he become aware of it. Do you think I would say that he should join and bring a female lamb or a female goat? It is evident to us.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: נְשִׂיאוּת מַהוּ שֶׁתַּפְסִיק, הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן שֶׁאָכַל חֲצִי כְּזַיִת חֵלֶב כְּשֶׁהוּא הֶדְיוֹט, וְנִתְמַנָּה וְעָבַר, וְהִשְׁלִימוֹ – הָתָם הוּא דְּלָא מִצְטְרֵף, דְּאַכְלֵיהּ פַּלְגָא כְּשֶׁהוּא הֶדְיוֹט וּפַלְגָא כְּשֶׁהוּא נָשִׂיא, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי כְּשֶׁהוּא הֶדְיוֹט אַכְלֵיהּ מִצְטְרֵף, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא? מַאי?
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: kingship, what is interpose What are the circumstances? where one ate half an olive-bulk of fat when he a commoner, and he was appointed and removed and finished it is there, that do not combine, as he ate half when he a commoner and half when he king. But here, where he ate this and that when he a commoner, combine. Or perhaps it is no different, What
llm_translation: Rava asked a question from Rav Nachman: Regarding a case of "nesiut," what is the law if it was interrupted, how much is the payment? For example, if one ate half an olive-bulk of forbidden fat while he was a commoner, and then he was appointed and became a leader, and he completed the amount – there, since it did not combine, as he ate half as a commoner and half as a leader. But here, where both amounts were eaten as a commoner, does it combine, or perhaps it is not different? What is the law?

hebrew_text: תִּפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מֵהָא דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָכַל חֵלֶב וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן וְנִשְׁתַּמֵּד וְחָזַר בּוֹ, הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחָה – יִדָּחֶה. הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? מְשׁוּמָּד לָאו בַּר אֵתוֹיֵי קׇרְבָּן הוּא, הַאי בַּר אֵתוֹיֵי קׇרְבָּן הוּא.
human_translation: Resolve from that which Ulla says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: one ate fat and designated an offering and he became an apostate, and retracted since he was disqualified he shall disqualified How can be compared? An apostate is ineligible bringing an offering this is eligible bringing an offering,
llm_translation: He should remove from it what Ulla said, Rabbi Yochanan said: If one ate forbidden fat and set aside a sacrifice, and then became ill and recovered, since it was disqualified, it should be disqualified. Is it now so? Because the one who set aside the sacrifice is not the same person who ate the forbidden fat, and this one who set aside the sacrifice is not the same person who ate the forbidden fat.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָכַל סָפֵק חֵלֶב כְּשֶׁהוּא הֶדְיוֹט, וְנִתְמַנָּה וְנוֹדַע לוֹ עַל סְפֵקוֹ, מַהוּ? אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן דְּאָזְלִי בָּתַר חֲטָאָה לָא תִּבְּעֵי לָךְ, דְּמַיְיתֵי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי, אֶלָּא כִּי תִּבְּעֵי לָךְ – אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: one ate when he was a commoner, uncertainty fat, and was appointed and his uncertainty became known to him, what is According to the Rabbis, who follow transgression, do not raise the dilemma, as bring a provisional guilt-offering. Rather, when you raise the dilemma according to Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Requested from him Rabbi Zeira from Rav Sheshet: He ate a doubtful forbidden fat when he was a commoner, and he became appointed and it became known to him about his doubt, what is the ruling? According to the opinion of the Rabbis who follow after a sin offering, you do not require it, for it is considered a hanging guilt offering. Rather, when you require it - according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מִדְּאִשְׁתַּנִּי לְוַדַּאי, אִשְׁתַּנִּי לְסָפֵק, אוֹ דִלְמָא כִּי אִשְׁתַּנִּי לְוַדַּאי, דְּאִשְׁתַּנִּי קׇרְבָּן דִּידֵיהּ – אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא אִשְׁתַּנִּי קׇרְבָּן דִּידֵיהּ, אֵימָא לַיְיתֵי אָשָׁם תָּלוּי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: from that changed with regard to a definite changed with regard to an uncertain Or perhaps when changed, with regard to a definite as his offering changed, But here, as his offering does not change, say: Let him bring a provisional guilt-offering. shall stand
llm_translation: From when it was taught in the case of Vidduy, it was taught in the case of doubt, or perhaps when it was taught in the case of Vidduy, it was taught in the case of his own offering - but here, where it was not taught in the case of his own offering, should we say that he should bring a guilt offering? Let it stand unresolved.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מֵעַם הָאָרֶץ״ – פְּרָט לִמְשׁוּמָּד.
human_translation: The Sages taught: from among the common people to exclude an apostate.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "From the common people" - excluding the appointed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֵעָשֶׂינָה בִּשְׁגָגָה וְאָשֵׁם״, הַשָּׁב בִּידִיעָתוֹ – מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ, לֹא שָׁב בִּידִיעָתוֹ – אֵינוֹ מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon bar Yosei says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: unwittingly that may not be done and he is guilty; one who repents due to his awareness, brings an offering for his unwitting not repent due to his awareness does not bring an offering for his unwitting
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon bar Yosei says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: "Which he did not do unintentionally, and is guilty," if he returned with his knowledge - he brings a sacrifice for his unintentional sin, if he did not return with his knowledge - he does not bring a sacrifice for his unintentional sin.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רַבִּי הַמְנוּנָא: מְשׁוּמָּד לֶאֱכוֹל חֵלֶב וּמֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל הַדָּם – אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דִּמְשׁוּמָּד לֶאֱכוֹל חֵלֶב – לְדָם נָמֵי מְשׁוּמָּד הָוֵי, וּמָר סָבַר: לְדָם מִיהָא שָׁב בִּידִיעָתוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: What between Rav Hamnuna said: between them an apostate with regard to eating fat; he brings an offering for blood. Sage, holds: Since he is an apostate with regard to eating fat, he is also an apostate with regard to blood. And Sage, holds: With regard to blood, in any event, he is repents due to his awareness,
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Hamnuna said: If one is determined to eat forbidden fat and then brings a sacrifice for the blood - there is a difference between them. Mar thought: Since he is determined to eat forbidden fat, the blood is considered as if it is determined, and Mar thought: The blood is determined regardless.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רָבָא אָמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מְשׁוּמָּד לֶאֱכוֹל חֵלֶב לָא הָוֵי מְשׁוּמָּד לְדָם! אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּאוֹכֵל נְבֵלָה לְתֵאָבוֹן וְנִתְחַלֵּף לוֹ בְּשׁוּמָּן וַאֲכָלוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דִּלְתֵאָבוֹן אָכֵיל בְּמֵזִיד – מְשׁוּמָּד הוּא, וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ אַשְׁכַּח דְּהֶיתֵּרָא לָא אֲכַל דְּאִיסּוּרָא – לָאו מְשׁוּמָּד הוּא.
human_translation: But didn’t Rava say that everyone agrees an apostate with regard to eating fat is not an apostate with regard to blood? Rather, here with regard to eats an animal carcass due to appetite, And became confused for with fat and he ate disagree. Sage, holds: Since he intentionally eats due to appetite, he is an apostate. And Sage, holds: Since if he finds that permitted he does not eat that prohibited, he is not an apostate.
llm_translation: And Rava said: The entire world is accustomed to eating fat, yet it is not accustomed to eating blood! Rather, here when one eats a carcass for appetite and substitutes it with fat and eats it, Mar Savar: Since he ate it intentionally for appetite - it is considered intentional, and Mar Savar: Since if he would have found that it was permitted he would not have eaten it - it is not intentional.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָכַל חֵלֶב – זֶהוּ מְשׁוּמָּד, וְאֵיזֶהוּ מְשׁוּמָּד? אָכַל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת, שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים, וְשָׁתָה יֵין נֶסֶךְ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַלּוֹבֵשׁ כִּלְאַיִם. אָמַר מָר: אָכַל חֵלֶב זֶהוּ מְשׁוּמָּד, וְאֵיזֶהוּ מְשׁוּמָּד? אוֹכֵל נְבֵילוֹת כּוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר?
human_translation: The Sages taught: ate fat is an apostate. And who is an apostate? ate animal carcasses or animals with wounds that will cause them to die within twelve months [ tereifot ], repugnant creatures or creeping animals, and drank wine a libation Rabbi Yehuda says: even one who wears diverse kinds, The Master said: ate fat is an apostate. And who is an apostate? ate animal carcasses, etc. What is he saying?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who eats forbidden fat - this is deliberate, and what is considered deliberate? One who eats carrion and torn animals, insects and rodents, and drinks wine poured as a libation. Rabbi Yehuda says: Also one who wears shaatnez. Mar said: One who eats forbidden fat - this is deliberate, and what is considered deliberate? One who eats carrion, etc. What is he saying?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אָכַל חֵלֶב לְתֵאָבוֹן – הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּמָּד, לְהַכְעִיס – הֲרֵי זֶה מִין. וְאֵיזֶהוּ מְשׁוּמָּד דְּבִסְתָמוֹ מִין? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: אוֹכֵל נְבֵילָה וּטְרֵיפָה, שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים, וְשָׁתָה יֵין נֶסֶךְ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף הַלּוֹבֵשׁ כִּלְאַיִם.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: This he is saying: one ate fat due to appetite, he is an apostate. to express insolence, this a heretic. And which is apostate who is a presumptive heretic You must say eats an animal carcass or a tereifa , repugnant creatures or creeping animals, and drank wine a libation Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: even one who wears diverse kinds,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, thus he said: One who eats fat for appetite – this is considered indulgence; to provoke – this is considered a sin. And which indulgence is considered a sin by default? One should say: one who eats neveilah and tereifah, insects and creeping creatures, and drinks idolatrous wine. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Also one who wears shaatnez.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ כִּלְאַיִם דְּרַבָּנַן. מָר סָבַר: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הָוֵי מְשׁוּמָּד, דְּרַבָּנַן לָא הָוֵי מְשׁוּמָּד. וּמָר סָבַר: כִּלְאַיִם כֵּיוָן דִּמְפַרְסַם אִסּוּרֵיהּ, אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְרַבָּנַן הָוֵי מְשׁוּמָּד.
human_translation: What between diverse kinds, by rabbinic law. Sage, holds: by Torah law is an apostate; by rabbinic law is not an apostate. And Sage, holds: diverse kinds, since his prohibition is well known, even by rabbinic law, he is an apostate.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them like the words of the Rabbis. One Master holds: From the Torah it is considered established, but from the Rabbis it is not considered established. And the other Master holds: Like the words of the Rabbis, since its prohibition is publicized, even according to the Rabbis it is considered established.

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָמַר: לְתֵאָבוֹן – מְשׁוּמָּד, לְהַכְעִיס – מִין. וְחַד אָמַר: לְהַכְעִיס נָמֵי מְשׁוּמָּד, אֶלָּא אֵיזֶהוּ מִין? כָּל הָעוֹבֵד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. מֵיתִיבִי: אָכַל פַּרְעוֹשׁ אֶחָד אוֹ יַתּוּשׁ אֶחָד – הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּמָּד. וְהָא הָכָא דִּלְהַכְעִיס הוּא, וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ מְשׁוּמָּד! הָתָם דְּאָמַר: אֶטְעוֹם טַעַם דְּאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree with regard to One said: due to appetite an apostate, to express insolence a heretic. And one said: to express insolence also an apostate. Rather, who is a heretic? anyone who engages in idol worship. raises an objection ate one flea or one mosquito, this an apostate. But here, where it is to express insolence, and calls him an apostate? there, eats as he says: I shall taste the flavor of prohibition.
llm_translation: They disputed it, Rav Acha and Ravina. One said: for the purpose of appetite - deliberate, for the purpose of anger - species. And one said: for the purpose of anger also deliberate, rather what species? Anyone who worships foreign worship. It was asked: if one ate a single flea or a single gnat - this is deliberate. But here, since it is for the purpose of anger, and it is called deliberate! There, where it was said: to taste the taste of the prohibition.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ נָשִׂיא? זֶה מֶלֶךְ כּוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״נָשִׂיא״ – יָכוֹל נְשִׂיא שֵׁבֶט כְּנַחְשׁוֹן בֶּן עַמִּינָדָב? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת ה׳ אֱלֹהָיו״, וּלְהַלָּן: הוּא אוֹמֵר ״לְמַעַן יִלְמַד לְיִרְאָה אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהָיו״.
human_translation: Who is nasi ? This is a king, The Sages taught: The verse states: “ nasi .” might the prince of a tribe, like Naḥshon, son of Amminadab. the verse states: any of all the mitzvot of the Lord his God.” Later, states: “That he may learn to fear the Lord his God”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is a prince? This is a king." The sages taught: "'Prince' - could it be a prince of a tribe like Nahshon son of Amminadab? The Scripture teaches: 'From all the commandments of the Lord his God,' and elsewhere it says: 'So that he may learn to fear the Lord his God.'"

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַלָּן שֶׁאֵין עַל גַּבָּיו אֶלָּא ה׳ אֱלֹהָיו, אַף נָשִׂיא שֶׁאֵין עַל גַּבָּיו אֶלָּא ה׳ אֱלֹהָיו.
human_translation: Just as there, over whom there is only the Lord his God, so too, a nasi , over whom there is only the Lord his God.
llm_translation: What is the case there that there is nothing upon him except Hashem his God, so too a prince that there is nothing upon him except Hashem his God.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי מֵרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כְּגוֹן אֲנִי, מַהוּ בְּשָׂעִיר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲרֵי צָרָתְךָ בְּבָבֶל. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמַלְכֵי בֵּית דָּוִד, אֵלּוּ מְבִיאִים לְעַצְמָם, וְאֵלּוּ מְבִיאִים לְעַצְמָם! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לָא כַּיְיפִי אַהֲדָדֵי, הָכָא אֲנַן כַּיְיפִינַן לְהוּ לְדִידְהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi raised a dilemma before Rabbi Ḥiyya: where I what is with a goat said to him: Your rival, in Babylonia, raised an objection to kings of Israel and kings of the house of David these bring for themselves and those bring for themselves said to There, were not subject to each other’s authority. Here, we are subject to their authority,
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi from Rabbi Hiyya: "Like me, what is in Sa'ir?" He said to him: "Behold, your trouble is in Babylon." He challenged him: "The kings of Israel and the kings of the House of David, these bring for themselves, and these bring for themselves!" He said to him: "There, we are not like the descendants of Ahadadei, here, we are like the descendants of Ahadadei to them."

hebrew_text: רַב סָפְרָא מַתְנֵי הָכִי. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי מֵרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כְּגוֹן אֲנִי מַהוּ בְּשָׂעִיר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם ״שֵׁבֶט״, הָכָא ״מְחוֹקֵק״, וְתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יָסוּר שֵׁבֶט מִיהוּדָה״ – זֶה רֹאשׁ גּוֹלָה שֶׁבְּבָבֶל, שֶׁרוֹדֶה אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמַקֵּל. ״וּמְחוֹקֵק מִבֵּין רַגְלָיו״ – אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי בָנָיו שֶׁל הִלֵּל שֶׁמְלַמְּדִים תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בָּרַבִּים.
human_translation: Rav Safra taught this Rabbi raised a dilemma before Rabbi Ḥiyya: where I what is with a male goat said to him: There, a scepter; here, a staff. And it is taught “The scepter shall not depart from Judah” this the Exilarch in Babylonia, who reigns over the Jewish people with a rod, “Nor the ruler’s staff from between his feet” these are the descendants of Hillel, who teach Torah to the Jewish people in public,
llm_translation: Rav Safra teaches thus: Rabbi inquired of Rabbi Hiyya: For example, what is the law regarding a goat? He said to him: There it says "a staff," here it says "a ruler," and it was taught: "The scepter shall not depart from Judah" – this refers to the head of the exile in Babylon, who rules over Israel with a staff. "Nor the ruler's staff from between his feet" – these are the descendants of Hillel who teach Torah to the people of Israel in public.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵיזֶהוּ הַמָּשִׁיחַ? הַמָּשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, לֹא הַמְרוּבֶּה בִּבְגָדִים. אֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן הַמָּשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה לִמְרוּבֵּה בְּגָדִים, אֶלָּא פַּר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: And who is the anointed who is anointed with the anointing oil, not the multiple garments, The difference between Priest anointed with the anointing oil and multiple garments is only bull that comes for any of the mitzvot.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And who is the anointed one (haMashiach)? The one anointed with the anointing oil, not one who is clad in many garments. There is no difference between a High Priest anointed with the anointing oil and one who is clad in many garments, except for the bull that is brought for all the commandments.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן מְשַׁמֵּשׁ לְכֹהֵן שֶׁעָבַר אֶלָּא פַּר יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה.
human_translation: And the difference between Priest serving and a former Priest is only bull Yom Kippur and the tenth of an ephah
llm_translation: There is no difference between a serving priest and a priest who has passed, except for the bull of the Day of Atonement and a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: זֶה וָזֶה שָׁוִים בַּעֲבוֹדַת יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים, וּמְצֻוִּוים עַל הַבְּתוּלָה, וַאֲסוּרִים עַל הָאַלְמָנָה, וְאֵינָם מִטַּמְּאִים בִּקְרוֹבֵיהֶם, וְלֹא פּוֹרְעִים, וְלֹא פּוֹרְמִים, וּמַחְזִירִין הָרוֹצֵחַ.
human_translation: this and that are equal with regard to the Yom Kippur service, and they are commanded with regard to a virgin and prohibited to a widow and they may not render themselves impure in their relatives and they may not grow long and they may not rend and they restore the murderer
llm_translation: Both this and that are equal in the service of Yom Kippur, and are commanded concerning virginity, and are forbidden concerning a widow, and they do not become impure through their relatives, and they do not pay, and they do not exempt, and they return the murderer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה בַּמִּדְבָּר הָיוּ שׁוֹלְקִים בּוֹ אֶת הָעִיקָּרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: וַהֲלֹא לָסוּךְ אֶת הָעִקָּרִים אֵינוֹ סוֹפֵק?! אֶלָּא: שׁוֹרִין אֶת הָעִקָּרִים בְּמַיִם, וּמֵצִיף עָלָיו שֶׁמֶן, וְקוֹלֵט אֶת הָרֵיחַ וְקוֹפְחוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: the anointing oil that Moses prepared in the wilderness, they would boil in the roots the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: But isn’t insufficient to smear on the roots Rather, they soak the roots in water. and they float oil on and absorbs the fragrance. And one removed [ vekippeḥo ]
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The anointing oil that Moses made in the wilderness, they would soak the spices in it, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: Is it not sufficient to soak the spices?! Rather, they would soak the spices in water, and then pour oil over them, and collect the fragrance and squeeze it out.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי נֵס אֶחָד נַעֲשָׂה בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה? וַהֲלֹא תְּחִלָּתוֹ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לוּגִּין, וּמִמֶּנּוּ הָיָה נִמְשָׁח מִשְׁכָּן וְכֵלָיו אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּלּוּאִים, וְכוּלּוֹ קַיָּים לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שֶׁמֶן מִשְׁחַת קֹדֶשׁ יִהְיֶה זֶה לִי לְדוֹרוֹתֵיכֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to him: And was one miracle performed with regard to the anointing oil? But wasn’t it initially twelve log , and from it the Tabernacle, and its vessels, Aaron, and his sons anointed entire seven days of inauguration, and all of it in existence for the future, as it is stated: “This shall be a sacred anointing oil unto Me throughout your generations”
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda: And was there only one miracle performed with the anointing oil? Wasn't its beginning twelve log, and from it the Mishkan, its vessels, Aharon, and his sons were anointed for all seven days of the inauguration, and it will all stand for the future, as it is stated: "It shall be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה וַיִּמְשַׁח [אֶת] הַמִּשְׁכָּן [וְאֶת] כׇּל אֲשֶׁר בּוֹ״, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה בַּמִּדְבָּר, כַּמָּה נִסִּים נַעֲשׂוּ בּוֹ מִתְּחִלָּה וְעַד סוֹף, תְּחִלָּתוֹ לֹא הָיָה אֶלָּא שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לוּגִּין, רְאֵה כַּמָּה יוֹרָה בּוֹלַעַת, וְכַמָּה עִקָּרִים בּוֹלְעִים, וְכַמָּה הָאוּר שׂוֹרֵף, וּבוֹ נִמְשַׁח מִשְׁכָּן וְכֵלָיו וְאַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעַת יְמֵי הַמִּלּוּאִים, וּבוֹ נִמְשְׁחוּ כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים וּמְלָכִים.
human_translation: It is taught another “And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the Tabernacle and all that was in it Rabbi Yehuda says: the anointing oil that Moses prepared in the wilderness, how many miracles were performed in its from beginning to end? Initially it was only twelve log . Consider how much a pot absorbs, and how much absorbed by the roots, and how much the fire burns, and the Tabernacle, and its vessels, Aaron, and his sons anointed with it entire seven days of inauguration, and High Priests and kings were anointed with it
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the Tabernacle and all that is in it." Rabbi Yehuda says: The anointing oil that Moses made in the desert, how many miracles were performed with it from beginning to end. At the start, it was only twelve log. See how much it swallowed, and how many beams it consumed, and how much fire it burned. With it, the Tabernacle and all its vessels, Aaron and his sons were anointed for seven days of inauguration, and with it, great priests and kings were anointed.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בֶּן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה, וְאֵין מוֹשְׁחִים מֶלֶךְ בֶּן מֶלֶךְ. וְאִם תֹּאמַר: מִפְּנֵי מָה מָשְׁחוּ אֶת שְׁלֹמֹה? מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוּקְתּוֹ שֶׁל אֲדוֹנִיָּה, וְאֶת יוֹאָשׁ מִפְּנֵי עֲתַלְיָה, וְאֶת יְהוֹאָחָז מִפְּנֵי יְהוֹיָקִים, שֶׁהָיָה גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים. וְאוֹתוֹ שֶׁמֶן קַיָּים לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שֶׁמֶן מִשְׁחַת קֹדֶשׁ יִהְיֶה זֶה לִי לְדוֹרוֹתֵיכֶם״, ״זֶה״ – בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לוּגִּין הֲווֹ.
human_translation: And even a High Priest, son of a High Priest, requires anointing, but one does not anoint a king, son of a king. And if you say: For what did they anoint King Solomon due to the challenge of Adonijah, And Joash due to Athaliah And Jehoahaz due to Jehoiakim, who was two years older than he And that oil remains in existence for the future, as it is stated: “This [ zeh ] shall be a sacred anointing oil unto Me throughout your generations” The numerical value of zeh is twelve log ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even a High Priest, son of a High Priest, requires anointing, but kings, son of kings, are not anointed. And if you say: Why was Solomon anointed? Because of the dispute of Adonijah, and Joash because of Athaliah, and Jehoahaz because of Jehoiakim, who was two years older than him. And that oil remains for the future, as it is stated: "It shall be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations," "this" - in gematria, twelve log.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וַאֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בֶּן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַכֹּהֵן הַמָּשִׁיחַ תַּחְתָּיו מִבָּנָיו״, נֵימָא קְרָא ״וְהַכֹּהֵן מִתַּחְתָּיו מִבָּנָיו״, מַאי ״הַמָּשִׁיחַ״? קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּמִבָּנָיו דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, אִי הָוֵי מָשִׁיחַ – הָוֵי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְאִי לָא – לָא הָוֵי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: The Master said: And even a High Priest, son of a High Priest, requires anointing. From where do we as it is written: “And the anointed priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons” Let the verse say The priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons. What “The anointed teaches us that from among the sons of a High Priest, if he is anointed he is a High Priest, and if not, he is not a High Priest.
llm_translation: The Master said: Even a High Priest, son of a High Priest, requires anointing. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And the priest who is anointed from among his sons." Let us say the verse reads: "And the priest from among his sons." What is the meaning of "the anointed one"? It teaches us that if he is from his sons, he is a High Priest; if he is not, he is not a High Priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וְאֵין מוֹשְׁחִין מֶלֶךְ בֶּן מֶלֶךְ. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן יַאֲרִיךְ יָמִים עַל מַמְלַכְתּוֹ וְגוֹ׳״, יְרוּשָּׁה הִיא לָכֶם. וּמְנָלַן דְּכִי אִיכָּא מַחְלוֹקֶת בָּעֵי מְשִׁיחָה, וְלָאו כָּל דְּבָעֵי מַלְכָּא מוֹרֵית מַלְכוּתָא לִבְנֵיהּ, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא וּבָנָיו בְּקֶרֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל״. בִּזְמַן שֶׁשָּׁלוֹם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ ״הוּא וּבָנָיו״, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּלֹא מְשִׁיחָה.
human_translation: The Master said: But one does not anoint a king, son of a king. From where do we Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said as it is written: “So that he may prolong his days in his kingdom, is an inheritance for you. And from where do we that when there is a dispute requires anointing, and not whenever the king wishes bequeath the kingdom to his son Rav Pappa said the verse states: “He and his sons, in the midst of Israel.” When there is peace in Israel we read concerning him: “He and his sons,” even without anointing;
llm_translation: Master said: And anoint not a king, the son of a king. From where do we derive this? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said, as it is written: "That his days may be prolonged upon his kingdom, etc." - the inheritance belongs to you. And from where do we derive that when there is a dispute, they seek the Messiah, and not every ruler who wants to establish his kingdom for his children? Rav Papa said in the name of a verse: "He and his sons in the midst of Israel." When there is peace in Israel, we read it as "He and his sons," even without the Messiah.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: אַף יֵהוּא בֶּן נִמְשִׁי לֹא נִמְשַׁח אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוּקְתּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹרָם. וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּרִאשׁוֹן הוּא! חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: מַלְכֵי בֵּית דָּוִד מְשׁוּחִין, מַלְכֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין מְשׁוּחִין. מְנָלַן? אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״קוּם מְשָׁחֵהוּ כִּי זֶה וְגוֹ׳״ – זֶה טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה, וְאֵין אַחֵר טָעוּן מְשִׁיחָה.
human_translation: taught: Even Jehu, son of Nimshi, was anointed only due to the challenge of Joram And let him derive due to that he first is incomplete and this it is teaching: Kings of the house of David are anointed; kings of Israel are not anointed. From where do we Rava said the verse states: “Arise, anoint him, for this This requires anointing, but another does not require anointing.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: It was taught: Even Jehu ben Nimshi was anointed only because of the dispute of Joram. And let him go away, for he is the first! Lacking, and so it is taught: Kings of the House of David are anointed, kings of Israel are not anointed. From where? Rava said, Scripture says: "Arise, anoint him, for this is..." - this one requires anointing, and no other requires anointing.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אַף יֵהוּא בֶּן נִמְשִׁי לֹא נִמְשַׁח אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מַחְלוּקְתּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹרָם. וּמִשּׁוּם מַחְלוּקְתּוֹ שֶׁל יוֹרָם בֶּן אַחְאָב נִמְעוֹל בְּשֶׁמֶן? כִּדְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בַּאֲפַרְסְמָא דַּכְיָא, הָכִי נָמֵי בַּאֲפַרְסְמָא דַּכְיָא.
human_translation: The Master said: Even Jehu, son of Nimshi, was anointed only due to the challenge of Joram. And due to the challenge of Joram, son of Ahab, shall we misuse consecrated anointing oil like which Rav Pappa said with pure balsam So too, with pure balsam
llm_translation: Master said: Even Jehu son of Nimshi was anointed only because of the dispute of Joram. And because of the dispute of Joram son of Ahab, was he involved in oil? As Rav Papa said: In the dust of the feet of dogs, so it is said in the dust of the feet of dogs.

hebrew_text: וְאֶת יְהוֹאָחָז מִפְּנֵי יְהוֹיָקִים, שֶׁהָיָה גָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים. וּמִי קַשִּׁישׁ מִינֵּיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ הַבְּכוֹר יוֹחָנָן הַשֵּׁנִי יְהוֹיָקִים הַשְּׁלִישִׁי צִדְקִיָּהוּ הָרְבִיעִי שַׁלּוּם״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוּא שַׁלּוּם הוּא צִדְקִיָּהוּ, הוּא יוֹחָנָן הוּא יְהוֹאָחָז. לְעוֹלָם יְהוֹיָקִים קַשִּׁישׁ, וּמַאי ״בְּכוֹר״? בְּכוֹר לַמַּלְכוּת.
human_translation: And Jehoahaz due to Jehoiakim, who was two years older than he And was older than But isn’t it written: “And the sons of Josiah: The firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum” and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He is Shallum, he is Zedekiah; he is Johanan, he is Jehoahaz, Actually, Jehoiakim older And what “firstborn” a firstborn to the kingship.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Jehoahaz from before Jehoiakim, that he was greater from him two years. And who was older from her? And it is written: "And the sons of Josiah, the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum," and Rabbi Yochanan said: He is Shallum, he is Zedekiah, he is Johanan, he is Jehoahaz. Forever Jehoiakim is older, and what is "firstborn"? Firstborn to the kingdom.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָלְכִי זוּטְרֵי מִקַּמֵּי קַשִּׁישֵׁי? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְאֶת הַמַּמְלָכָה נָתַן לִיהוֹרָם כִּי הוּא הַבְּכוֹר״! יְהוֹרָם מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו הֲוָה, יְהוֹיָקִים לָאו מְמַלֵּא מְקוֹם אֲבוֹתָיו הֲוָה.
human_translation: And do younger rule before elder But isn’t it written: “And the kingdom he gave to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn” Jehoram was a surrogate for his ancestors Jehoiakim was not a surrogate for his ancestors;
llm_translation: And who is Malki-Zutrī before the elders? But it is written: "And he gave the kingdom to Jehoram because he was the firstborn!" Jehoram was filling the place of his fathers, but Jehoiakim was not filling the place of his fathers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: הוּא שַׁלּוּם הוּא צִדְקִיָּהוּ, הוּא יוֹחָנָן הוּא יְהוֹאָחָז. וְהָא חַד חַד קָא חָשֵׁיב, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַשְּׁלִישִׁי הָרְבִיעִי״! מַאי ״שְׁלִישִׁי״ – שְׁלִישִׁי לַבָּנִים, וּמַאי ״רְבִיעִי״ – רְבִיעִי לַמַּלְכוּת. דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא מְלַךְ יְהוֹאָחָז, וּלְבַסּוֹף יְהוֹיָקִים, וּלְבַסּוֹף יְכׇנְיָה, וּלְבַסּוֹף צִדְקִיָּהוּ.
human_translation: The Master said: He is Shallum, he is Zedekiah; he is Johanan, he is Jehoahaz. But doesn’t enumerate them individually, as it is written: “The third the fourth What third? third among the sons. And what fourth? fourth to the kingship. Initially, Jehoahaz reigned, and ultimately, Jehoiakim, and ultimately, Jeconiah, and ultimately, Zedekiah,
llm_translation: Master said: He is Shalom, he is Zedekiah, he is Yoḥanan, he is Yehoahaz. And this one, this one is counted, as it is written: "The third, the fourth!" What is "third" - third to the sons, and what is "fourth" - fourth to the kingdom. Originally, King Yehoahaz, and in the end Yehoyakim, and in the end Yekhonyah, and in the end Zedekiah.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הוּא שַׁלּוּם הוּא צִדְקִיָּהוּ. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ שַׁלּוּם? שֶׁהָיָה מְשׁוּלָּם בְּמַעֲשָׂיו. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: ״שַׁלּוּם״ – שֶׁשָּׁלְמָה מַלְכוּת בֵּית דָּוִד בְּיָמָיו, וּמָה שְׁמוֹ? מַתַּנְיָה שְׁמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּמְלֵךְ מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל אֶת מַתַּנְיָה דוֹדוֹ תַּחְתָּיו וַיַּסֵּב אֶת שְׁמוֹ צִדְקִיָּהוּ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יָהּ יַצְדִּיק עָלֶיךָ אֶת הַדִּין אִם תִּמְרוֹד בִּי, (שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר וַיְבִאֵהוּ בָּבֶלָה) וּכְתִיב: ״וְגַם בַּמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר מָרָד אֲשֶׁר הִשְׁבִּיעוֹ בֵּאלֹהִים״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: He is Shallum, he is Zedekiah. And why was he called Shallum? due to that he was perfect [ meshullam ] is his actions. Some say: Shallum because the kingdom of the house of David was concluded [ sheshalema ] during his days. And what his name? Mattaniah his name, as it is stated: “And the king of Babylon crowned Mattaniah his uncle in his stead, and changed his name to Zedekiah” He said to him: God will justify the judgment against you if you rebel against me; and it is written: “And he also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had imposed upon him an oath by God”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: He is Shalum, he is Tzidkiyahu. And why was his name called Shalum? Because he was complete in his actions. Some say: "Shalum" - because the kingdom of the house of David was complete in his days. And what was his name? Matanyahu was his name, as it is stated: "And the king of Babylon made Matanyahu his uncle king in his place, and changed his name to Tzidkiyahu." He said to him: May God bring justice upon you if you rebel against me, as it is stated, "And he brought him to Babylon," and it is written: "And also against King Nebuchadnezzar, who he had sworn by God."

hebrew_text: וּמִי הֲוָה שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: מִשֶּׁנִּגְנַז אָרוֹן, נִגְנַז שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה וְצִנְצֶנֶת הַמָּן וּמַקְלוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן שְׁקֵדֶיהָ וּפְרָחֶיהָ וְאַרְגַּז שֶׁשָּׁלְחוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים דּוֹרוֹן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵת כְּלֵי הַזָּהָב אֲשֶׁר הֲשֵׁבֹתֶם לוֹ אָשָׁם תָּשִׂימוּ בָאַרְגַּז מִצִּדּוֹ וְשִׁלַּחְתֶּם אֹתוֹ וְהָלָךְ״.
human_translation: And was there anointing oil But isn’t it taught When the Ark of the Covenant was sequestered, the anointing oil, and the jar of manna and Aaron’s staff its almonds and blossoms and the chest that the Philistines sent a gift to Israel, sequestered as it is stated: and put the vessels of gold that you return Him as a guilt-offering in a chest by its side and send it away that it may go”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who was the anointing oil? And it was taught: From when the Ark was hidden away, the anointing oil was hidden away, and the jar of manna, and Aaron's staff, its almonds and blossoms, and the chest that the Philistines sent as a guilt offering to Israel, as it is said: "And you shall put the golden articles that you are returning to Him as a guilt offering in a chest by its side, and send it off, and it shall go."

hebrew_text: וּמִי גְּנָזוֹ? יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה גְּנָזוֹ, שֶׁרָאָה שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּתּוֹרָה: ״יוֹלֵךְ ה׳ אֹתְךָ וְאֶת מַלְכְּךָ וְגוֹ׳״, צִוָּה וּגְנָזוּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לַלְוִיִּם הַמְּבִינִים לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל הַקְּדוֹשִׁים לַה׳ תְּנוּ אֶת אֲרוֹן הַקֹּדֶשׁ בַּבַּיִת אֲשֶׁר בָּנָה שְׁלֹמֹה בֶן דָּוִד מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין לָכֶם מַשָּׂא בַּכָּתֵף עַתָּה עִבְדוּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם וְאֵת עַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: And who sequestered Josiah, king of Judea, sequestered it, as he saw that it is written in the Torah “The Lord will lead you, and your king He commanded and sequestered them, as it is stated: “And he said to the Levites who taught all Israel, and who were sacred unto the Lord: Place the sacred Ark in the room that Solomon, son of David, king of Israel built; there shall be no more burden upon your shoulders. Now serve the Lord your God and His people Israel”
llm_translation: And who hid it? Josiah, king of Judah, hid it, as he saw that it is written in the Torah: "The Lord will bring you and your king, etc." He commanded and they hid it, as it is said: "And he said to the Levites who taught all Israel, the holy ones of the Lord, 'Put the holy ark in the house that Solomon son of David, king of Israel, built. You shall no longer carry it on your shoulders. Now serve the Lord your God and His people Israel.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָתְיָא ״שָׁם״ ״שָׁם״, אַתְיָא ״מִשְׁמֶרֶת״ ״מִשְׁמֶרֶת״, אָתְיָא ״דּוֹרוֹת״ ״דּוֹרוֹת״! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בַּאֲפַרְסְמָא דַּכְיָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: One derives There, There, Keepsake, Keepsake, Generations, Generations, Rav Pappa said: with pure balsam
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: It says "there" "there," it says "guard" "guard," it says "generations" "generations"! Rav Papa said: In the blacksmith's shop.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מוֹשְׁחִין אֶת הַמְּלָכִים? כְּמִין נֵזֶר. וְאֶת הַכֹּהֲנִים? כְּמִין כִּי. מַאי ״כְּמִין כִּי״? אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר גַּדָּא: כְּמִין כָּף יְוָנִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: How does one anoint the kings? similar to a crown And the priests? like chi. What Like chi? Rav Menashya bar Gadda said: Like Greek kaf .
llm_translation: The sages taught: How do we anoint kings? Like a type of crown. And how do we anoint priests? Like a type of box. What is "like a type of box"? Rav Menashya bar Gadda said: Like a Greek cup.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: בַּתְּחִלָּה מוֹצְקִין שֶׁמֶן עַל רֹאשׁוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שֶׁמֶן בֵּין רִיסֵי עֵינָיו. וְתַנְיָא אַחֲרִיתִי: בַּתְּחִלָּה נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שֶׁמֶן בֵּין רִיסֵי עֵינָיו, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מוֹצְקִים לוֹ שֶׁמֶן עַל רֹאשׁוֹ! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: מְשִׁיחָה עֲדִיפָא, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: יְצִיקָה עֲדִיפָא.
human_translation: It is taught one Initially, they pour oil on head, and thereafter, they place oil for him between the lashes of his eyes. And it is taught a different Initially, they place oil for him between the lashes of his eyes, and thereafter, they pour oil on his head. It is tanna’im . Some say: Anointing is preferable and some say: Pouring is preferable
llm_translation: It was taught: At first, they would pour oil on his head, and afterwards they would place oil between the lashes of his eyes. And it was taught at the end: At first, they would place oil between the lashes of his eyes, and afterwards they would pour oil on his head! These are the teachings: Some say anointing is preferable, and some say pouring is preferable.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר יְצִיקָה עֲדִיפָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּצֹק מִשֶּׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה עַל רֹאשׁ אַהֲרֹן וַיִּמְשַׁח אֹתוֹ לְקַדְּשׁוֹ״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מְשִׁיחָה עֲדִיפָא, מַאי טַעְמָא? קָסָבַר: שֶׁכֵּן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֵצֶל כְּלֵי שָׁרֵת. וְהָכְתִיב ״וַיִּצֹק״, וּבַסּוֹף ״וַיִּמְשַׁח״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: מַאי טַעַם ״וַיִּצֹק״? מִשּׁוּם דְּ״וַיִּמְשַׁח״.
human_translation: What is the reason of the one who said pouring is preferable? as it is written: “And he poured from the anointing oil upon Aaron’s head and anointed him to sanctify him” And the one who said anointing is preferable what is the reason He holds: as you find with regard to service vessels But isn’t it written “And he poured,” and ultimately: “And anointed”? This is saying: What is the reason he poured due to that he anointed
llm_translation: What is the reason that one who says pouring is preferable? As it is written: "And he poured from the anointing oil upon Aaron's head and anointed him to sanctify him." And one who says anointing is preferable, what is the reason? He holds: Because you find it by the vessels of the service. And it is written "and he poured," and in the end "and he anointed"! This is what he is saying: What is the reason for "and he poured"? Because of "and he anointed."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כַּשֶּׁמֶן הַטּוֹב [וְגוֹ׳] יֹרֵד עַל הַזָּקָן זְקַן אַהֲרֹן וְגוֹ׳״ – כְּמִין שְׁנֵי טִפֵּי מַרְגָּלִיּוֹת הָיוּ תְּלוּיוֹת לְאַהֲרֹן בִּזְקָנוֹ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מְסַפֵּר, עוֹלוֹת וְיוֹשְׁבוֹת לוֹ בְּעִיקַּר זְקָנוֹ, וְעַל דָּבָר זֶה הָיָה מֹשֶׁה דּוֹאֵג, אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם מָעַלְתִּי בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה: ״כְּשֶׁמֶן הַטּוֹב וְגוֹ׳ כְּטַל חֶרְמוֹן״, מָה טַל חֶרְמוֹן אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה, אַף שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה שֶׁבִּזְקַן אַהֲרֹן אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “It is like the precious oil upon the head coming down upon the beard, Aaron’s beard, Two drops shaped like pearls, were suspended for Aaron from his beard. Rav Pappa said taught: When speak rise and settle on the roots of his beard Moses was concerned about this matter. He said: Perhaps, Heaven forfend, I misused anointing oil A Divine Voice emerged and said: “It is like the precious oil Like the dew of Hermon” Just as there is no misuse of the dew of Hermon, so too, the anointing oil that is on Aaron’s beard, there is no misuse
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Like the good oil etc. that descends upon the beard, the beard of Aaron, etc." - They were like two drops of myrrh hanging on Aaron's beard. Rav Papa said, a Tanna taught: When he would recount, they would rise and sit primarily on his beard, and concerning this matter, Moses was concerned, saying: "Perhaps I have sinned by the anointing oil?" A Divine Voice emerged and said: "Like the good oil etc. like the dew of Hermon," just as there is no covering in the dew of Hermon, so too, there is no covering in the anointing oil of Aaron's beard.

hebrew_text: וַעֲדַיִין הָיָה אַהֲרֹן דּוֹאֵג, אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא מֹשֶׁה לֹא מָעַל, אֲבָל אֲנִי מָעַלְתִּי? יָצְתָה בַּת קוֹל וְאָמְרָה לוֹ: ״הִנֵּה מַה טּוֹב וּמַה נָּעִים שֶׁבֶת אַחִים גַּם יָחַד״, מָה מֹשֶׁה לֹא מָעַל, אַף אַתָּה לֹא מָעַלְתָּ.
human_translation: And still Aaron was concerned. He said: Perhaps Moses did not misuse but I misused A Divine Voice emerged and said: “Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together in unity” Just as Moses did not misuse so too, you did not misuse
llm_translation: And still Aaron was anxious, he said: perhaps Moses did not ascend, but I ascended? A heavenly voice came out and said to him: "Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together." Just as Moses did not ascend, so too you did not ascend.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מוֹשְׁחִים אֶת הַמְּלָכִים אֶלָּא עַל הַמַּעְיָין, כְּדֵי שֶׁתִּמָּשֵׁךְ מַלְכוּתָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ לָהֶם קְחוּ עִמָּכֶם אֶת עַבְדֵי אֲדֹנֵיכֶם [וְגוֹ׳] וְהוֹרַדְתֶּם אֹתוֹ אֶל גִּחוֹן״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One anoints the kings only upon a spring, so that their kingdom will continue as it is stated “And the king said unto them: Take with you the servants of your lord, and bring him down to Gihon.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Kings are anointed only near a spring, so that their reign may endure, as it is stated: "And the king said to them, 'Take with you the servants of your lord etc. and bring him down to Gihon.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לִידַּע אִי מַסֵּיק שַׁתֵּיהּ אִי לָא, נִיתְלֵי שְׁרָגָא בַּעֲשָׂרָה יוֹמֵי דְּבֵין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים בְּבֵיתָא דְּלָא נָשֵׁיב זִיקָא. אִי מָשֵׁיךְ נְהוֹרֵיהּ – נִידַּע דְּמַסֵּיק שַׁתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: This who seeks to know if he will complete his year or if not, let him light a lamp, during the ten days that are between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur, in a house in which wind does not blow. If its light continues he knows that he complete his year.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: The one who wants to know whether he has concluded his drinking or not, should hang a lamp for ten days between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur in a house where there is no danger. If he continues to see its light, it is known that he has not concluded his drinking.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמִיעְבַּד בְּעִיסְקָא, וּבָעֵי לְמִידַּע אִי מַצְלַח אִי לָא מַצְלַח, לִירַבֵּי תַּרְנְגוֹלָא. אִי שָׁמֵין וְשָׁפַר, מַצְלַח.
human_translation: And one who seeks to conduct a business venture and wishes to know if he will succeed if not succeed, let him raise a rooster. If grows fat and healthy, he will succeed.
llm_translation: One who wants to engage in a business transaction, and wants to know whether it will succeed or not, should raise a rooster. If it crowed nicely and beautifully, it will succeed.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמִיפַּק [לְאוֹרְחָא] וּבָעֵי לְמִידַּע אִי (חָזַר) [הָדַר] וְאָתֵי לְבֵיתָא, אִי לָא – נֵיקוּם בְּבֵיתָא דְּחַבָּרָא, אִי חָזֵי בָּבוּאָה דְבָבוּאָה לִידַּע דְּהָדַר וְאָתֵי לְבֵיתֵאּ. וְלָאו מִלְּתָא הִיא, דִּלְמָא חָלְשָׁא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, וּמִיתְּרַע מַזָּלֵיהּ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ סִימָנָא מִילְּתָא הִיא, [לְעוֹלָם] יְהֵא רָגִיל לְמִיחְזֵי בְּרֵישׁ שַׁתָּא קָרָא וְרוּבְּיָא, כַּרָּתֵי וְסִילְקָא וְתַמְרֵי.
human_translation: One who seeks to embark on a journey and wishes to know if he return and come to home if not, let him go to a dark [ daḥavara ] house. If he sees the shadow of a shadow he shall know that he return and come home. is not matter. Perhaps he will be disheartened and his fortune will suffer Abaye said: Now that you said an omen is matter, a person should always be accustomed to seeing on Rosh HaShana: Squash, and fenugreek, leeks, and chard, and dates,
llm_translation: This one who wants to go out on the road and wants to know if he will return and come home, if not - he should take revenge in the home of the friend, if he sees a well-traveled road, he should know that he will return and come home. And this is not a matter, perhaps his mind is weak, and his luck is bad. Abaye said: Now that you said a sign is a matter, always be accustomed to see at the beginning of the hour a pitcher and a staff, a knife and dates.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לִבְרֵיהּ: כִּי בָּעֵיתוּ מֵיעַל וּמִיגְמַרי קַמֵּי רַבַּיְיכוּ, גְּרֻסוּ מַתְנִיתָא וְעַלּוּ לְקַמֵּי רַבַּיְיכוּ. וְכִי יָתְבִיתוּ קַמֵּיהּ, חֲזוֹ לְפוּמֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינֶיךָ רֹאוֹת אֶת מוֹרֶיךָ״. וְכִי גָרְסִיתוּ, גְּרֻסוּ עַל נַהֲרָא דְּמַיָּא, דְּכִי הֵיכִי דְּמָשְׁכִן מַיָּא מׇשְׁכָן שְׁמַעְתָּתַיְיכוּ. וְתִיבוּ אַקִּילְקְלֵי דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא, וְלָא תִּיבוּ אַפַּדְנֵי דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא – טָב גִּלְדָּנָא סַרְיָא [דְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא לְמֵיכַל], מִכּוּתָּחָא דְּרָמֵי כֵּיפֵי.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said to his son: When you seek to enter and study before your teacher, study the baraita and enter before your teacher. And when you are sitting before him, look to his mouth, as it is written: “And your eyes shall see your teacher” And when you study, study adjacent to a river of water; just as the water flows, your studies will flow And sit on the rubbish heaps [ akilkelei ] of Mata Meḥasya, and do not sit in the palaces [ appadnei ] of Pumbedita. Better to eat the rotten fish [ gildana ] of Mata Meḥasya than kutḥa , which displaces rocks,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Mesharshaya said to his son: When you come from the upper and lower markets before your teachers, grasp the Mishnah and go before your teachers. And when you sit before them, look at their mouths, as it is written: "And your eyes shall see your teachers." And when you learn, learn near a flowing river, so that just as water flows, so too may the words of your teachers flow. And let your garments be clean from the marketplace, and do not let the rags of the marketplace touch the food in your mouth, from the edge of the knife that cuts.

hebrew_text: ״רָמָה קַרְנִי בֵּאלֹהָי״, ״רָמָה קַרְנִי״ וְלֹא רָמָה פַּכִּי, דָּוִד וּשְׁלֹמֹה שֶׁנִּמְשְׁחוּ בְּקֶרֶן – נִמְשְׁכָה מַלְכוּתָן, שָׁאוּל וְיֵהוּא שֶׁנִּמְשְׁחוּ בְּפַךְ – לֹא נִמְשְׁכָה מַלְכוּתָן.
human_translation: “My horn is exalted in my God” My horn is exalted, and my jug is not exalted. David and Solomon were anointed with a horn. their reign endured. Saul and Jehu were anointed with a jug and their reign did not endure.
llm_translation: "Raise my horn in God," "Raise my horn" and did not raise a flask, David and Solomon who were anointed with a horn - their kingdom endured, Saul and Jehu who were anointed with a flask - their kingdom did not endure."

hebrew_text: הַמָּשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מָשִׁיחַ״ – יָכוֹל מֶלֶךְ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כֹּהֵן״. אִי כֹּהֵן, יָכוֹל מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מָשִׁיחַ״. אִי מָשִׁיחַ, יָכוֹל מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַכֹּהֵן הַמָּשִׁיחַ״, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מָשִׁיחַ עַל גַּבָּיו.
human_translation: who is anointed with the anointing oil, The Sages taught: “Anointed” might a king. the verse states: “Priest.” If a priest, might multiple garments. the verse states: “Anointed.” If anointed, might anointed for war. the verse states: “And the anointed priest,” that there is no anointed over him;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: One who is anointed with the anointing oil, etc. The Rabbis taught: "Anointed" - could this refer to a king? The Torah states: "Kohen." If a Kohen, could this refer to one who wears many garments? The Torah states: "Anointed." If anointed, could this refer to one anointed for war? The Torah states: "And the anointed Kohen," indicating that he is not anointed upon his garments.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא: ״הַיָּרֵךְ״ – הַמְיוּמֶּנֶת שֶׁבַּיָּרֵךְ, הָכָא נָמֵי: ״הַמָּשִׁיחַ״ – הַמְיוּמָּן שֶׁבַּמְּשׁוּחִים.
human_translation: From where inferred? as Rava said “the thigh” the stronger of the thighs. Here too, “The anointed,” the distinguished of anointed,
llm_translation: What is implied? As Rava said: "The thigh" - the designated one in the thigh, here we say: "The anointed one" - the designated one among the anointed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״מָשִׁיחַ״ – יָכוֹל מֶלֶךְ. מֶלֶךְ פַּר הוּא דְּמַיְיתֵי? שָׂעִיר הוּא דְּמַיְיתֵי! אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: עַל שִׁגְגַת מַעֲשֶׂה יָבִיא שָׂעִיר, עַל הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר יָבִיא פַּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The Master said: “Anointed” might a king. Is it a bull that a king brings It is a male goat that he brings, was necessary enter your mind to say: for the unwitting of an action shall bring for absence of the matter shall bring a bull. teaches us
llm_translation: Master said: "Messiah" - could mean king. Is it a young bull that he resembles? It is a he-goat that he resembles! It was necessary, according to your opinion, I would say: For an unwitting transgression, he brings a he-goat; for a hidden matter, he brings a young bull. This is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אֵין בֵּין מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה כּוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא תַּנְיָא: מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים מֵבִיא פַּר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: The difference between Priest anointed with the anointing oil The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as, if it was Rabbi Meir, isn’t it taught multiple garments brings a bull that comes for any of the mitzvot; the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Rabbis did not concede to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: There is no difference between one anointed with anointing oil, etc. Mishnah: Not like Rabbi Meir, for if it were like Rabbi Meir, it was taught: One who is abundant in garments brings a bull for every commandment, the words of Rabbi Meir, and the Sages did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? דְּתַנְיָא: ״מָשִׁיחַ״ – אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַכֹּהֵן הַמָּשִׁיחַ״.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir? as it is taught “Anointed” I have only a priest anointed with the anointing oil. From where multiple garments? The verse states: “The anointed priest,”
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? For it was taught: "Anointed" - I have only learned anointed with the anointing oil, but how do we know with many garments? The Talmud teaches: "The anointed priest."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתֵּיהּ? כְּרַבָּנַן,
human_translation: In accordance with which did you interpret in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: With what is it established? Like the Rabbis,
