hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן מְשַׁמֵּשׁ לְכֹהֵן שֶׁעָבַר אֶלָּא פַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה. אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְעָבַר וּמִינּוּ כֹּהֵן אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו – הָרִאשׁוֹן חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי כׇּל מִצְוֹת כְּהוּנָּה עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. [רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: רִאשׁוֹן חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, וְשֵׁנִי אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לֹא לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וְלֹא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט].
human_translation: Say the latter clause: The difference between Priest serving and a former Priest is only bull Yom Kippur and the tenth of an ephah we arrive at Rabbi Meir, as it is taught disqualification befell the High Priest and he left and they appointed another priest in his stead, the first returns to his service And the second all of the mitzvot of the Priesthood upon him; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: The first returns to his service, and the second is unfit neither as a High Priest nor as an ordinary priest.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: ein bein kohen meshamesh lekohen she'avar ela par yom hakkippurim va'asirit ha'eifah. Atan leRabbi Meir. Detanya: eira bo pesul bekohen gadol ve'avar uminu kohen acher takhtav – harishon chozer la'avodato, vehasheni kol mitzvot kehunah alav, divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei omer: rishon chozer la'avodato, vesheni einu rauy lo lekohen gadol velo lekohen hediyot." English translation: "The reason for this is: there is no difference between a serving priest and a priest who has passed away, except for the bull of Yom Kippur and a tenth of an ephah. They came to Rabbi Meir. As it was taught: If a disqualification occurred in him while he was a high priest, and he passed away, and his replacement is a different priest – the first one returns to his service, and the second one is responsible for all the priestly duties, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: the first one returns to his service, and the second one is not fit for either a high priest or an ordinary priest."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיוֹסֵף בֶּן אִילֵּים מִצִּפּוֹרִי שֶׁאֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְעָבַר, וּמִינּוּ אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו, וְלֹא הֱנִיחוּהוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים לִהְיוֹת לֹא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְלֹא כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה, כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט מִשּׁוּם מַעֲלִין בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וְאֵין מוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: an incident involving Yosef ben Eilim of Tzippori: When disqualification befell a High Priest and he left appointed another, in his stead. And his brethren the priests did not allow to neither a High Priest nor an ordinary priest. a High Priest, due to enmity, an ordinary priest, because One elevates in sanctity and one does not downgrade.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident involving Yosef ben Illeim from Zippori, in whom a blemish was found that disqualified him from serving as a High Priest. He transgressed and another of his sect took his place, but his priestly brethren did not allow him to serve as either a High Priest or an ordinary priest. A High Priest due to enmity, an ordinary priest due to elevating to holiness without lowering.

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אִין, רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: רַבִּי הִיא, וְנָסֵיב לַהּ אַלִּיבָּא דְתַנָּאֵי.
human_translation: the first clause the Rabbis, and the latter clause Rabbi Meir? Rav Ḥisda said: Indeed, the first clause the Rabbis and the latter clause Rabbi Meir. Rav Yosef said: is Rabbi and he formulates according to tanna’im .
llm_translation: Beginning: The sages, and the end: Rabbi Meir? Rav Hisda said: No, the beginning is the sages, and the end is Rabbi Meir. Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi, and he married her according to the opinion of the Tannaim.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Rava said: is Rabbi Shimon, and he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir with regard to one and disagrees with him with regard to one
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Shimon is she, and he holds like Rabbi Meir in one matter, and he disagrees with him in one matter.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט אֵלּוּ הֵם: פַּר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת, וּפַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה, וְלֹא פּוֹרֵעַ וְלֹא פּוֹרֵם. אֲבָל הוּא פּוֹרֵם מִלְּמַטָּה וְהַהֶדְיוֹט מִלְמַעְלָה. וְאֵין מִטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבִים, וּמוּזְהָר עַל הַבְּתוּלָה, וְאָסוּר בָּאַלְמָנָה, וּמַחְזִיר אֶת הָרוֹצֵחַ,
human_translation: as it is taught These are matters which between a High Priest and an ordinary priest: the bull that comes for any of the mitzvot, and the bull of Yom Kippur, and the tenth of an ephah And he may not grow long and may not rend but rends from below and the ordinary from above, And may not render himself impure in relatives and warned to a virgin, and prohibited to a widow, and he restores the murderer
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Matters between the High Priest and an ordinary priest, these are they: the bull that is brought for all the commandments, and the bull of Yom Kippur, and the tithe of the ephah, and he does not rend and they do not rend. But he rends from below and the ordinary priest from above. And one does not become impure for relatives, and one must be cautious regarding virginity, and it is forbidden with a widow, and he returns the murderer.

hebrew_text: וּמַקְרִיב אוֹנֵן, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל [וְאֵינוֹ חוֹלֵק]. מַקְרִיב חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ, וְנוֹטֵל חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ, וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ בִּשְׁמוֹנָה כֵּלִים. וְכׇל עֲבוֹדַת יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֵינָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה אֶלָּא בּוֹ, וּפָטוּר עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו.
human_translation: And sacrifices an acute mourner but he may not partake and he does not receive a share He sacrifices a portion at the head and takes a portion at the head, And he performs wearing eight garments, and the entire Yom Kippur service is valid only by him, and he is exempt from defiling of Temple or its sacrificial
llm_translation: And one who is an onen, and does not eat and does not divide. He brings a portion at the beginning, and takes a portion at the beginning, and serves with eight utensils. And all the service of Yom Kippur is valid only with him, and he is exempt from impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן נוֹהֲגִין בִּמְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים חוּץ מִפַּר הַמֵּבִיא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת, וְכוּלָּן נוֹהֲגִין בְּמָשִׁיחַ שֶׁעָבַר חוּץ מִפַּר יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה, וְכוּלָּן אֵין נוֹהֲגִין בִּמְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה חוּץ מֵחֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים הָאֲמוּרִים בַּפָּרָשָׁה: לֹא פּוֹרֵעַ וְלֹא פּוֹרֵם, וְאֵין מִטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבִים, וּמוּזְהָר עַל הַבְּתוּלָה, וְאָסוּר בָּאַלְמָנָה, וּמַחֲזִיר אֶת הָרוֹצֵחַ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיר.
human_translation: And all are in effect with regard to multiple garments, except for the bull the brings for all the mitzvot. And all are in effect with regard to a former anointed except for the bull of Yom Kippur and the tenth of an ephah. And all are not in effect with regard to anointed for war, except for the five matters stated in the portion He may not grow long and may not rend and he may not render himself impure in relatives and he is warned to a virgin, and prohibited to a widow, and he restores the murderer the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: He does not restore the murderer
llm_translation: And all of them are accustomed to wear most garments except for the bull that is brought for all the commandments, and all of them are accustomed to anoint with oil except for the anointing oil of the High Priest that has passed, except for the bull of Yom Kippur and the tenth of an ephah, and all of them are not accustomed to anoint for war except for five matters that are stated in the portion: "He shall not loosen it, nor shall he exchange it, nor shall he defile himself for the dead among his people, and he shall be cautious with the virgin, and he shall not marry a widow, and he shall restore the murderer," the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the sages say: He does not restore.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מִמַּאי דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר פָּטוּר עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו? רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: And this from where that is Rabbi Shimon? Rav Pappa said: Whom did you hear who says: exempt from defiling of Temple or its sacrificial Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And this, what is the source for Rabbi Shimon's statement? Rav Papa said: Who heard him say that one is exempt regarding impurity of the Sanctuary and its holy items? Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מֵחֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים הָאֲמוּרִים בַּפָּרָשָׁה. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדוֹל מֵאֶחָיו״ – זֶה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, ״אֲשֶׁר יוּצַק עַל רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה״ – זֶה מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה, ״וּמִלֵּא אֶת יָדוֹ לִלְבֹּשׁ אֶת הַבְּגָדִים״ – זֶה מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים. עַל כּוּלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״רֹאשׁוֹ לֹא יִפְרָע וּבְגָדָיו לֹא יִפְרֹם וְעַל כׇּל נַפְשֹׁת מֵת לֹא יָבֹא״.
human_translation: except for the five matters stated in the portion From where are these matters as the Sages taught: “And the priest who is greater than his brethren” this is a High Priest. “Upon whose head the anointing oil is poured”; this is anointed for war. “And who is consecrated to don the garments”; this is multiple garments. With regard to all of them, states: “He shall neither let the hair of his head grow, nor rend his garments, neither shall he come upon any dead body”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Outside of five things said in the portion. From where are these matters? For the Rabbis taught: "And the high priest from among his brothers" - this is the high priest, "Upon whose head the anointing oil was poured" - this is anointed for war, "And who is consecrated to put on the garments" - this is one who has many garments. Concerning all of them, it says: "He shall not uncover his head, nor rend his clothes; neither shall he go in to any dead body." English translation:

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יְהוּ כּוּלָּן מַקְרִיבִין אוֹנְנִים? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי נֵזֶר שֶׁמֶן מִשְׁחַת אֱלֹהָיו עָלָיו״ – ״עָלָיו״ וְלֹא עַל חֲבֵירוֹ. וְאַחַר שֶׁחָלְקוּ הַכָּתוּב, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא מְצֻוֶּוה עַל הַבְּתוּלָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּא״.
human_translation: might all of sacrifice acute mourners. the verse states: “For the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is upon him” “Upon him,” but not upon another And after the verse differentiated might that he would not be commanded to a virgin, the verse states “And he
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it possible that all may bring offerings while in a state of aninut (mourning)? The Torah states: "For the anointing oil of his God is upon him" - "upon him" and not upon his fellow. And after the verse has made this distinction, one might think that he is not commanded regarding virginity? The Torah states: "And he shall be."

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״וְהוּא אִשָּׁה בִבְתוּלֶיהָ יִקָּח״, אַחַר שֶׁחִלֵּק הַכָּתוּב, רִיבָּה. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁעָבַר מֵחֲמַת קִרְיוֹ, מֵחֲמַת מוּמִין מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּא״.
human_translation: parallel to tanna’im “And he shall take a wife in her virginity.” Once the verse had distinguished included the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: I have only who stepped down due to his seminal emission From where due to blemishes, the verse states: “And he,”
llm_translation: Tannaim: "And he shall take a wife in her virginity," after the Scripture divided, it multiplied. The words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: I only know that he passed due to a seminal emission, from where do we derive due to blemishes? The Talmud teaches: "And he."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: מָשִׁיחַ שֶׁנִּצְטָרַע, מַהוּ בְּאַלְמָנָה? מִידְחָא דָּחֵי, אוֹ מִיפְטָר פָּטַר? לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: an anointed who was afflicted with leprosy, what is with regard to a widow? disqualified Or absolved was not available to him.
llm_translation: Rava asked a question of Rav Nachman: If the anointed one becomes afflicted with tzara'at, what is the law regarding a widow? Does he push her away immediately, or does he exempt her? It was not in his hands.

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין הָוֵי יָתֵיב רַב פָּפָּא וְקָמִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרַב פָּפָּא, תְּנֵינָא: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא שֶׁעָבַר מֵחֲמַת קִרְיוֹ, עָבַר מֵחֲמַת מוּמִין מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּא״. קָם נַשְּׁקֵיהּ בְּרֵישֵׁיהּ וִיהַיב לֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה.
human_translation: occasion, Rav Pappa was sitting and he raised dilemma. Huna, son of Rav Naḥman, said to Rav Pappa: We learn I have only who stepped down due to his seminal emission From where due to blemishes, The verse states: “And he.” he arose kissed him on his head and gave him his daughter
llm_translation: At times, Rav Papa would sit and ask. He said to him, Huna, son of Rav Nahman, to Rav Papa, we learned: I only have that which passed due to a seminal emission, how do I know that which passed due to blemishes? The Talmud says: "And he." He got up, kissed him on his head, and gave him his daughter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל פּוֹרֵם מִלְּמַטָּה, וְהַהֶדְיוֹט מִלְמַעְלָה. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מַקְרִיב אוֹנֵן וְלֹא אוֹכֵל, וְהַהֶדְיוֹט לֹא מַקְרִיב וְלֹא אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: A High Priest rends from below and an ordinary from above A High Priest sacrifices an acute mourner, but he may not eat And an ordinary neither sacrifices nor eats
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The High Priest removes the ashes from below, while the commoner removes the ashes from above. The High Priest offers a sacrifice while in mourning and does not eat from it, whereas the commoner neither offers a sacrifice nor eats from it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר [רַב]: לְמַטָּה – לְמַטָּה מַמָּשׁ, לְמַעְלָה – לְמַעְלָה מַמָּשׁ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לְמַטָּה – לְמַטָּה מִקַּמֵּי שָׂפָה, לְמַעְלָה – לְמַעְלָה מִקַּמֵּי שָׂפָה. וְזֶה וָזֶה בַּצַּוָּאר.
human_translation: Rav says: From below, actually from below, from above actually from above, And Shmuel said: From below from below the neckline, and from above from above the neckline, and this and that at the neck
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rav: below - below literally, above - above literally. And Shmuel said: below - below from the edge of the lip, above - above from the edge of the lip. And this and this in the neck.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: עַל כׇּל הַמֵּתִים כּוּלָּן – רָצָה מַבְדִּיל קַמֵּי שָׂפָה שֶׁלּוֹ, רָצָה אֵינוֹ מַבְדִּיל קַמֵּי שָׂפָה שֶׁלּוֹ. עַל אָבִיו וְעַל אִמּוֹ – מַבְדִּיל, כֵּיוָן דִּבְעָלְמָא הָוֵי קֶרַע, קְרִי כָּאן ״בְּגָדָיו לֹא יִפְרֹם״!
human_translation: raises an objection For all the dead he wishes he rends the neckline of his asunder; he wishes he does not rend the neckline of his asunder. for his father or for his mother he rends asunder. Since in general, it is a tear read here “Nor rend his garments”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: concerning all the deceased - if he wishes, he may separate before his own language, if he wishes, he may not separate before his own language. But concerning his father and his mother - he must separate, since in the world it is considered disrespectful, as it is written here, "His garments he shall not rend"!

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: כׇּל קֶרַע שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַבְדִּיל שָׂפָה שֶׁלּוֹ, אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא קֶרַע שֶׁל תִּפְלוּת. וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה קְרִיעָה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל?
human_translation: Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who says: Any tear that does not rend his neckline asunder is only a gratuitous tear And is Rabbi Yehuda of rending for a High Priest?
llm_translation: Samuel like Rabbi Yehuda holds, for he said: Any tear that does not separate its edge, is nothing but a tear of prayer. And who agrees with Rabbi Yehuda regarding tearing for the High Priest?

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״רֹאשׁ לֹא יִפְרָע וּבֶגֶד לֹא יִפְרֹם״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: בְּרֹאשׁ וּבֶגֶד שֶׁל סוֹטָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ לֹא יִפְרָע וּבְגָדָיו לֹא יִפְרֹם״, שֶׁאֵינוֹ בִּפְרִיעָה וּפְרִימָה כׇּל עִיקָּר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ פּוֹרֵם כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁבְּנֵי אָדָם פּוֹרְמִין, אֶלָּא הוּא מִלְּמַטָּה וְהַהֶדְיוֹט מִלְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Had it been stated: He shall neither let the hair of a head grow, nor rend garments, I would have said: with regard to the head and the garment of a woman suspected by her husband of having been unfaithful [ sota ] the verse is speaking, the verse states: “He shall neither let the hair of his head grow, nor rend his garments” that he is not in grow long and rend at all; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yishmael says: He does not rend in the manner that people rend Rather, he from below and an ordinary from above.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in a Baraita: If it had only said, "His head shall not be uncovered, and his clothes shall not be torn," I would have said that the Torah is speaking specifically about the head and clothes of a Sotah. The Torah therefore teaches us: "His head shall not be uncovered, and his clothes shall not be torn," to indicate that the primary prohibition is not about uncovering and tearing, these are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yishmael says: He does not uncover in the manner that people normally uncover, rather he uncovers from below and the commoner from above.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda with regard to one and disagrees with him with regard to one
llm_translation: Shmuel thought like Rabbi Yehuda in one matter, and he disagreed with him in another matter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל הַתָּדִיר מֵחֲבֵירוֹ קוֹדֵם אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, וְכׇל הַמְקוּדָּשׁ מֵחֲבֵירוֹ קוֹדֵם אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ. פַּר הַמָּשִׁיחַ וּפַר הָעֵדָה עוֹמְדִים – פַּר הַמָּשִׁיחַ קוֹדֵם לְפַר הָעֵדָה בְּכׇל מַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: Any that is frequent than another precedes other And anyone who is sanctified than another precedes other the bull of the anointed and the bull of the congregation, are pending, the bull of the anointed priest precedes the bull of the congregation in all its actions,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Anything that is more frequent than its counterpart takes precedence over its counterpart, and anything that is more sacred than its counterpart takes precedence over its counterpart. The bull of the anointed priest and the bull of the congregation stand together - the bull of the anointed priest takes precedence over the bull of the congregation in all its actions.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מִלְּבַד עוֹלַת הַבֹּקֶר אֲשֶׁר לְעוֹלַת הַתָּמִיד״, (לְמָה לִי) מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב ״עוֹלַת הַבֹּקֶר״ – ״עוֹלַת הַתָּמִיד״ לְמָה לִי? הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: כֹּל דִּתְדִירָה קָדְמָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters Abaye said: as the verse states “Beside the burnt-offering of the morning, which is for a daily burnt-offering” Once it is written: “The burnt-offering of the morning,” why do I “A daily burnt-offering”? This the Merciful One is saying: Any that is frequent takes precedence.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Abbaye, de'amar kra: "Milevad olat haboker asher letamid," (lema li) mikdei k'tiv "olat haboker" - "olat hatamid" lema li? Hakhi ka'amar rachamana: Kol didtirah kadma. English translation: What is the conclusion regarding these matters? Abbaye said, as the verse states: "Besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for the continual burnt offering," (why do I need) since it is written "burnt offering of the morning" - "continual burnt offering," why do I need it? This is what the Merciful One is saying: Whatever is more frequent takes precedence.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הַמְקוּדָּשׁ מֵחֲבֵירוֹ הוּא קוֹדֵם אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ. מְנָלַן? דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ״ – לְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבִּקְדוּשָּׁה: לִפְתּוֹחַ רִאשׁוֹן, וּלְבָרֵךְ רִאשׁוֹן, וְלִיטּוֹל מָנָה יָפָה רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: And anyone who is sanctified than another precedes other From where do we as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, “And you shall sanctify him, with regard to any matter of sanctity. to open first and to recite the blessing first, and to take a fine portion first.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And all that is sanctified from his fellow, he precedes his fellow. From where do we derive this? As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: 'And you shall sanctify him' - for every matter of sanctity: to open first, and to bless first, and to take a beautiful portion first."

hebrew_text: פַּר כֹּהֵן מָשׁוּחַ וּפַר עֵדָה כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשָׂרַף אוֹתוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׂרַף אֵת הַפָּר הָרִאשׁוֹן״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״הָרִאשׁוֹן״? שֶׁיְּהֵא רִאשׁוֹן, קוֹדֵם לְפַר הָעֵדָה בְּכׇל מַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: the bull of the anointed priest and the bull of the congregation, From where are these matters as the Sages taught: “And he shall burn it as he burned the first bull” Why the verse state “the first”? that the first precedes the bull of the congregation in all its actions.
llm_translation: Bull priest anointed and bull congregation like. From where these words? For taught Rabbis: "And he shall burn it as he burned the first bull," what teaching to say "the first"? That it should be first, before the bull of the congregation in all its actions.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פַּר כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ וּפַר הָעֵדָה עוֹמְדִים – פַּר כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ קוֹדֵם לְפַר הָעֵדָה בְּכׇל מַעֲשָׂיו. הוֹאִיל וּמָשִׁיחַ מְכַפֵּר, וְעֵדָה מִתְכַּפֶּרֶת – דִּין הוּא שֶׁיַּקְדִּים הַמְכַפֵּר לַמִּתְכַּפֵּר, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְכִפֶּר בַּעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד בֵּיתוֹ וּבְעַד כׇּל קְהַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: The Sages taught the bull of the anointed priest and the bull of the congregation are pending, the bull of the anointed priest precedes the bull of the congregation in all its actions. Since the anointed atones and the congregation gains atonement, it is logical that the one who atones will precede the one who gains atonement. And so states: “And he shall atone for himself, and for his household, and for all the congregation of Israel”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The bull of the anointed Kohen Gadol and the bull of the congregation stand – the bull of the anointed Kohen Gadol precedes the bull of the congregation in all its actions. Since the anointed one atones, and the congregation is atoned for – it is proper that the one who atones precedes the one being atoned for. As it says: "And he shall make atonement for himself and for his household and for the entire assembly of Israel."

hebrew_text: פַּר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר קוֹדֵם לְפַר שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? הַאי חַטָּאת וְהַאי עוֹלָה, וְתַנְיָא: ״וְהִקְרִיב אֶת אֲשֶׁר לְחַטָּאת רִאשׁוֹנָה״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אִם לְלַמֵּד שֶׁתְּהֵא חַטָּאת רִאשׁוֹנָה, הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְאֶת הַשֵּׁנִי יַעֲשֶׂה עוֹלָה כַּמִּשְׁפָּט״! אֶלָּא זֶה בָּנָה אָב שֶׁיְּהוּ כׇּל חַטָּאוֹת קוֹדְמוֹת לְעוֹלוֹת הַבָּאִים עִמָּהֶם, וְקַיְימָא לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ חַטַּאת הָעוֹף קוֹדֶמֶת לְעוֹלַת בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: A bull for an unwitting communal sin precedes a bull for idol worship. What is the reason This, a sin-offering, and that, a burnt-offering, and it is taught “And he shall sacrifice that which is for the sin-offering first” why the verse state If to teach that the sin offering will be first, it is already stated: “And the second he shall prepare as a burnt-offering according to the ordinance” Rather, this established a paradigm that all sin-offerings precede the burnt-offerings that accompany them, and we maintain that even bird sin-offerings precede animal burnt-offerings.
llm_translation: Bull of the community precedes bull of foreign worship. What is the reason? This sin offering and this burnt offering, and it was taught: "And he shall offer that which is for the sin offering first." What is the teaching for? If to teach that the sin offering should be first, behold it is already stated: "And the second he shall make a burnt offering according to the ordinance"! Rather, this teaches that a father should establish all previous sin offerings before the burnt offerings that come with them, and we hold that even a sin offering of a bird precedes a burnt offering of an animal.

hebrew_text: פַּר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה קוֹדֵם לִשְׂעִיר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אַמַּאי? הַאי חַטָּאת, וְהַאי עוֹלָה! אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא בַּר מָרִי: חַטַּאת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה חַסִּירָא אָלֶף, ״לְחַטָּת״ כְּתִיב. רָבָא אָמַר: ״כַּמִּשְׁפָּט״ כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: A bull for idol worship precedes a goat for idol worship Why this, a sin-offering, and that, a burnt-offering? In the West, they say in the name of Rava bar Mari: the sin-offering for idol worship is lacking an alef , “ leḥattat ” is written Rava said: “According to the ordinance” is written concerning it,
llm_translation: A young bull of foreign worship precedes a he-goat of foreign worship, why? This is for the sin offering, and this is for the burnt offering! They said in the West in the name of Rava bar Mari: The sin offering of foreign worship is lacking one thousand, "for sin" is written. Rava said: "According to the ordinance" is written in it.

hebrew_text: שְׂעִיר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה קוֹדֵם לִשְׂעִיר נָשִׂיא. מַאי טַעְמָא? הַאי צִבּוּר וְהַאי יָחִיד, שְׂעִיר נָשִׂיא קוֹדֵם לִשְׂעִירַת יָחִיד. מַאי טַעְמָא? הַאי מֶלֶךְ וְהַאי הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: The goat for idol worship precedes the goat of the king. What is the reason this public and that an individual, The male goat of the king precedes the female goat of the individual. What is the reason This a king, and that a commoner.
llm_translation: The scapegoat of foreign worship precedes the scapegoat of the leader. What is the reason? This one is for the community, and this one is for the individual; the scapegoat of the leader precedes the scapegoat of the individual. What is the reason? This one is for a king, and this one is for a commoner.

hebrew_text: שְׂעִירַת יָחִיד קוֹדֶמֶת לְכִבְשַׂת יָחִיד. וְהָא תַּנְיָא: כִּבְשַׂת יָחִיד קוֹדֶמֶת לִשְׂעִירַת יָחִיד! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, מָר סָבַר: שְׂעִירָה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבְּתָה אֵצֶל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּיָחִיד. וּמָר סָבַר: כִּבְשָׂה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן נִתְרַבְּתָה בְּאַלְיָה.
human_translation: The female goat of an individual precedes the ewe of an individual But isn’t it taught The ewe of an individual precedes the female goat of an individual? Abaye said: It is tanna’im . Sage holds a female goat is preferable as it has an increased for idol worship by an individual, And Sage holds ewe is preferable as it has more tail
llm_translation: The goat of an individual precedes the sheep of an individual. But isn't it taught: The sheep of an individual precedes the goat of an individual! Abaye said: It is a dispute of Tannaim, for Master holds: a goat is preferable, as it has become accustomed to foreign worship in private. And Master holds: a sheep is preferable, as it has become accustomed to the upper chamber.

hebrew_text: עוֹמֶר קוֹדֵם לְכֶבֶשׂ הַבָּא עִמּוֹ, שְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם קוֹדְמִים לִכְבָשִׂים הַבָּאִים עִמָּהֶם. זֶה הַכְּלָל: דָּבָר הַבָּא בְּגִין (לַ)יוֹם קוֹדֵם לְדָבָר הַבָּא בְּגִין לֶחֶם.
human_translation: omer precedes the lamb that accompanies it; the two loaves, precede the sheep that accompany them. This is the principle: A matter that comes due to the day precedes a matter that comes due to bread.
llm_translation: Omer precedes the lamb that comes with it, two loaves precede the lambs that come with them. This is the principle: an item that comes for the sake of the day precedes an item that comes for the sake of bread.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִישׁ קוֹדֵם לָאִשָּׁה לְהַחֲיוֹת וּלְהָשֵׁב אֲבֵדָה. וְהָאִשָּׁה קוֹדֶמֶת לָאִישׁ לִכְסוּת וּלְהוֹצִיא מִבֵּית הַשְּׁבִי. בִּזְמַן שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם עוֹמְדִים בְּקַלְקָלָה – הָאִישׁ קוֹדֵם לָאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: The man precedes the woman to rescue or to return a lost item And the woman precedes the man to a garment or to release from captivity When they are both subject to degradation, the man precedes the woman.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man precedes a woman in saving and returning a lost object. And a woman precedes a man in providing clothing and taking out from captivity. When both of them are in a state of confusion - the man precedes the woman.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָיָה הוּא וְאָבִיו וְרַבּוֹ בַּשֶּׁבִי – הוּא קוֹדֵם לְרַבּוֹ, וְרַבּוֹ קוֹדֵם לְאָבִיו. אִמּוֹ קוֹדֶמֶת לְכוּלָּם.
human_translation: the Sages taught one and his father and his teacher were in captivity, his precedes his teacher’s and his teacher’s precedes his father’s His mother’s precedes all of them.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If he, his father, and his teacher are in captivity - he takes precedence over his teacher, his teacher takes precedence over his father. His mother precedes them all.

hebrew_text: חָכָם קוֹדֵם לְמֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל: חָכָם שֶׁמֵּת – אֵין לָנוּ כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ. מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁמֵּת – כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל רְאוּיִם לַמַּלְכוּת.
human_translation: A Torah scholar precedes the king of Israel, a Sage who dies, we have no one like him, but a king of Israel who dies, all of Israel are fit for royalty.
llm_translation: A wise man precedes the King of Israel. A wise man who dies - we have no one like him. The King of Israel who dies - all of Israel are fit for kingship.

hebrew_text: מֶלֶךְ קוֹדֵם לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ (אֲלֵיהֶם) [לָהֶם] קְחוּ עִמָּכֶם (אוֹ מֵעַבְדֵי) [אֶת עַבְדֵי] אֲדֹנֵיכֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: A king precedes a High Priest, as it is stated: “And the king said unto them: Take with you the servants of your lord”
llm_translation: King precedes to high priest, as it is said: "And the king said (to them), 'Take with you (either from your servants) the servants of your lord, etc.'"

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל קוֹדֵם לְנָבִיא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמָשַׁח אֹתוֹ שָׁם צָדוֹק הַכֹּהֵן וְנָתָן הַנָּבִיא״. הִקְדִּים צָדוֹק לְנָתָן. וְאוֹמֵר: ״שְׁמַע נָא יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדוֹל אַתָּה וְרֵעֶיךָ וְגוֹ׳״. יָכוֹל הֶדְיוֹטוֹת הָיוּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי אַנְשֵׁי מוֹפֵת הֵמָּה״, וְאֵין ״מוֹפֵת״ אֶלָּא נָבִיא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַן אֵלֶיךָ אוֹת אוֹ מוֹפֵת״.
human_translation: A High Priest precedes a prophet, as it is stated: “And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there” Zadok before Natan. And says: “Hear now, Joshua the High Priest, you and your colleagues might were laymen. the verse states: “For they are men that are a sign,” and “sign” nothing other than a prophet, as it is stated: “And he gives you a sign or a wonder”
llm_translation: High Priest precedes Prophet, as it is stated: "And anoint him there, Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet." Zadok preceded Nathan. And it says: "Listen now, Joshua the High Priest, you and your friends, etc." Could they have been laymen? The verse teaches: "For they are men of wonder," and "wonder" refers only to a prophet, as it is stated: "And he will give you a sign or wonder."

hebrew_text: מָשׁוּחַ בְּשֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה קוֹדֵם לִמְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים. מְרוּבֵּה בְגָדִים קוֹדֵם לְמָשִׁיחַ שֶׁעָבַר מֵחֲמַת קִרְיוֹ. מָשִׁיחַ שֶׁעָבַר מֵחֲמַת קִרְיוֹ קוֹדֵם לְעָבַר מֵחֲמַת מוּמוֹ. עָבַר מֵחֲמַת מוּמוֹ קוֹדֵם לִמְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה. מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה קוֹדֵם לִסְגָן.
human_translation: anointed with anointing oil precedes multiple garments. multiple garments precedes an anointed who stepped down, due to his seminal emission. An anointed who stepped down due to his seminal emission precedes stepped down due to his blemish. stepped down due to his blemish precedes anointed for war. anointed for war precedes a deputy
llm_translation: Anointed with anointing oil precedes wearing garments. Wearing garments precedes the anointed High Priest who has passed due to a seminal emission. The anointed High Priest who has passed due to a seminal emission precedes one who has passed due to a blemish. One who has passed due to a blemish precedes one anointed for war. One anointed for war precedes the deputy.

hebrew_text: סְגָן קוֹדֵם לַאֲמַרְכָּל. מַאי אֲמַרְכָּל? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אָמַר כּוֹלָּא. אֲמַרְכָּל קוֹדֵם לְגִזְבָּר, גִּזְבָּר קוֹדֵם לְרֹאשׁ מִשְׁמָר, רֹאשׁ מִשְׁמָר קוֹדֵם לְרֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב, רֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב קוֹדֵם לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: A deputy precedes the overseer [ la’amarkal ], What amarkal ? Rav Ḥisda said: amar kulla , overseer precedes treasurer. treasurer precedes head of watch head of watch precedes head of patrilineal family. head of patrilineal family precedes an ordinary priest.
llm_translation: Deputy precedes Chamberlain. What is Chamberlain? Rav Hisda said: He said everything. Chamberlain precedes Treasurer, Treasurer precedes Chief of the Guard, Chief of the Guard precedes Head of the Household, Head of the Household precedes Lay Priest.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה, סְגָן וּמְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה אֵיזֶה מֵהֶם קוֹדֵם?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before With regard to the matter of ritual impurity, deputy and anointed for war which of them precedes
llm_translation: He asked them: In the matter of impurity, which one takes precedence, a deputy or a commander of war?

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא: סְגָן וּמְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִים בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּפָגַע בָּהֶם מֵת מִצְוָה, מוּטָב שֶׁיִּטַּמֵּא מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה וְאַל יִטַּמֵּא סְגָן, שֶׁאִם יֶאֱרַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, נִכְנָס הַסְּגָן וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ תַּחְתָּיו. וְהָתַנְיָא: מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה קוֹדֵם לַסְּגָן! אָמַר רָבִינָא, כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא לְהַחְיוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, son of Rav Naḥman, said: Come hear as it is taught a deputy and anointed for war who were walking along the path and they encountered a met mitzva it is preferable that anointed for war will become ritually impure and the deputy will not become ritually impure. that if disqualification befalls the High Priest, the deputy enters and performs service in his stead. But isn’t it taught anointed for war precedes a deputy Ravina said: When that is taught, with regard to rescuing him,
llm_translation: Master Zutra, son of Rav Nachman, said: Come and hear, as it was taught: If a deputy and a commander of the army were walking on the road and they encountered a dead body, it is better for the commander to become ritually impure from the dead body and not the deputy, for if a disqualification were to occur in him, the High Priest would be disqualified. The deputy enters and serves under him. And it was taught: The commander precedes the deputy! Ravina said: When that teaching was taught, it was to keep him alive.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן קוֹדֵם לְלֵוִי, לֵוִי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַמְזֵר, וּמַמְזֵר לְנָתִין, וְנָתִין לְגֵר, וְגֵר לְעֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר. אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁכּוּלָּם שָׁוִים. אֲבָל אִם הָיָה מַמְזֵר תַּלְמִיד חָכָם וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל עַם הָאָרֶץ – מַמְזֵר תַּלְמִיד חָכָם קוֹדֵם לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל עַם הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: A priest precedes a Levite. A Levite an Israelite. An Israelite a son born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzer ], and a mamzer a Gibeonite, and a Gibeonite a convert, and a convert an emancipated slave. When when they are all equal But if there were a mamzer a Torah scholar and a High Priest an ignoramus, a mamzer a Torah scholar precedes a High Priest an ignoramus,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A Kohen precedes a Levi, a Levi precedes a Yisrael, a Yisrael precedes a Mamzer, a Mamzer precedes a Natin, a Natin precedes a convert, and a convert precedes a freed slave. When is this the case? When all of them are equal. However, if a Mamzer is a Torah scholar and a great Kohen is an ignorant person, the Mamzer Torah scholar precedes the great Kohen ignorant person.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כֹּהֵן קוֹדֵם לְלֵוִי – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״(וּבְנֵי) [בְּנֵי] עַמְרָם אַהֲרֹן וּמֹשֶׁה וַיִּבָּדֵל אַהֲרֹן (לְהַקְרִיב) [לְהַקְדִּישׁוֹ] קֹדֶשׁ (הַקֳּדָשִׁים) [קָדָשִׁים]״. לֵוִי קוֹדֵם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל – שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא הִבְדִּיל ה׳ אֶת שֵׁבֶט הַלֵּוִי (מִתּוֹךְ) וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: A priest precedes a Levite, as it is stated: “The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses, and Aaron was separated that he should be sanctified as the most sacred” A Levite precedes an Israelite, as it is stated: “At that time the Lord separated the tribe of Levi,
llm_translation: Gemar Kohain kodem leLevi - shene'emar: "(uvenei) benei Amram Aharon uMoshe va'yibadel Aharon (le'hakriv) le'hakdisho kodesh (ha'kodashim) kadashim." Levi kodem leYisrael - shene'emar: "ba'et hahi hivdil Hashem et shevet haLevi (mitoch) vego."

hebrew_text: יִשְׂרָאֵל קוֹדֵם לְמַמְזֵר – שֶׁזֶּה מְיוּחָס, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ מְיוּחָס. מַמְזֵר קוֹדֵם לְנָתִין – זֶה בָּא מִטִּפָּה כְּשֵׁרָה, וְזֶה בָּא מִטִּפָּה פְּסוּלָה. נָתִין קוֹדֵם לְגֵר – זֶה גָּדַל עִמָּנוּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְזֶה לֹא גָּדַל עִמָּנוּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה. גֵּר קוֹדֵם לְעֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר – זֶה הָיָה בִּכְלַל אָרוּר, וְזֶה לֹא הָיָה בִּכְלַל אָרוּר.
human_translation: An Israelite precedes a mamzer because this of lineage and that not of lineage A mamzer precedes a Gibeonite because this comes from a fit drop and that comes from an unfit drop A Gibeonite precedes a convert, this grew among us in sanctity and that did not grow among us in sanctity. A convert precedes an emancipated slave this was in the category of curse and that was not in the category of curse.
llm_translation: Israel precedes a mamzer - because this one is of lineage, and this one is not of lineage. A mamzer precedes a natin - this one comes from a permissible drop, and this one comes from an impermissible drop. A natin precedes a convert - this one grew up with us in sanctity, and this one did not grow up with us in sanctity. A convert precedes a freed slave - this one was included in the curse, and this one was not included in the curse.

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי? בִּזְמַן שֶׁכּוּלָּן שָׁוִין כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״יְקָרָה הִיא מִפְּנִינִים״, מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנִּכְנָס לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים.
human_translation: When when they are all equal From where are these matters Rav Aḥa, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: as the verse states: “She is more precious than rubies [ mipeninim ]” than High Priest who enters the innermost sanctum [ lifnai velifnim ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When? At a time when they are all equal. From where do we derive these words? Rav Acha, son of Rabbi Chanina, said, as the verse states: "She is more precious than pearls," referring to the High Priest who enters inside and inside.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר: בַּדִּין הוּא שֶׁיַּקְדִּים עֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר לְגֵר, שֶׁזֶּה גָּדַל עִמָּנוּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְזֶה לֹא גָּדַל עִמָּנוּ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה. אֶלָּא זֶה הָיָה בִּכְלַל אָרוּר, וְזֶה לֹא הָיָה בִּכְלַל אָרוּר.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai says: By right, an emancipated slave should have preceded a convert, because this grew among us in sanctity, and that did not grow among us in sanctity. But this was in the category of curse, and that was not in the category of curse.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai says: It is just that one should sell a freed slave to a convert, for this one grew up among us in sanctity, while this one did not grow up among us in sanctity. Rather, this one was included in the curse, and this one was not included in the curse.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי צָדוֹק: מִפְּנֵי מָה הַכֹּל רָצִין לִישָּׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת, וְאֵין הַכֹּל רָצִין לִישָּׂא מְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת? אָמַר לָהֶם: זוֹ הָיְתָה בִּכְלַל אָרוּר, וְזוֹ לֹא הָיְתָה בִּכְלַל אָרוּר. דָּבָר אַחֵר: זוֹ הָיְתָה בְּחֶזְקַת שָׁמוּר, וְזוֹ לֹא הָיְתָה בְּחֶזְקַת שָׁמוּר.
human_translation: The students of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, asked For what does everyone, run to marry a female convert, and not everyone runs to marry an emancipated He said to them: This was in the category of curse, that was not in the category of curse. Alternatively, this has the presumptive status of chastity, and that does not have the presumptive status of chastity.
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok: "Why is everyone eager to marry a convert, but not everyone is eager to marry a freed woman?" He said to them: "This one was included in the curse, and this one was not included in the curse. Another explanation: This one was in the category of being guarded, and this one was not in the category of being guarded."

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִפְּנֵי מָה הַכֶּלֶב מַכִּיר אֶת קוֹנוֹ, וְחָתוּל אֵינוֹ מַכִּיר אֶת קוֹנוֹ? אָמַר לָהֶם: וּמָה הָאוֹכֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁעַכְבָּר אוֹכֵל – מְשַׁכֵּחַ, הָאוֹכֵל עַכְבָּר עַצְמוֹ – עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: The students of Rabbi Elazar asked For what does a dog recognize its master, while a cat does not recognize its master? said to them: If one who eats from that which a mouse eats, causes him to forget, who eats the mouse itself, all the more so
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Elazar: "Why does a dog recognize its owner, but a cat does not recognize its owner?" He said to them: "And what about the one who eats from what a mouse eats - forgets, but the one who eats the mouse itself - all the more so."

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מִפְּנֵי מָה הַכֹּל מוֹשְׁלִים בָּעַכְבָּרִים? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסּוּרַן רַע. מַאי הִיא? רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ גְּלִימֵי גָּיְיצִי.
human_translation: The students of Rabbi Eliezer asked For what all dominate mice Because their inclination [ shesuran ] is evil. What is They gnaw even at cloaks,
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Eliezer: "Why is everything compared to mice?" "Because their evil inclination is strong," he replied. What is it? Rava said: "Even the coats of the Gittite."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ שׁוּפְתָּא [דְּ]מָרָא גָּיְיצִי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: They gnaw even on the handle of a hoe.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even the lip of a shepherd is arrogant.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן. חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים מְשַׁכְּחִים אֶת הַתַּלְמוּד: הָאוֹכֵל מִמַּה שֶּׁאוֹכֵל עַכְבָּר וּמִמַּה שֶּׁאוֹכֵל חָתוּל, וְהָאוֹכֵל לֵב שֶׁל בְּהֵמָה, וְהָרָגִיל בְּזֵיתִים, וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה מַיִם שֶׁל שִׁיּוּרֵי רְחִיצָה, וְהָרוֹחֵץ רַגְלָיו זוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי זוֹ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַמַּנִּיחַ כֵּלָיו תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו. חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים מְשִׁיבִים אֶת הַתַּלְמוּד: פַּת פֶּחָמִין וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן פֶּחָמִין עַצְמָן, וְהָאוֹכֵל בֵּיצָה מְגוּלְגֶּלֶת בְּלֹא מֶלַח, וְהָרָגִיל בְּשֶׁמֶן זַיִת, וְהָרָגִיל בְּיַיִן וּבְשָׂמִים, וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה מַיִם שֶׁל שִׁיּוּרֵי עִיסָּה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַטּוֹבֵל אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּמֶלַח וְאוֹכֵל.
human_translation: The Sages taught five factors cause forget study: One who eats from that which a mouse eats and from that which a cat eats, and one who eats the heart of an animal, and one who is accustomed to olives, and one who drinks water that remains from washing, and one who washes his feet this atop that And some say: Also one who places his garments under his head. five factors restore study: bread baked on coals and all the more so coals themselves, and one who eats a hard-boiled egg [ beitza megulgelet ] without salt, and one who is accustomed to olive oil, and one who is accustomed to wine and spices, and one who drinks water that remains from dough. And some say: Also one who dips his finger in salt and eats
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Five things cause forgetfulness of the Talmud: one who eats from what a mouse eats, and from what a cat eats, and one who eats the heart of an animal, and one who is accustomed to eating olives, and one who drinks water used for washing feet, and one who washes one foot over the other. And some say: even one who places his kidneys under his head. Five things restore the Talmud: coarse bread, and all the more so coarse bread itself, and one who eats a peeled egg without salt, and one who is accustomed to olive oil, and one who is accustomed to wine and perfumes, and one who drinks water used for kneading dough. And some say: even one who dips his finger in salt and eats.

hebrew_text: ״הָרָגִיל בְּשֶׁמֶן זַיִת״. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַזַּיִת מְשַׁכֵּחַ תַּלְמוּד שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה, כָּךְ שֶׁמֶן זַיִת מֵשִׁיב תַּלְמוּד שֶׁל שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה.
human_translation: One who is accustomed to olive oil supports Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Just as an olive causes to forget seventy years’ worth of study, olive oil restores seventy years’ worth of study.
llm_translation: "The one who is accustomed to olive oil." It assists Rabbi Yochanan, for Rabbi Yochanan said: Just as olive oil causes one to forget seventy years of learning, so too olive oil brings back seventy years of learning.

hebrew_text: ״וְהָרָגִיל בְּיַיִן וּבְשָׂמִים״. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: חַמְרָא וְרֵיחָנֵי פַּקַּחִין.
human_translation: And one who is accustomed to wine and spices supports Rava, as Rava said: Wine and spices rendered me wise.
llm_translation: "And one who is accustomed to wine and perfumes." Supports for Rava, for Rava said: Wine and pleasant scents open the mind.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַטּוֹבֵל אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּמֶלַח״, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וּבְאַחַת. כְּתַנָּאֵי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שְׁתַּיִם וְלֹא שָׁלֹשׁ. וְסִימָנָיךְ: קְמִיצָה.
human_translation: One who dips his finger in salt Reish Lakish says: And with regard to one parallel to tanna’im . Rabbi Yehuda says: One but not two. Rabbi Yosei says: Two but not three. And your mnemonic kemitza ,
llm_translation: "And one who dips his finger in salt," Reish Lakish said: "And with one." As the Tannaim taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: "One and not two," Rabbi Yosei says: "Two and not three." And your mnemonic: a handful.

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה דְּבָרִים קָשִׁים לַתַּלְמוּד: הָעוֹבֵר תַּחַת הָאַפְסָר [הַגָּמָל] וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן תַּחַת גָּמָל [עַצְמוֹ], וְהָעוֹבֵר בֵּין שְׁנֵי גְּמַלִּים, וְהָעוֹבֵר בֵּין שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, וְהָאִשָּׁה הָעוֹבֶרֶת בֵּין שְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים, וְהָעוֹבֵר מִתַּחַת רֵיחַ רַע שֶׁל נְבֵילָה, וְהָעוֹבֵר תַּחַת הַגֶּשֶׁר שֶׁלֹּא עָבְרוּ תַּחְתָּיו מַיִם אַרְבָּעִים יוֹם, וְהָאוֹכֵל פַּת שֶׁלֹּא בָּשַׁל כׇּל צָרְכּוֹ, וְהָאוֹכֵל בָּשָׂר מִזּוּהֲמָא לִיסְטְרוֹן, וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה מֵאַמַּת הַמַּיִם הָעוֹבֶרֶת בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת, וְהַמִּסְתַּכֵּל בִּפְנֵי הַמֵּת. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף הַקּוֹרֵא כְּתָב שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי הַקֶּבֶר.
human_translation: Ten factors are detrimental for study: One who passes beneath the bit of the camel, and all the more so beneath a camel itself; and one who passes between two camels; and one who passes between two women; and a woman who passes between two men; and one who passes beneath foul odor of an animal carcass; and one who passes under a bridge beneath which water has not passed forty days; and one who eats bread that was not sufficiently baked; and one who eats meat from zuhama listeron , and one who drinks from an aqueduct that passes through a cemetery; and one who gazes at the face of the dead. And some say: Also one who reads the writing that is on a grave.
llm_translation: Ten things are difficult for study: one who passes beneath the tail of a camel, and all the more so beneath the camel itself, and one who passes between two camels, and one who passes between two women, and a woman who passes between two men, and one who passes beneath the stench of a carcass, and one who passes beneath a bridge under which water has not flowed for forty days, and one who eats uncooked bread for all his needs, and one who eats meat cooked in vinegar, and one who drinks water from a pitcher that passed through a cemetery, and one who gazes at a dead body. And some say: even one who reads writing on a tombstone.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּשֶׁהַנָּשִׂיא נִכְנָס, כׇּל הָעָם עוֹמְדִים, וְאֵין יוֹשְׁבִים עַד שֶׁאוֹמֵר לָהֶם: שֵׁבוּ. כְּשֶׁאַב בֵּית דִּין נִכְנָס, עוֹשִׂים לוֹ שׁוּרָה אַחַת מִכָּאן וְשׁוּרָה אַחַת מִכָּאן, עַד שֶׁיֵּשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ. כְּשֶׁחָכָם נִכְנָס, אֶחָד עוֹמֵד וְאֶחָד יוֹשֵׁב, עַד שֶׁיֵּשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ. בְּנֵי חֲכָמִים וְתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, בִּזְמַן שֶׁרַבִּים צְרִיכִים לָהֶם – מַפְסִיעִין עַל רָאשֵׁי הָעָם. יָצָא לְצוֹרֶךְ – יִכָּנֵס וְיֵשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught When the Nasi enters, all the people stand and they do not sit until he says to them: Sit. When the deputy Nasi enters, form for him one row from here, and one row from there, until he sits in his place, When the Ḥakham , enters, one stands and another sits, until he sits in his place. When the multitudes require their sons of the Sages and Torah scholars may step over the heads of the people left for purpose he may enter and sit in his place
llm_translation: The sages taught: When the prince enters, all the people stand, and do not sit until he says to them: Sit. When a court official enters, they make for him one row from here and one row from there, until he sits in his place. When a scholar enters, one stands and one sits, until he sits in his place. Regarding scholars and disciples of scholars, when many are needed – they make way for them among the people. If he needs to leave – he may leave and sit in his place.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁמְּמוּנִּים אֲבִיהֶם פַּרְנָס עַל הַצִּבּוּר, בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם דַּעַת לִשְׁמוֹעַ – נִכְנָסִים וְיוֹשְׁבִים לִפְנֵי אֲבִיהֶם וַאֲחוֹרֵיהֶם כְּלַפֵּי הָעָם. בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם דַּעַת לִשְׁמוֹעַ – נִכְנָסִים וְיוֹשְׁבִים לִפְנֵי אֲבִיהֶם וּפְנֵיהֶם כְּלַפֵּי הַעָם. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי [צָדוֹק] אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה עוֹשִׂים אוֹתָם סְנִיפִין.
human_translation: When they have the wisdom to hear the sons of Torah scholars, whose fathers are appointed as leaders of the congregation, enter and sit before their fathers, and their backs toward the people. When they do not have the wisdom to hear they enter and sit before their fathers, and their faces toward the people, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: Even at party one renders them attachments [ senifin ]
llm_translation: Sons of disciples of sages who are supported by their fathers, the community sustains them, when they have the capacity to study - they enter and sit before their fathers, and their backs to the people. When they do not have the capacity to study - they enter and sit before their fathers, and their faces to the people. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: Even at a banquet, they make these distinctions.

hebrew_text: [אָמַר מָר] יָצָא לְצוֹרֶךְ – נִכְנָס וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּמְקוֹמוֹ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא לִקְטַנִּים, אֲבָל לִגְדוֹלִים – לָא, הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִבְדַּק נַפְשֵׁיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לְעוֹלָם יְלַמֵּד אָדָם עַצְמוֹ לְהַשְׁכִּים וּלְהַעֲרִיב, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִתְרַחֵק. אָמַר רָבָא: הָאִידָּנָא דַּחֲלַשׁא עָלְמָא – אֲפִילּוּ לִגְדוֹלִים נָמֵי.
human_translation: The Master said: left for purpose he may enter and sit in his place. Rav Pappa said: said only for minor But for major no, he should have examined himself initially as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: A person should always accustom himself to in the morning and in the evening so that he will not distance himself Rava said: Today, when the world is weak even for major
llm_translation: Master said he went out for a need - he enters and sits in his place. Rav Papa said: They only said this for minors, but for adults - no, as it would be a danger to his life from the outset. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A person should always train himself to wake up early and stay up late, so that he does not distance himself. Rava said: In this generation that is weak - even for adults too.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר רַבִּי [צָדוֹק] אוֹמֵר: אַף בְּבֵית הַמִּשְׁתֶּה עוֹשִׂים אוֹתָם סְנִיפִים. אָמַר רָבָא: בְּחַיֵּי אֲבִיהֶם בִּפְנֵי אֲבִיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: Even at party one renders them attachments. Rava said: during the lifetime of their fathers and in the presence of their fathers.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: Even in the house of feasting, they make them branches. Rava said: By the life of their fathers in the presence of their fathers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּימֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל נִישְׁנֵית מִשְׁנָה זוֹ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל נָשִׂיא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר חָכָם, רַבִּי נָתָן אַב בֵּית דִּין. כִּי הֲוָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הָתָם, הֲווֹ קָיְימִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִקַּמֵּיהּ. כִּי הֲווֹ עָיְילִי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי נָתָן, הֲווֹ קָיְימִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִקַּמַּיְיהוּ. אָמַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: לָא בָּעוּ לְמִיהְוֵי הֶיכֵּרָא בֵּין דִּילִי לְדִידְהוּ? תַּקֵּין הָא מַתְנִיתָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: This mishna, was taught during the days of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel Nasi , Rabbi Meir Ḥakham , Rabbi Natan deputy Nasi . When Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel was there, everyone would arise before him. When Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Natan would enter, everyone would arise before them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Shouldn’t there be a conspicuous distinction between me and them instituted this baraita
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In the days of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, this Mishnah was revised. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel was the Nasi, Rabbi Meir was the sage, and Rabbi Nathan was the head of the court. When Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel was there, all the generations were established before him. When Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Nathan were there, all the generations were established before them. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said: Did they not want to distinguish between my judgment and theirs? The Mishnah was corrected.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא יוֹמָא לָא הֲווֹ רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי נָתָן הָתָם, לִמְחַר כִּי אֲתוֹ חֲזוֹ דְּלָא קָמוּ מִקַּמַּיְיהוּ כְּדִרְגִילָא מִילְּתָא, אָמְרִי: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַרוּ לְהוּ: הָכִי תַּקֵּין רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: That day, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Natan were not there. The following day when they came they saw that did not stand before them as the matter was typically They said: What is this? said to them: This Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel instituted.
llm_translation: On that day, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Nathan were not there. The next day, when they saw that they did not come before them as usual, they said: What is this? They were told: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel has arranged it thus.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר לְרַבִּי נָתָן: אֲנָא חָכָם וְאַתְּ אַב בֵּית דִּין, נְתַקֵּין מִילְּתָא כִּי לְדִידַן. מַאי נַעֲבֵיד לֵיהּ? נֵימָא לֵיהּ: גַּלִּי עוּקְצִים, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ. וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא גְּמִר, נֵימָא לֵיהּ: ״מִי יְמַלֵּל גְּבוּרוֹת ה׳ יַשְׁמִיעַ כׇּל תְּהִלָּתוֹ״, לְמִי נָאֶה לְמַלֵּל גְּבוּרוֹת ה׳ – מִי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְהַשְׁמִיעַ כׇּל תְּהִלּוֹתָיו. נְעַבְּרֵיהּ, וְהָוֵי אֲנָא אַב בֵּית דִּין וְאַתְּ נָשִׂיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said to Rabbi Natan: I am Ḥakham and you are deputy Nasi . Let us devise a matter as he did to us. What shall we do to him? Let us say to him: Reveal Okatzim , which he does not And once that he did not learn, we will say to him: “Who can express the mighty acts of the Lord, shall make all His praises heard?” For whom is it becoming to express the mighty acts of the Lord? one who is capable of making all His praises heard, We will remove him and I will be deputy Nasi and you Nasi .
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Meir to Rabbi Nathan: I am a sage and you are the head of the court, let us establish the matter according to our opinion. What should we do with him? Let us say to him: Reveal the thorns, for he has none. And once he does not finish, let us say to him: "Who can speak of the mighty deeds of the Lord, can make all His praises heard." To whom is it fitting to speak of the mighty deeds of the Lord - one who is able to make all His praises heard. Let us pass him over, and I will be the head of the court and you the president.

hebrew_text: שַׁמְעִינְהוּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בֶּן קֻדְשַׁי, אֲמַר: דִּלְמָא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם אָתְיָא מִלְּתָא לִידֵי כִּיסּוּפָא, אֲזַל יְתֵיב אֲחוֹרֵי עִילִּיתֵיהּ דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, פְּשַׁט, גְּרַס וּתְנָא, גְּרַס וּתְנָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov ben Korshei heard them said: Perhaps, Heaven forfend, matter come to humiliation he went sat behind the upper story Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel He explained he studied and repeated studied and repeated
llm_translation: Listen to him, Rabbi Yaakov ben Kudshai, said: Perhaps a matter of deception and peace comes through, he went and sat behind the upper chamber of Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, he interpreted, read, and taught, he interpreted and taught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: מַאי דְּקַמָּא? דִּלְמָא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם אִיכָּא בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא מִידֵּי, יְהַב דַּעְתֵּיהּ וְגַרְסַהּ. לִמְחַר אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: נֵיתֵי מָר וְנִיתְנֵי בְּעוּקְצִין, פְּתַח וַאֲמַר. בָּתַר דְּאוֹקֵים, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי לָא גְּמִירְנָא, כַּסֵּיפְיתֻּנַן.
human_translation: said What that before us? Perhaps, Heaven forfend, there is something the study hall. He concentrated and studied The following said to him: Let the Master come and teach in Okatzin . He began and stated After he completed he said to them: If I had not studied you humiliated me.
llm_translation: He said: What is the reason for the first statement? Perhaps there is peace and tranquility in the study hall, he gave his opinion and expounded. The next day they said to him: "Master, let us place you in restraints," he began and said. After they arose, he said to them: "If we have not completed our study, you have cut us off."

hebrew_text: פַּקֵּיד וְאַפְּקִינְהוּ מִבֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. הֲווֹ כָּתְבִי קוּשְׁיָיתָא [בְּפִתְקָא] וְשָׁדוּ הָתָם. דַּהֲוָה מִיפְּרִיק – מִיפְּרִיק, דְּלָא הֲווֹ מִיפְּרִיק – כָּתְבִי פֵּירוּקֵי וְשָׁדוּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: תּוֹרָה מִבַּחוּץ וְאָנוּ מִבִּפְנִים?
human_translation: commanded and they expelled from the study hall would write difficulties on a scrap of paper [ pitka ] and would throw there that were resolved were resolved; that were not resolved, wrote resolutions and threw Rabbi Yosei said to Torah, is outside and we are inside?
llm_translation: Appoint and I will appoint him from the study hall. They wrote a question on a parchment and placed it there. If he was able to explain - he explained, if he was not able to explain - they wrote the answers and placed them. Rabbi Yosei said to them: Is the Torah from the outside and we from the inside?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶן רַבָּן [שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן] גַּמְלִיאֵל: נִיעַיְּילִינְהוּ, מִיהוּ נִיקְנְסִינְהוּ דְּלָא נֵימְרוּ שְׁמַעְתָּא מִשְּׁמַיְיהוּ. אַסִּיקוּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אֲחֵרִים, וּלְרַבִּי נָתָן יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים. אַחְווֹ לְהוּ בְּחֶלְמַיְיהוּ: זִילוּ פַּיְּיסוּהוּ [לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל], רַבִּי נָתָן אֲזַל, רַבִּי מֵאִיר לָא אֲזַל, אֲמַר: דִּבְרֵי חֲלוֹמוֹת לֹא מַעֲלִין וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין. כִּי אֲזַל רַבִּי נָתָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: נְהִי דְּאַהֲנִי לָךְ קַמְרָא דַּאֲבוּךְ לְמֶהֱוֵי אַב בֵּית דִּין, שַׁוִּינָיךְ נָמֵי נָשִׂיא?!
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to them: Let us admit them But we will penalize them that we will not cite halakha in their names. They cited of Rabbi Meir Aḥerim , and of Rabbi Natan yesh omerim , were shown in their dreams: Go, appease Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. Rabbi Natan went. Rabbi Meir did not go. He said Matters of dreams are insignificant. When Rabbi Natan went, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to him: Although the belt, of your father was effective to become deputy Nasi , will it render you Nasi as well?
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: Let us go and bring them in, so that they do not say that the tradition was not heard from their mouths. They brought it to Rabbi Meir and others, and to Rabbi Nathan some say. They said to him in their dreams: Go and appease him Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, Rabbi Nathan went, Rabbi Meir did not go, he said: The words of dreams do not raise up and do not bring down. When Rabbi Nathan went, he said to him, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: Since I have made you a father of the court, should I also make you a prince?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרֵיהּ, אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: אִילּוּ הָיָה תְּמוּרָה
human_translation: Rabbi taught Rabban Shimon his son Aḥerim say: If it was a substitute,
llm_translation: He taught him, Rabbi to Rabban Shimon his son, others say: "If it were an exchange."

hebrew_text: לֹא הָיָה קָרֵב. אָמַר לוֹ: מִי הֵם הַלָּלוּ שֶׁמֵּימֵיהֶם אָנוּ שׁוֹתִים וּשְׁמוֹתָם אֵין אָנוּ מַזְכִּירִים? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁבִּקְּשׁוּ לַעֲקוֹר כְּבוֹדְךָ וּכְבוֹד בֵּית אָבִיךָ.
human_translation: it would not be sacrificed. said to him: Who are these whose water we drink but whose names we do not mention? said to him: people who sought to abolish your honor and the honor of your father’s house.
llm_translation: He was not close. He said to him: Who are these people whose waters we drink and whose names we do not mention? He said to him: Human beings who sought to uproot Your honor and the honor of Your Father's house.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״גַּם אַהֲבָתָם גַּם שִׂנְאָתָם גַּם קִנְאָתָם כְּבָר אָבָדָה״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הָאוֹיֵב תַּמּוּ חֳרָבוֹת לָנֶצַח״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנֵי מִלֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאַהֲנוֹ מַעֲשַׂיְיהוּ, רַבָּנַן לָא אַהֲנוֹ מַעֲשַׂיְיהוּ! הֲדַר אַתְנִי לֵיהּ, אָמְרוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִילּוּ הָיָה תְּמוּרָה לֹא הָיָה קָרֵב. אָמַר רָבָא: אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי דְּעִנְוְותָנָא הוּא (תְּנָא), ״אָמְרוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר״. ״אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר״ לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: said to him, “Their love as well as their hatred and their envy is long ago perished” said to him: “The enemy are come to an end; the wasted places are forever” said to These matters where their actions were effective. Sages, their actions were not effective. then taught him: said in the name of Rabbi Meir: If it was a substitute, it would not be sacrificed. Rava said: Even Rabbi who is humble, taught: said in the name of Rabbi Meir. he did not say Rabbi Meir said.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Their love, their hatred, and their jealousy have already perished!" He said to him: "The enemy will come to an end forever." He said to him: "These words, where they enjoy the fruits of their labor, the Rabbis do not enjoy the fruits of their labor!" He then repeated it to him, they said in the name of Rabbi Meir: If there had been a substitute, he would not have come close. Rava said: Even if Rabbi De'anvatan (a Tanna) himself had said it, "they said in the name of Rabbi Meir." "Rabbi Meir said" he did not say.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פְּלִיגוּ בַּהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וְרַבָּנַן, חַד אָמַר: סִינַי עֲדִיף, וְחַד אָמַר: עוֹקֵר הָרִים עֲדִיף.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis disagreed with regard to this One said: Sinai, is preferable; and one said: uproots mountains, is preferable.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel and the Rabbis disagree about it. One said: Sinai is preferable, and one said: Uprooting mountains is preferable.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף סִינַי, רַבָּה עוֹקֵר הָרִים. שְׁלַחוּ לְתַמָּן: אֵיזֶה מֵהֶם קוֹדֵם? שְׁלַחוּ לְהוּ: סִינַי עֲדִיף, דְּאָמַר מָר: הַכֹּל צְרִיכִין לְמָרֵי חִטַּיָּא, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא קַבֵּיל רַב יוֹסֵף עֲלֵיהּ. מְלַךְ רַבָּה עֶשְׂרִין וְתַרְתֵּי שְׁנִין, וַהֲדַר מְלַךְ רַב יוֹסֵף. וְכֹל שְׁנֵי דִּמְלַךְ רַבָּה, רַב יוֹסֵף אֲפִילּוּ אוּמָּנָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ לָא (חֲלֵיף).
human_translation: Rav Yosef Sinai; Rabba uproots mountains. They sent to there, Which takes precedence? They sent Sinai is preferable, as the Master said: Everyone requires the owner of the wheat, And even so, Rav Yosef did not accept upon himself Rabba reigned for twenty-two years, and then Rav Yosef reigned. all those years that Rabba presided, did not even call a bloodletter to his home.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef of Sinai, Rabba the mountain uprooter. They sent to Taman: Which of them is superior? They sent to Hu: Sinai is superior, as the Master said: All require the approval of the masters of wheat, yet Rav Yosef did not accept it. Rabba reigned for twenty-two years, then Rav Yosef reigned. And all the years that Rabba reigned, Rav Yosef did not even turn as a craftsman to his house.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא וְרַבִּי זֵירָא וְרַבָּה בַּר מַתְנָה הֲווֹ יָתְבִי וַהֲווֹ צְרִיכִי רֵישָׁא, אָמְרִי: כֹּל דְּאָמַר מִלְּתָא וְלָא מִפְּרִיךְ, לֶהֱוֵי רֵישָׁא. דְּכוּלְּהוּ אִיפְּרִיךְ, דְּאַבָּיֵי לָא אִיפְּרִיךְ. חַזְיֵיהּ רַבָּה לְאַבָּיֵי דִּגְבַהּ רֵישֵׁאּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נַחְמָנִי, פְּתַח וְאֵימָא.
human_translation: Abaye, Rava, Rabbi Zeira, and Rabba bar Mattana were sitting and were in need a head They said: Let anyone who will say a matter is not refuted be head. Everyone’s were refuted, of Abaye was not refuted. Rabba saw that Abaye raised his head, said to him: Naḥmani, begin and say
llm_translation: Abaye, Rava, Rabbi Zeira, and Rabba bar Matna were sitting, and they needed a leader. They said: Anyone who states a matter without being refuted, let him be the leader. Since Abaye was never refuted, Rabba saw that Abaye was of superior intellect, and said to him: "Comfort me, open and say."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי זֵירָא וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב מַתְנָה הֵי מִנַּיְיהוּ עֲדִיף? רַבִּי זֵירָא חָרִיף וּמַקְשֶׁה, וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב מַתְנָה מָתוּן וּמַסֵּיק, מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Rabbi Zeira and Rabba bar Rav Mattana, which of them is preferable? Rabbi Zeira is incisive and raises difficulties, and Rabba bar Rav Mattana is moderate but he draws conclusions. What shall stand
llm_translation: The question was asked: Is Rabbi Zeira or Rabba bar Rav Mattana preferable? Rabbi Zeira is sharp and difficult, and Rabba bar Rav Mattana is clever and conclusive. What is the resolution? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ, וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת הוֹרָיוֹת.
llm_translation: We will return to you, O anointed priest, and go up with her to the tractate of her teachings.
